4:00pm, Sunday 26th July 2020._Arsenal_W.news: Arsenal 3-2 Watford: Hornets relegated despite fightback
4:00pm, Sunday 26th July 2020._Arsenal_W.response: A valiant Watford fightback was not enough to save them from relegation to the Sky Bet Championship as Arsenal clung on to secure a 3-2 win at the Emirates Stadium.
4:00pm, Sunday 26th July 2020._Arsenal_W.detail: Watford went into the final day knowing they needed to better Aston Villa's result at West Ham to have a realistic chance of survival, but they fell behind to an early penalty from Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang, who then scored his second goal after Kieran Tierney had doubled Arsenal's lead.

4:00pm, Sunday 26th July 2020._Burnley_B.news: Burnley 1-2 Brighton: Seagulls set Premier League club record
4:00pm, Sunday 26th July 2020._Burnley_B.response: Brighton produced a solid 2-1 win over Burnley at Turf Moor on Sunday to set a new club-record points haul in the Premier League.
4:00pm, Sunday 26th July 2020._Burnley_B.detail: The game started with a sluggish tempo and disjointed possession as Burnley looked to maintain their solid defensive line and help goalkeeper Nick Pope record his 16th clean sheet of the campaign to claim the Golden Glove.

4:00pm, Sunday 26th July 2020._Chelsea_W.news: Chelsea 2-0 Wolves: Champions League finish for Frank Lampard's side as Wolves must wait
4:00pm, Sunday 26th July 2020._Chelsea_W.response: Chelsea secured the result they needed in beating Wolves 2-0 at Stamford Bridge to finish fourth in the Premier League and qualify for next season's Champions League.
4:00pm, Sunday 26th July 2020._Chelsea_W.detail: Two goals in first-half stoppage time by Mason Mount and Olivier Giroud took the game away from Wolves, who will have to wait to find out whether their seventh-place finish will be enough for Europa League football next season.

4:00pm, Sunday 26th July 2020._Crystal P.news: Crystal Palace 1-1 Tottenham: Harry Kane's strike seals European football
4:00pm, Sunday 26th July 2020._Crystal P.response: Tottenham guaranteed Europa League football for next season by finishing sixth in the Premier League despite a 1-1 draw with Crystal Palace on the final day of the season.
4:00pm, Sunday 26th July 2020._Crystal P.detail: Starting the day one point behind Wolves, Spurs made the perfect start when they went ahead in the 13th minute through Harry Kane's low strike.

4:00pm, Sunday 26th July 2020._Everton_B.news: Everton 1-3 Bournemouth: Cherries relegated despite win at Goodison Park
4:00pm, Sunday 26th July 2020._Everton_B.response: Bournemouth's five-year stay in the Premier League is over despite a valiant effort on the final day as their 3-1 victory at Everton was not enough to avoid relegation.
4:00pm, Sunday 26th July 2020._Everton_B.detail: Joshua King's penalty put the Cherries ahead (13) before Moise Kean levelled for Everton with a simple tap-in four minutes before the interval.

4:00pm, Sunday 26th July 2020._Leicester.news: Leicester 0-2 Manchester United: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's side finish third after final-day showdown
4:00pm, Sunday 26th July 2020._Leicester.response: Manchester United confirmed their place in the top four with a 2-0 win at Leicester City, meaning Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's side finish third in the Premier League.
4:00pm, Sunday 26th July 2020._Leicester.detail: In a final-day shootout with Brendan Rodgers' side at the King Power Stadium, where the winners would guarantee Champions League football next season, nerves were on show until Bruno Fernandes settled the visitors down from the penalty spot (71) after Anthony Martial was taken down by Jonny Evans and Wes Morgan.

4:00pm, Sunday 26th July 2020._Mancheste.news: Manchester City 5-0 Norwich: David Silva signs off in Canaries thrashing
4:00pm, Sunday 26th July 2020._Mancheste.response: David Silva captained Manchester City to a 5-0 final-day thrashing of relegated Norwich on his final Premier League appearance for the club.
4:00pm, Sunday 26th July 2020._Mancheste.detail: First-half goals from Gabriel Jesus and Kevin de Bruyne set Manchester City on course to victory, but things could have been different had Onel Hernandez's opener not been ruled out by VAR before Teemu Pukki spurned the Canaries' best chance.

4:00pm, Sunday 26th July 2020._Newcastle.news: Newcastle 1-3 Liverpool: Premier League champions sign off with away-day victory
4:00pm, Sunday 26th July 2020._Newcastle.response: Liverpool signed off their Premier League title-winning season with a 3-1 victory at Newcastle, coming from behind after Dwight Gayle's goal inside 26 seconds.
4:00pm, Sunday 26th July 2020._Newcastle.detail: Steve Bruce's side had just three shots during the game but one of them came almost immediately after kick off as Gayle (1) swept the ball home around the oncoming Alisson. There was a lengthy VAR check for offside, but it was soon confirmed that the goal would stand.

4:00pm, Sunday 26th July 2020._Southampt.news: Southampton 3-1 Sheffield United: Danny Ings misses out on Golden Boot despite penalty in comeback win
4:00pm, Sunday 26th July 2020._Southampt.response: A Danny Ings penalty was not enough to earn him the Golden Boot as Southampton signed off with a 3-1 comeback win over Sheffield United.
4:00pm, Sunday 26th July 2020._Southampt.detail: The Blades' superb first-half performance earned them a richly-deserved half-time lead through John Lundstram's smart finish when Southampton failed to defend Billy Sharp's cross (26).

4:00pm, Sunday 26th July 2020._West Ham.news: West Ham 1-1 Aston Villa: Villa secure Premier League survival despite late scare
4:00pm, Sunday 26th July 2020._West Ham.response: Aston Villa avoided Premier League relegation by just a single point after their 1-1 draw with West Ham.
4:00pm, Sunday 26th July 2020._West Ham.detail: It seemed an impossibility just a fortnight ago, but Dean Smith's side stayed up after Watford lost 3-2 at Arsenal, while Bournemouth are down despite their 3-1 win at Bournemouth.

6:00pm, Wednesday 22nd July 2020._Manche.news: Manchester United 1-1 West Ham: Hosts into Champions League places as Hammers secure safety
6:00pm, Wednesday 22nd July 2020._Manche.response: Manchester United moved into the Champions League places after a 1-1 draw with West Ham, setting up a European showdown with Leicester on the final day of the season.
6:00pm, Wednesday 22nd July 2020._Manche.detail: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's side had to come from behind to secure a point at Old Trafford and it was a bizarre incident that gave West Ham the lead at the end of the first half.

8:15pm, Wednesday 22nd July 2020._Liverp.news: Liverpool 5-3 Chelsea: Champions make Chelsea wait to secure top-four finish after title-party thriller
8:15pm, Wednesday 22nd July 2020._Liverp.response: Liverpool got their Premier League trophy-lift party started on the pitch with a thrilling 5-3 win over Chelsea at Anfield, meaning the Blues' top-four hopes go to the final day.
8:15pm, Wednesday 22nd July 2020._Liverp.detail: A draw would have secured Champions League football next season for Chelsea, but they capitulated in the first half as Liverpool got the party started early through Naby Keita's stunner (23), Trent Alexander-Arnold's fine free-kick (38) and Gini Wijnaldum's volley (43).

6:00pm, Tuesday 21st July 2020._Watford_.news: Watford 0-4 Man City: Raheem Sterling double deepens Hornets' relegation fears
6:00pm, Tuesday 21st July 2020._Watford_.response: Raheem Sterling scored twice to deepen managerless Watford's relegation fears as Manchester City recorded a resounding 4-0 win at Vicarage Road.
6:00pm, Tuesday 21st July 2020._Watford_.detail: Sterling's first-half double put City in control, with his superb opener (31) added to when he slotted home the rebound after Ben Foster saved his initial penalty (40).

8:15pm, Tuesday 21st July 2020._Aston Vi.news: Aston Villa 1-0 Arsenal: Trezeguet winner moves Villa out of drop zone
8:15pm, Tuesday 21st July 2020._Aston Vi.response: Aston Villa took a giant leap towards Premier League safety as Trezeguet's goal took them out of the bottom three with a vital 1-0 win over Arsenal at Villa Park.
8:15pm, Tuesday 21st July 2020._Aston Vi.detail: Villa were boosted before kick-off by relegation rivals Watford's 4-0 defeat by Manchester City, and the positivity continued as Trezeguet scored his third goal in three games, lashing home at the far post from a corner (27).

6:00pm, Monday 20th July 2020._Brighton.news: Brighton 0-0 Newcastle: Goalless draw ensures Seagulls stay in Premier League
6:00pm, Monday 20th July 2020._Brighton.response: Brighton sealed their Premier League status for another season with a drab 0-0 draw against Newcastle on Monday evening.
6:00pm, Monday 20th July 2020._Brighton.detail: Graham Potter's side needed just one point to be safe from relegation going into the fixture but their status was already virtually secure and their contest with their injury-hit visitors lacked rhythm on a warm, sunny evening by the seaside.

6:00pm, Monday 20th July 2020._Sheffield.news: Sheffield United 0-1 Everton: Richarlison header ends Blades' dreams of Europa League
6:00pm, Monday 20th July 2020._Sheffield.response: A Richarlison header 57 seconds after half-time gave Everton a 1-0 win at Sheffield United to end their hopes of Europa League qualification.
6:00pm, Monday 20th July 2020._Sheffield.detail: The Blades' defeat left them hoping Crystal Palace would do them a favour in the race for Europe at Wolves later on Monday night, but the hosts' 2-0 win at Molineux ensured Chris Wilder's men can no longer catch the Black Country side.

8:15pm, Monday 20th July 2020._Wolverham.news: Wolves 2-0 Crystal Palace: Daniel Podence, Jonny goals close hosts in on top-seven finish
8:15pm, Monday 20th July 2020._Wolverham.response: Goals from Daniel Podence and Jonny put Wolves on the brink of a European spot with a 2-0 win over Crystal Palace at Molineux.
8:15pm, Monday 20th July 2020._Wolverham.detail: Podence's first goal in Wolves colours minutes before the interval set the hosts on their way, crafted by a Joao Moutinho lofted pass into Matt Doherty, who squared for the January signing to nod home unmarked from four yards.

2:00pm, Sunday 19th July 2020._Bournemou.news: Bournemouth 0-2 Southampton: Late VAR drama leaves Cherries on the brink
2:00pm, Sunday 19th July 2020._Bournemou.response: Bournemouth are on the brink of Premier League relegation following their 2-0 defeat by Southampton at the Vitality Stadium after the Cherries' had a last-gasp equaliser ruled out by VAR.
2:00pm, Sunday 19th July 2020._Bournemou.detail: After Ings had put Southampton ahead in the first half, sub Sam Surridge saw a 94th-minute leveller chalked off by VAR as Callum Wilson was correctly adjudged offside.

4:00pm, Sunday 19th July 2020._Tottenham.news: Tottenham 3-0 Leicester: Clinical Harry Kane display sets up final-day showdown for Foxes
4:00pm, Sunday 19th July 2020._Tottenham.response: A Harry Kane masterclass saw Tottenham beat Leicester 3-0 and pile yet more pressure on the Foxes' Champions League hopes.
4:00pm, Sunday 19th July 2020._Tottenham.detail: James Justin deflected Heung-Min Son's effort past Kasper Schmeichel inside six minutes in a nightmare start for the visitors, before Leicester responded with Hugo Lloris at his best to keep out a Jamie Vardy backheel and Ayoze Perez's control and finish.

5:30pm, Saturday 18th July 2020._Norwich.news: Norwich 0-2 Burnley: Two red cards as Burnley keep up Europa League charge
5:30pm, Saturday 18th July 2020._Norwich.response: Norwich had two players sent off as a Chris Wood strike and a Ben Godfrey own goal kept Burnley in European contention with a 2-0 win at Carrow Road.
5:30pm, Saturday 18th July 2020._Norwich.detail: The relegated Canaries, who had come close to frustrating Chelsea at Stamford Bridge earlier in the week, started encouragingly but shot themselves in the foot when Emi Buendia was dismissed by VAR for aiming an elbow at Ashley Westwood (36), before Josip Drmic followed him down the tunnel for a late challenge on Erik Pieters (45).

8:00pm, Friday 17th July 2020._West Ham.news: West Ham 3-1 Watford: Hammers close in on Premier League safety
8:00pm, Friday 17th July 2020._West Ham.response: West Ham turned on the style in the first half to secure a 3-1 victory over relegation-rivals Watford to all but seal their Premier League status for next season.
8:00pm, Friday 17th July 2020._West Ham.detail: The Hammers - who started the day level on points with Watford, three above the relegation zone - burst out of the traps, stunning the visitors as goals from Michail Antonio (6) and Tomas Soucek (10) saw them race into the lead, before Declan Rice's stunning strike (36) extended that advantage before half time.

6:00pm, Thursday 16th July 2020._Everton.news: Everton 1-1 Aston Villa: Theo Walcott's late equaliser leaves Villa in relegation trouble
6:00pm, Thursday 16th July 2020._Everton.response: Theo Walcott punished Anwar El Ghazi's glaring miss by scoring a late equaliser for Everton against Aston Villa in a 1-1 draw at Goodison Park which leaves the visitors deep in relegation trouble.
6:00pm, Thursday 16th July 2020._Everton.detail: Ezri Konsa had given Villa the lead (72), diverting home Conor Hourihane's free-kick, but, after El Ghazi failed to turn home Jack Grealish's cross from two yards out, Walcott's looping header (88) denied Villa a crucial win.

6:00pm, Thursday 16th July 2020._Leicest.news: Leicester 2-0 Sheffield United: Foxes reignite Champions League hopes with victory
6:00pm, Thursday 16th July 2020._Leicest.response: Leicester reignited their hopes for a Champions League place with a 2-0 win against Sheffield United, who themselves missed the chance to go into sixth.
6:00pm, Thursday 16th July 2020._Leicest.detail: The Foxes needed a reaction after a disastrous second-half collapse against Bournemouth on Sunday and looked much improved from the get-go, with Ayoze Perez turning home from teenage debutant Luke Thomas' cross in the 29th minute.

8:15pm, Thursday 16th July 2020._Crystal.news: Crystal Palace 0-2 Manchester United: VAR frustrates Palace as United triumph
8:15pm, Thursday 16th July 2020._Crystal.response: Manchester United know two more wins from their final two games will be enough for a top-four finish in the Premier League after beating Crystal Palace 2-0, with the help of VAR.
8:15pm, Thursday 16th July 2020._Crystal.detail: Goals from Marcus Rashford (45+1) and Anthony Martial (78) at Selhurst Park took them back level on points with fourth-placed Leicester City, who are set to play United on the final day.

8:15pm, Thursday 16th July 2020._Southam.news: Southampton 1-1 Brighton: Danny Ings reaches 20 league goals for season
8:15pm, Thursday 16th July 2020._Southam.response: Danny Ings' 20th league goal of the season denied Brighton mathematical Premier League safety with a 1-1 draw at Southampton.
8:15pm, Thursday 16th July 2020._Southam.detail: Neal Maupay had taken advantage of some sleepy Saints defending to fire Brighton ahead after 17 minutes, with the Seagulls knowing three points would secure their Premier League survival with two games to go.

6:00pm, Wednesday 15th July 2020._Burnle.news: Burnley 1-1 Wolves: Chris Wood scores 96th-minute penalty to secure Clarets point
6:00pm, Wednesday 15th July 2020._Burnle.response: Chris Wood's 96th-minute penalty secured a 1-1 draw for Burnley to dent Wolves' Champions League hopes.
6:00pm, Wednesday 15th July 2020._Burnle.detail: Adama Traore combined with Matt Doherty for the game's opening goal as the Republic of Ireland full-back's shot deflected off James Tarkowski and landed perfectly for Raul Jimenez to volley beyond Nick Pope in the 76th minute.

6:00pm, Wednesday 15th July 2020._Manche.news: Man City 2-1 Bournemouth: David Silva and Gabriel Jesus edge Cherries towards drop
6:00pm, Wednesday 15th July 2020._Manche.response: David Silva provided a masterclass as he heads towards his Premier League swansong in Manchester City's 2-1 win over Bournemouth, which edged the plucky Cherries closer to Premier League relegation.
6:00pm, Wednesday 15th July 2020._Manche.detail: Silva fired a sixth-minute free-kick in off the bar to leave Aaron Ramsdale with no chance of keeping out a superb opener, before feeding Gabriel Jesus, on his 100th Premier League appearance, to double City's advantage with a lovely turn and finish shortly before half-time (39).

6:00pm, Wednesday 15th July 2020._Newcas.news: Newcastle 1-3 Tottenham: Harry Kane brings up 200 club career goals in important win
6:00pm, Wednesday 15th July 2020._Newcas.response: Harry Kane's double took him past 200 club career goals as Tottenham earned a hard-fought 3-1 win at Newcastle to keep their Europa League qualifying hopes alive.
6:00pm, Wednesday 15th July 2020._Newcas.detail: Spurs weren't at their best and, following Heung-Min Son's first-half opener (27), Matt Ritchie (56) deservedly pulled Newcastle level with a powerful strike.

8:15pm, Wednesday 15th July 2020._Arsena.news: Arsenal 2-1 Liverpool: Virgil van Dijk and Alisson Becker errors gift Gunners win
8:15pm, Wednesday 15th July 2020._Arsena.response: Virgil van Dijk and Alisson Becker errors gifted Arsenal a 2-1 victory as Liverpool's hopes of breaking the Premier League points record were dashed.
8:15pm, Wednesday 15th July 2020._Arsena.detail: Sadio Mane looked to have set the champions on course for one of the three victories they needed to surpass Manchester City's record 100-point haul with the opener on 20 minutes at the Emirates.

8:15pm, Tuesday 14th July 2020._Chelsea_.news: Chelsea 1-0 Norwich: Olivier Giroud header puts Chelsea in Champions League control
8:15pm, Tuesday 14th July 2020._Chelsea_.response: Chelsea tightened their grip on a Champions League spot as Olivier Giroud's header gave them a 1-0 win over relegated Norwich.
8:15pm, Tuesday 14th July 2020._Chelsea_.detail: Giroud's header moments before half-time, against an unusually resolute Norwich defence, ensured Frank Lampard's side returned to winning ways after their dire defeat at Sheffield United last weekend.

8:00pm, Monday 13th July 2020._Mancheste.news: Manchester United 2-2 Southampton: Late Saints equaliser denies United move into top four
8:00pm, Monday 13th July 2020._Mancheste.response: Manchester United missed the chance to move into the top four after conceding a 96th-minute equaliser in a 2-2 draw against Southampton.
8:00pm, Monday 13th July 2020._Mancheste.detail: After big defeats for Chelsea and Leicester at the weekend, Manchester United were presented with the perfect opportunity to move into the Champions League places, but went behind early on when Stuart Armstrong rifled home (12).

12:00pm, Sunday 12th July 2020._Wolverha.news: Wolves 3-0 Everton: Hosts maintain push for Europe
12:00pm, Sunday 12th July 2020._Wolverha.response: Wolves brushed aside Everton 3-0 at Molineux on Sunday with new boy Daniel Podence shining on his first Premier League start for Nuno Espirito Santo's side.
12:00pm, Sunday 12th July 2020._Wolverha.detail: ​​​​​​The Portuguese, who joined the club from Olympiakos in January, was brought down for a penalty which Raul Jimenez converted for his 25th goal in all competitions this season just before the break.

2:15pm, Sunday 12th July 2020._Aston Vil.news: Aston Villa 2-0 Crystal Palace: Trezeguet's double gives Villa hope of survival
2:15pm, Sunday 12th July 2020._Aston Vil.response: Trezeguet's double boosted Aston Villa's hopes for survival as they won for the first time since January, beating Crystal Palace 2-0 at Villa Park.
2:15pm, Sunday 12th July 2020._Aston Vil.detail: Palace thought they had taken the lead through Mamadou Sakho early on, but VAR ruled the strike out for a handball, before Trezeguet put Villa ahead in first-half stoppage time with a finish at the far post (45+5).

4:30pm, Sunday 12th July 2020._Tottenham.news: Tottenham 2-1 Arsenal: Jose Mourinho masterclass earns north London derby spoils
4:30pm, Sunday 12th July 2020._Tottenham.response: Jose Mourinho tasted victory in his first north London derby as Tottenham came from behind to beat Arsenal 2-1 on Sunday.
4:30pm, Sunday 12th July 2020._Tottenham.detail: Toby Alderweireld's 81st-minute header claimed a vital three points for Spurs' European push in their first encounter with their rivals at the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium.

7:00pm, Sunday 12th July 2020._Bournemou.news: Bournemouth 4-1 Leicester: Eddie Howe's side boost survival hopes with second-half comeback
7:00pm, Sunday 12th July 2020._Bournemou.response: Bournemouth kept their Premier League survival hopes alive after coming from behind to beat Champions League-chasing Leicester 4-1 at the Vitality Stadium.
7:00pm, Sunday 12th July 2020._Bournemou.detail: Jamie Vardy's first-half strike (23) had put Leicester on course for all three points but a bizarre passage of play in the second half saw Bournemouth turn the game completely on its head.

12:30pm, Saturday 11th July 2020._Norwic.news: Norwich 0-4 West Ham: Michail Antonio scores four goals as Canaries relegated
12:30pm, Saturday 11th July 2020._Norwic.response: Michail Antonio produced a sensational performance for West Ham as he scored every goal in a 4-0 win against Norwich, condemning them to relegation.
12:30pm, Saturday 11th July 2020._Norwic.detail: The forward began his incredible scoring spree in the 11th minute, firing home from close range after a corner, and added another from at set-piece just before the break, nodding home a Mark Noble free-kick (45+1).

12:30pm, Saturday 11th July 2020._Watfor.news: Watford 2-1 Newcastle: Troy Deeney at the double from the spot to steer Hornets towards safety
12:30pm, Saturday 11th July 2020._Watfor.response: Watford took a significant step towards Premier League survival as two Troy Deeney penalties helped them come from behind to beat Newcastle 2-1 at Vicarage Road.
12:30pm, Saturday 11th July 2020._Watfor.detail: Dwight Gayle gave the visitors the lead when he steered home from close range (23) but the hosts improved after the restart as Kiko Femenia was brought down inside the box by Matt Ritchie, allowing Deeney to level (52).

3:00pm, Saturday 11th July 2020._Liverpo.news: Liverpool 1-1 Burnley: Champions drop points at Anfield for first time in Premier League
3:00pm, Saturday 11th July 2020._Liverpo.response: Liverpool dropped points at Anfield for the first time in the Premier League this season as Burnley fought to a 1-1 draw against the champions.
3:00pm, Saturday 11th July 2020._Liverpo.detail: Liverpool dominated for the first hour as man-of-the-match Nick Pope made two world-class saves from Mo Salah and Sadio Mane, but they came either side of Andrew Robertson's brilliant headed opener from a Fabinho cross (34).

5:30pm, Saturday 11th July 2020._Sheffie.news: Sheffield United 3-0 Chelsea: David McGoldrick double dents Blues
5:30pm, Saturday 11th July 2020._Sheffie.response: David McGoldrick broke his Premier League duck with two goals as Sheffield United dented Champions League-chasing Chelsea with a 3-0 victory at Bramall Lane.
5:30pm, Saturday 11th July 2020._Sheffie.detail: McGoldrick benefitted from static Chelsea defending to end his 25-game wait for a top-flight goal with a close-range rebound after a Kepa Arrizabalaga save on 18 minutes.

8:00pm, Saturday 11th July 2020._Brighto.news: Brighton 0-5 Manchester City: Raheem Sterling hat-trick inspires Pep Guardiola's side
8:00pm, Saturday 11th July 2020._Brighto.response: Raheem Sterling is enjoying his best season in front of goal after his hat-trick inspired Manchester City to a 5-0 victory at Brighton.
8:00pm, Saturday 11th July 2020._Brighto.detail: The England forward got Pep Guardiola's side up and running in the 21st minute, curling an effort beyond the dive of Mat Ryan before Gabriel Jesus added City's second just before half-time (44).

6:00pm, Thursday 9th July 2020._Bournemo.news: Bournemouth 0-0 Tottenham: Last-gasp Callum Wilson strike ruled out by VAR for handball
6:00pm, Thursday 9th July 2020._Bournemo.response: Bournemouth's hopes of avoiding relegation remain in the balance after Callum Wilson's last-gasp strike was ruled out by VAR for handball in their 0-0 draw with Tottenham.
6:00pm, Thursday 9th July 2020._Bournemo.detail: The point sees Eddie Howe's side move to within three points of safety, but it could have been so much better had Wilson's overhead kick not struck the hand of Joshua King on its way into the net in the final minute of normal time.

6:00pm, Thursday 9th July 2020._Everton_.news: Everton 1-1 Southampton: Danny Ings on target as Saints held
6:00pm, Thursday 9th July 2020._Everton_.response: Danny Ings scored his 19th goal of the season but Southampton could not make their early dominance count in a 1-1 draw with Everton.
6:00pm, Thursday 9th July 2020._Everton_.detail: Saints were in the ascendancy from the first whistle and James Ward-Prowse missed a golden opportunity from the penalty spot after he was fouled by Andre Gomes.

8:15pm, Thursday 9th July 2020._Aston Vi.news: Aston Villa 0-3 Manchester United: Contentious penalty opens floodgates at Villa Park
8:15pm, Thursday 9th July 2020._Aston Vi.response: Manchester United produced another unerring attacking display to sweep struggling Aston Villa aside 3-0, but only after a contentious penalty unlocked the door at Villa Park.
8:15pm, Thursday 9th July 2020._Aston Vi.detail: Relegation-threatened Villa struck the post through Trezeguet in an encouraging opening quarter but unravelled after Ezri Konsa was harshly adjudged to have fouled Bruno Fernandes by referee Jon Moss, as United's 13th penalty this season saw them equal the Premier League record.

6:00pm, Wednesday 8th July 2020._Manches.news: Manchester City 5-0 Newcastle: David Silva shines in demolition job
6:00pm, Wednesday 8th July 2020._Manches.response: David Silva reminded onlookers of just what Manchester City will be missing next season as he starred in a 5-0 demolition job over Newcastle.
6:00pm, Wednesday 8th July 2020._Manches.detail: Silva provided the assist for Gabriel Jesus' opener (10) before Riyad Mahrez (21) and an unfortunate Federico Fernandez own goal (58) put City firmly in control.

6:00pm, Wednesday 8th July 2020._Sheffie.news: Sheffield United 1-0 Wolves: Late John Egan header keeps Blades' European dream alive
6:00pm, Wednesday 8th July 2020._Sheffie.response: John Egan's 93rd-minute winner earned Sheffield United a crucial 1-0 victory that kept their European dream alive and dented Wolves' in the process.
6:00pm, Wednesday 8th July 2020._Sheffie.detail: With seconds remaining at Bramall Lane, Egan found the net for the second game running with a towering header from Oliver Norwood's corner.

6:00pm, Wednesday 8th July 2020._West Ha.news: West Ham 0-1 Burnley: Nick Pope stars as Jay Rodriguez pushes Sean Dyche's side towards Europe
6:00pm, Wednesday 8th July 2020._West Ha.response: Burnley's hopes of European qualification were boosted by completing the double over West Ham with a 1-0 win which owed plenty to some fine goalkeeping from Nick Pope at the London Stadium.
6:00pm, Wednesday 8th July 2020._West Ha.detail: Golden glove-chasing Pope racked up his 14th clean sheet of the season with stunning stops from Tomas Soucek, Michail Antonio and sub Sebastien Haller either side of Jay Rodriguez's strike (38) as Burnley continued their excellent run of form.

8:15pm, Wednesday 8th July 2020._Brighto.news: Brighton 1-3 Liverpool: Mohamed Salah double helps Premier League champions to victory
8:15pm, Wednesday 8th July 2020._Brighto.response: Mohamed Salah scored twice for Liverpool as they beat a plucky Brighton side 3-1, ending the Premier League champions' recent scoring drought on the road.
8:15pm, Wednesday 8th July 2020._Brighto.detail: Liverpool had failed to score in their last five away games in all competitions - not winning on the road since February - but this strange run was quickly halted when Salah (6) and Jordan Henderson (8) found the net early on.

6:00pm, Tuesday 7th July 2020._Crystal P.news: Crystal Palace 2-3 Chelsea: Tammy Abraham fires visitors to hard-fought win in five-goal thriller
6:00pm, Tuesday 7th July 2020._Crystal P.response: Chelsea moved up to third in the Premier League after surviving a Crystal Palace fightback to win 3-2 at Selhurst Park.
6:00pm, Tuesday 7th July 2020._Crystal P.detail: Frank Lampard's side raced into a two-goal lead inside half an hour as Olivier Giroud's opener (6) was added to by the in-form Christian Pulisic (27) just after the drinks break.

6:00pm, Tuesday 7th July 2020._Watford_N.news: Watford 2-1 Norwich: Danny Welbeck's overhead kick boosts Hornets' survival chances
6:00pm, Tuesday 7th July 2020._Watford_N.response: Danny Welbeck's stunning overhead kick sent Norwich a step closer to relegation from the Premier League as Watford boosted their own survival chances with a 2-1 victory at Vicarage Road.
6:00pm, Tuesday 7th July 2020._Watford_N.detail: Norwich, who remain bottom of the table with only four games left to play, did take the lead in the fourth minute through Emiliano Buendia but Craig Dawson's header (10) quickly brought the scores level.

8:15pm, Tuesday 7th July 2020._Arsenal_L.news: Arsenal 1-1 Leicester: Jamie Vardy snatches late draw against 10-man Gunners
8:15pm, Tuesday 7th July 2020._Arsenal_L.response: Jamie Vardy's late goal helped Leicester to snatch a late 1-1 draw against 10-man Arsenal with VAR once again playing its part.
8:15pm, Tuesday 7th July 2020._Arsenal_L.detail: The battle for the European places was the main headline going into the game, but the sub-plot of the Golden Boot race reared its head when Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (21) slotted home to take him one goal behind current leader Vardy.

8:00pm, Monday 6th July 2020._Tottenham.news: Tottenham 1-0 Everton: Michael Keane own goal lifts Spurs to eighth
8:00pm, Monday 6th July 2020._Tottenham.response: Michael Keane's own goal gave Tottenham a scrappy 1-0 win over Everton to dent the Toffees' European hopes.
8:00pm, Monday 6th July 2020._Tottenham.detail: From point-blank range, Keane inadvertently turned Giovani Lo Celso's shot past Jordan Pickford after 24 minutes of a game lacking quality and intensity depsite both sides' European qualification hopes.

12:00pm, Sunday 5th July 2020._Burnley_S.news: Burnley 1-1 Sheffield United: Fine John Egan strike saves point for Blades
12:00pm, Sunday 5th July 2020._Burnley_S.response: John Egan's fine late equaliser saved Sheffield United a point as they drew 1-1 at Burnley in the Premier League.
12:00pm, Sunday 5th July 2020._Burnley_S.detail: Both sides had opportunities in an entertaining first half, but Burnley got the opener through defender James Tarkowski, stabbing home at the far post after Jay Rodriguez flicked on Dwight McNeil's free-kick (43).

2:15pm, Sunday 5th July 2020._Newcastle.news: Newcastle 2-2 West Ham: Miguel Almiron and Jonjo Shelvey equalisers deny Hammers win
2:15pm, Sunday 5th July 2020._Newcastle.response: Newcastle came from behind twice to deny West Ham a second successive Premier League win, with the Hammers having to settle for a 2-2 draw.
2:15pm, Sunday 5th July 2020._Newcastle.detail: Michail Antonio got the visitors off to a perfect start with a thunderous finish inside four minutes. But Newcastle reacted well and equalised 13 minutes later as Miguel Almiron (17) tapped home.

4:30pm, Sunday 5th July 2020._Liverpool_.news: Liverpool 2-0 Aston Villa: Sadio Mane & Curtis Jones keep up below-par Reds' perfect home record
4:30pm, Sunday 5th July 2020._Liverpool_.response: Sadio Mane and Curtis Jones kept up below-par Liverpool's perfect home record in their 2-0 win over struggling Aston Villa.
4:30pm, Sunday 5th July 2020._Liverpool_.detail: In their first home game since being crowned Premier League champions 10 days ago, Liverpool were fortunate to edge past their relegation-threatened visitors, who had the better of the few chances at Anfield.

7:00pm, Sunday 5th July 2020._Southampto.news: Southampton 1-0 Man City: Che Adams scores first Premier League goal to secure fine home win
7:00pm, Sunday 5th July 2020._Southampto.response: Manchester City crashed to a third successive away Premier League defeat as Che Adams' first Southampton goal secured a hard-fought 1-0 win at St Mary's.
7:00pm, Sunday 5th July 2020._Southampto.detail: It is the first time Pep Guardiola has lost three consecutive away league games in his managerial career following defeats at Manchester United and Chelsea with the goal coming on 16 minutes when Stuart Armstrong dispossessed Oleksandr Zinchenko and Adams lobbed the stranded Ederson from 35 yards.

12:30pm, Saturday 4th July 2020._Norwich.news: Norwich 0-1 Brighton: Leandro Trossard goal pushes Norwich closer to Premier League relegation
12:30pm, Saturday 4th July 2020._Norwich.response: Brighton strengthened their Premier League survival hopes while seriously denting Norwich's as they earned a narrow 1-0 win at Carrow Road.
12:30pm, Saturday 4th July 2020._Norwich.detail: Brighton scored their opener on the counter as Norwich got caught high up the pitch, Leandro Trossard deftly sweeping into the bottom-left corner from Aaron Mooy's right-wing cross (25).

3:00pm, Saturday 4th July 2020._Leiceste.news: Leicester 3-0 Crystal Palace: Jamie Vardy scores 100th PL goal as Foxes hold on to third place
3:00pm, Saturday 4th July 2020._Leiceste.response: Jamie Vardy netted his 100th Premier League goal as Leicester kept their hold on third place with a 3-0 win over Crystal Palace.
3:00pm, Saturday 4th July 2020._Leiceste.detail: Vardy could not have wished for an easier goal to secure his ton, with a dreadful mistake from Mamadou Sakho gifting the ball to Harvey Barnes, who squared for him to net just his third goal of 2020 (77). In injury time, he then doubled his tally on the break with the finish of a man finally feeling confident again.

3:00pm, Saturday 4th July 2020._Manchest.news: Manchester United 5-2 Bournemouth: Mason Greenwood scores twice in victory
3:00pm, Saturday 4th July 2020._Manchest.response: Manchester United put on an electric showing of attacking flair to beat Bournemouth 5-2 and temporarily move into the top four.
3:00pm, Saturday 4th July 2020._Manchest.detail: An early error at his near post by David de Gea helped the Cherries take the lead through Junior Stanislas (16) but going behind sparked United's breathtaking attack into life.

5:30pm, Saturday 4th July 2020._Wolverha.news: Wolves 0-2 Arsenal: Bukayo Saka and Alexandre Lacazette on target in win
5:30pm, Saturday 4th July 2020._Wolverha.response: Arsenal brought Wolves' charge for the top four to a screeching halt with goals from Bukayo Saka and Alexandre Lacazette giving the Gunners a 2-0 win at Molineux.
5:30pm, Saturday 4th July 2020._Wolverha.detail: Wolves had been unbeaten in eight Premier League games and had won all three of their matches since the restart, but a sensational volley from Saka (43) put Arsenal ahead at the end of the first half.

8:00pm, Saturday 4th July 2020._Chelsea_.news: Chelsea 3-0 Watford: Olivier Giroud, Willian and Ross Barkley on target as Blues return to winning ways
8:00pm, Saturday 4th July 2020._Chelsea_.response: Chelsea brushed off their midweek setback to return to winning ways with a routine 3-0 victory over Watford at Stamford Bridge.
8:00pm, Saturday 4th July 2020._Chelsea_.detail: Frank Lampard had called for a response from his players following his side's 3-2 defeat to West Ham, and after Manchester United temporarily moved above them into the top four with a comprehensive victory over Bournemouth on Saturday, Chelsea had to win.

6:00pm, Thursday 2nd July 2020._Sheffiel.news: Sheffield United 3-1 Tottenham: VAR handball call denies Spurs equaliser as Blades back on form
6:00pm, Thursday 2nd July 2020._Sheffiel.response: Sander Berge, Lys Mousset and Oli McBurnie fired Sheffield United to a 3-1 win over Tottenham, as Spurs were left fuming after a VAR call denied Harry Kane an equaliser.
6:00pm, Thursday 2nd July 2020._Sheffiel.detail: Sheffield United were infamously denied a goal at Tottenham in November when John Lundstram's toe was judged offside but roles were reversed on Thursday when, trailing to Berge's opener (31), Kane's strike was disallowed by VAR for a Lucas Moura handball in the build-up.

8:15pm, Thursday 2nd July 2020._Manchest.news: Man City 4-0 Liverpool: Champions stunned as City thrash Liverpool
8:15pm, Thursday 2nd July 2020._Manchest.response: Premier League champions Liverpool were brought back down to earth as they were thrashed 4-0 by Manchester City at the Etihad Stadium.
8:15pm, Thursday 2nd July 2020._Manchest.detail: City showed respect to the title winners with a guard of honour before kick-off, but it was strictly back to business soon enough as Kevin De Bruyne's penalty put the hosts ahead after Joe Gomez had hauled down Raheem Sterling (25).

6:00pm, Wednesday 1st July 2020._Arsenal.news: Arsenal 4-0 Norwich: Mikel Arteta's side boost European hopes with clinical victory
6:00pm, Wednesday 1st July 2020._Arsenal.response: Arsenal boosted their chances of securing European football for next season with a comprehensive 4-0 win over relegation-threatened Norwich.
6:00pm, Wednesday 1st July 2020._Arsenal.detail: The Gunners again benefited from some poor goalkeeping as Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang capitalised on Tim Krul's error to open the scoring before Granit Xhaka finished a fine move to double his side's advantage at the break.

6:00pm, Wednesday 1st July 2020._Bournem.news: Bournemouth 1-4 Newcastle: Magpies deepen Cherries relegation fears
6:00pm, Wednesday 1st July 2020._Bournem.response: Newcastle ignited their quest for a top-half finish with a comprehensive 4-1 victory at Bournemouth that deepened the Cherries' relegation fears.
6:00pm, Wednesday 1st July 2020._Bournem.detail: Dwight Gayle punished Jefferson Lerma's costly fifth-minute error to hand Newcastle the lead, and Sean Longstaff put the Magpies in complete control at the Vitality Stadium with an emphatic second on the half-hour.

6:00pm, Wednesday 1st July 2020._Everton.news: Everton 2-1 Leicester: Richarlison and Gylfi Sigurdsson add to Foxes' top-four fears
6:00pm, Wednesday 1st July 2020._Everton.response: Leicester's hopes of a top-four finish in the Premier League were hit by a 2-1 defeat at Everton on Wednesday night, despite a second-half fightback from the Foxes.
6:00pm, Wednesday 1st July 2020._Everton.detail: Richarlison put Everton ahead with just 10 minutes on the clock and Gylfi Sigurdsson doubled their advantage from the penalty spot six minutes later after a long VAR review eventually punished Wilfred Ndidi's handball.

8:15pm, Wednesday 1st July 2020._West Ha.news: West Ham 3-2 Chelsea: Andriy Yarmolenko wins it late on as Hammers shake off VAR controversy
8:15pm, Wednesday 1st July 2020._West Ha.response: Andriy Yarmolenko stepped off the bench to hit the winner as West Ham shrugged off VAR controversy to beat Chelsea 3-2 and give their Premier League survival hopes a huge boost.
8:15pm, Wednesday 1st July 2020._West Ha.detail: The Hammers had controversially been denied an opener when Tomas Soucek's strike was scrubbed out by VAR but battled back from Willian's (42) penalty to lead when Soucek (45+2) and Michail Antonio (51) netted either side of the break.

8:15pm, Tuesday 30th June 2020._Brighton.news: Brighton 0-3 Manchester United: Bruno Fernandes double keeps visitors in top-four hunt
8:15pm, Tuesday 30th June 2020._Brighton.response: Bruno Fernandes stole the show as Manchester United remained in pursuit of a top-four finish with a comprehensive 3-0 victory at Brighton on Tuesday.
8:15pm, Tuesday 30th June 2020._Brighton.detail: Mason Greenwood's sixth league goal of the season gave United the lead inside 16 minutes at the Amex Stadium before Fernandes combined with Paul Pogba to double their tally before the half-hour mark.

8:00pm, Monday 29th June 2020._Crystal P.news: Crystal Palace 0-1 Burnley: Ben Mee keeps Clarets' European hopes alive
8:00pm, Monday 29th June 2020._Crystal P.response: Ben Mee's second-half header saw Burnley beat Crystal Palace 1-0 at Selhurst Park as Sean Dyche's side kept alive their hopes of qualifying for Europe next season.
8:00pm, Monday 29th June 2020._Crystal P.detail: ​​​In what was a battle of two mid-table teams in southeast London, it was the visitors who took the spoils when their captain headed home Ashley Westwood's free kick just past the hour-mark for his first goal since January 2017.

4:30pm, Sunday 28th June 2020._Watford_S.news: Watford 1-3 Southampton: Danny Ings' double dents Hornets hopes
4:30pm, Sunday 28th June 2020._Watford_S.response: Danny Ings scored twice as Southampton piled the pressure on struggling Watford with a 3-1 victory at Vicarage Road on Sunday.
4:30pm, Sunday 28th June 2020._Watford_S.detail: Ings registered his 20th goal of the season with a superb solo effort on 16 minutes and capitalised on Ben Foster's poor clearance with his 21st of the campaign 20 minutes from time.

12:30pm, Saturday 27th June 2020._Aston.news: Aston Villa 0-1 Wolves: Leander Dendoncker scores only goal as Wolves push for top four
12:30pm, Saturday 27th June 2020._Aston.response: Wolves kept up their 100 per cent record since the Premier League's return with a 1-0 victory at Aston Villa on Saturday.
12:30pm, Saturday 27th June 2020._Aston.detail: Wolves waited just over an hour for their opener as Leander Dendoncker fired into the bottom right corner from 15 yards (62), and the visitors deserved the victory on balance, also going close in the first half through Diogo Jota as he capitalised on Orjan Nyland's error.

6:00pm, Thursday 25th June 2020._Burnley.news: Burnley 1-0 Watford: Jay Rodriguez header sees off Hornets
6:00pm, Thursday 25th June 2020._Burnley.response: A glancing header from Jay Rodriguez was enough for Burnley to beat Watford 1-0 and ensure they remain unbeaten at Turf Moor in the Premier League since New Year's Day.
6:00pm, Thursday 25th June 2020._Burnley.detail: It was the old football cliche of a game of two half, with Burnley by far the better side in the first as Matej Vydra hit the post and Rodriguez had an effort cleared off the line by Craig Dawson.

6:00pm, Thursday 25th June 2020._Southam.news: Southampton 0-2 Arsenal: Gunners register first post-lockdown win
6:00pm, Thursday 25th June 2020._Southam.response: Arsenal got off the mark with their first post-lockdown victory as goals from Eddie Nketiah and Joe Willock earned a 2-0 win at Southampton.
6:00pm, Thursday 25th June 2020._Southam.detail: Nketiah forced a calamitous error from Saints goalkeeper Alex McCarthy midway through the first half, charging down his pass before converting his fourth Gunners goal of the season into the unguarded net.

8:15pm, Thursday 25th June 2020._Chelsea.news: Chelsea 2-1 Man City: Liverpool champions after Christian Pulisic and Willian down Pep Guardiola's side
8:15pm, Thursday 25th June 2020._Chelsea.response: Liverpool have been crowned Premier League champions after Chelsea's dramatic 2-1 victory over Manchester City left the Reds with an unassailable lead.
8:15pm, Thursday 25th June 2020._Chelsea.detail: City had to win to delay Liverpool's celebrations but a first-half defensive mix-up allowed Christian Pulisic (36) to put Chelsea ahead and, after Kevin De Bruyne's (55) sublime equaliser, Willian fired home a penalty following Fernandinho's red card to seal Chelsea's - and Liverpool's - triumph.

6:00pm, Wednesday 24th June 2020._Manche.news: Manchester United 3-0 Sheffield United: Anthony Martial grabs first career hat-trick
6:00pm, Wednesday 24th June 2020._Manche.response: Anthony Martial produced his standout performance in a Manchester United shirt as he bagged a hat-trick in a 3-0 win over Sheffield United.
6:00pm, Wednesday 24th June 2020._Manche.detail: The French striker has had his critics at Old Trafford but gave a lacklustre Blades outfit the run-around, opening the scoring with a close-range finish from a Marcus Rashford cross (7).

6:00pm, Wednesday 24th June 2020._Newcas.news: Newcastle 1-1 Aston Villa: Ahmed Elmohamady's late header rescues point for visitors
6:00pm, Wednesday 24th June 2020._Newcas.response: Aston Villa grabbed what could prove to be a crucial point in their battle to stay in the Premier League thanks to a 1-1 draw at Newcastle.
6:00pm, Wednesday 24th June 2020._Newcas.detail: Newcastle thought they were on course for a second straight home victory, following their 3-0 win against Sheffield United on Saturday, when substitute Dwight Gayle broke the deadlock in the 68th minute.

6:00pm, Wednesday 24th June 2020._Norwic.news: Norwich 0-1 Everton: Michael Keane deepens Canaries relegation fears
6:00pm, Wednesday 24th June 2020._Norwic.response: Norwich edged closer to the Premier League trapdoor as Michael Keane's 55th-minute header was enough to secure Everton a 1-0 victory in sweltering heat at Carrow Road.
6:00pm, Wednesday 24th June 2020._Norwic.detail: The Canaries remain six points adrift of safety with seven games remaining, while Everton move above Arsenal into 10th after edging an encounter low on quality in East Anglia.

6:00pm, Wednesday 24th June 2020._Wolver.news: Wolves 1-0 Bournemouth: Raul Jimenez moves on to 15 league goals for season with winner
6:00pm, Wednesday 24th June 2020._Wolver.response: Raul Jimenez and Adama Traore combined again to continue Wolves' Champions League bid with a 1-0 win over lowly Bournemouth.
6:00pm, Wednesday 24th June 2020._Wolver.detail: In a near carbon copy of his opener against West Ham on Saturday, Jimenez nodded in Traore's cross at the back post (60) to register his 15th Premier League goal of the season, and the 10th the pair have combined for, as Wolves kept the pressure on fifth-placed Manchester United, who they continue to trail on goal difference.

8:15pm, Wednesday 24th June 2020._Liverp.news: Liverpool 4-0 Crystal Palace: Mohamed Salah stars as Reds close in on Premier League title
8:15pm, Wednesday 24th June 2020._Liverp.response: Liverpool thrashed Crystal Palace 4-0 and are on the brink of the Premier League title, knowing a win or draw for Chelsea against Manchester City on Thursday will see them crowned English champions for the first time in 30 years.
8:15pm, Wednesday 24th June 2020._Liverp.detail: An inch-perfect Trent Alexander-Arnold free-kick (23) and trademark finish from the returning Mohamed Salah (44) rewarded Liverpool's first-half dominance at Anfield and, with the visitors' threat hampered by an early injury to Wilfried Zaha, the Reds continued their control after the break.

6:00pm, Tuesday 23rd June 2020._Leiceste.news: Leicester 0-0 Brighton: Neal Maupay denied by Kasper Schmeichel from spot
6:00pm, Tuesday 23rd June 2020._Leiceste.response: Brighton pulled further clear of the relegation zone with a 0-0 draw at Leicester but it could have been more if Neal Maupay had not missed a penalty.
6:00pm, Tuesday 23rd June 2020._Leiceste.detail: The game's key moment arrived early (14) when James Justin was adjudged to have fouled Aaron Connolly but Maupay - who scored the winner in Brighton's first win of 2020 on Saturday against Arsenal - could not find a way past Kasper Schmeichel.

8:15pm, Tuesday 23rd June 2020._Tottenha.news: Tottenham 2-0 West Ham: Harry Kane back on scoresheet in derby win
8:15pm, Tuesday 23rd June 2020._Tottenha.response: Harry Kane scored his first goal since returning from injury as Tottenham boosted their hopes of European football with a 2-0 win that keeps West Ham deep in relegation trouble.
8:15pm, Tuesday 23rd June 2020._Tottenha.detail: Tomas Soucek unwittingly bundled into his own net (64) - the ball hitting Davinson Sanchez's arm in the build-up - to finally gift the breakthrough to a Spurs side that had seen Heung-Min Son denied by VAR at the end of an even first half.

8:00pm, Monday 22nd June 2020._Mancheste.news: Manchester City 5-0 Burnley: Phil Foden and Riyad Mahrez doubles in thrashing
8:00pm, Monday 22nd June 2020._Mancheste.response: Phil Foden and Riyad Mahrez were the stars of the show as they both scored doubles in Manchester City's 5-0 thrashing of Burnley.
8:00pm, Monday 22nd June 2020._Mancheste.detail: Pep Guardiola made eight changes from the 3-0 win against Arsenal on Wednesday with Foden handed a rare Premier League start. It took only 22 minutes for him to justify his selection with a thunderous finish from the edge of the area.

2:00pm, Sunday 21st June 2020._Newcastle.news: Newcastle 3-0 Sheff Utd: Joelinton ends goal drought in win over 10-man Blades
2:00pm, Sunday 21st June 2020._Newcastle.response: Newcastle emphatically picked up back-to-back Premier League victories for the first time since December with a 3-0 win over 10-man Sheffield United at St James' Park.
2:00pm, Sunday 21st June 2020._Newcastle.detail: Joelinton ended a 2,130-minute wait for a goal with his first Premier League strike at home (78) since his £40m move last summer, to put the seal on a one-sided second half, adding to Allan Saint-Maximin's opener (55) and Matt Ritchie's fine strike (68).

4:15pm, Sunday 21st June 2020._Aston Vil.news: Aston Villa 1-2 Chelsea: Blues' second-half comeback boosts top-four hopes
4:15pm, Sunday 21st June 2020._Aston Vil.response: Chelsea boosted their hopes of Champions League football next season by coming from a goal down on their return to Premier League action to beat Aston Villa 2-1 at Villa Park.
4:15pm, Sunday 21st June 2020._Aston Vil.detail: After dominating the majority of the first half, Frank Lampard's side found themselves trailing at the interval when, firmly against the run of play, Kortney Hause tapped home from close range in the 43rd minute to send Villa into the break with a shock lead.

7:00pm, Sunday 21st June 2020._Everton_L.news: Everton 0-0 Liverpool: Goodison Park stalemate delays Reds' title charge
7:00pm, Sunday 21st June 2020._Everton_L.response: Everton and Liverpool played out a tepid goalless draw on their return to Premier League action at Goodison Park, delaying the visitors' title charge.
7:00pm, Sunday 21st June 2020._Everton_L.detail: Liverpool went into the game needing six more points to clinch their first Premier League title but were blunted by the absences of Mohamed Salah and Andrew Robertson, mustering only three shots on target.

12:30pm, Saturday 20th June 2020._Watfor.news: Watford 1-1 Leicester: Late Craig Dawson and Ben Chilwell wondergoals at Vicarage Road
12:30pm, Saturday 20th June 2020._Watfor.response: Two defenders scored late wondergoals as Watford and Leicester drew 1-1 at Vicarage Road on Saturday.
12:30pm, Saturday 20th June 2020._Watfor.detail: With the evenly fought contest entering its final minute, both teams appeared to have settled for a goalless draw before Leicester left-back Ben Chilwell found the top corner of the net with an exquisite strike.

3:00pm, Saturday 20th June 2020._Brighto.news: Brighton 2-1 Arsenal: Neal Maupay grabs last-gasp winner after Bernd Leno stretchered off
3:00pm, Saturday 20th June 2020._Brighto.response: Neal Maupay piled the misery on Arsenal with a last-gasp goal to give Brighton a 2-1 win over the Gunners, who had earlier seen goalkeeper Bernd Leno stretchered off.
3:00pm, Saturday 20th June 2020._Brighto.detail: Replays showed Leno had appeared to see his knee buckle after being pushed by Maupay as the two competed for an aerial ball before half-time, and the German 'keeper had aimed some choice words at the Brighton forward as he was stretchered from the pitch.

5:30pm, Saturday 20th June 2020._West Ha.news: West Ham 0-2 Wolves: Late goals give Wolves victory at struggling Hammers
5:30pm, Saturday 20th June 2020._West Ha.response: Wolves' substitutions changed the game as they earned a 2-0 win at relegation-threatened West Ham thanks to goals from Raul Jimenez and Pedro Neto.
5:30pm, Saturday 20th June 2020._West Ha.detail: Pablo Fornals blazed over from a good position early on in the game's only chance until 17 minutes from time, when sub Adama Traore expertly crossed for Jimenez to head in at the far post.

7:45pm, Saturday 20th June 2020._Bournem.news: Bournemouth 0-2 Crystal Palace: Luka Milivojevic and Jordan Ayew pile pressure on Cherries
7:45pm, Saturday 20th June 2020._Bournem.response: Crystal Palace toasted their return to Premier League action with a 2-0 victory at Bournemouth that piled more misery on the relegation-threatened Cherries.
7:45pm, Saturday 20th June 2020._Bournem.detail: Luka Milivojevic's exquisite free-kick and Jordan Ajew's ninth goal of the season put the Eagles two up inside 23 minutes at a deserted Vitality Stadium.

6:00pm, Friday 19th June 2020._Norwich C.news: Norwich 0-3 Southampton: Slick Saints outclass sloppy Canaries
6:00pm, Friday 19th June 2020._Norwich C.response: Southampton put in a slick performance on their Premier League return, easily beating Norwich 3-0 as the Canaries edged closer to relegation.
6:00pm, Friday 19th June 2020._Norwich C.detail: The Saints looked like they had barely missed a Premier League game - let alone three months' worth - and soon took control after a good start from Norwich, who were punished for too many errors in possession.

8:15pm, Friday 19th June 2020._Tottenham.news: Tottenham 1-1 Man Utd: Paul Pogba wins penalty for Bruno Fernandes to cancel out Steven Bergwijn opener
8:15pm, Friday 19th June 2020._Tottenham.response: Paul Pogba stepped off the bench to help derail Jose Mourinho and Tottenham's hopes of catching Manchester United in the race for the Champions League places, winning a penalty for Bruno Fernandes to cancel out Steven Bergwijn's opener.
8:15pm, Friday 19th June 2020._Tottenham.detail: A woeful David de Gea error from Bergwijn's first-half strike (27) looked like it would end United's unbeaten streak on their Premier League return, but Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's side were hugely improved after the break with the introduction of fit-again Pogba, and Spurs could not withstand the onslaught as it ended 1-1.

6:00pm, Wednesday 17th June 2020._Aston.news: Aston Villa 0-0 Sheffield United: Visitors denied by tech error on Premier League's return
6:00pm, Wednesday 17th June 2020._Aston.response: Sheffield United were denied by a bizarre goal-line technology error in their 0-0 draw at Aston Villa as the Premier League returned in highly controversial fashion following a 100-day absence.
6:00pm, Wednesday 17th June 2020._Aston.detail: The visitors should have been ahead going into half-time as Oliver Norwood's deep free-kick was fumbled over the line by Villa goalkeeper Orjan Nyland, but the usually faultless goal-line technology did not alert referee Michael Oliver, to the bemusement of all watching at Villa Park and at home.

8:15pm, Wednesday 17th June 2020._Manche.news: Manchester City 3-0 Arsenal: Hosts punish David Luiz errors to seal comfortable win
8:15pm, Wednesday 17th June 2020._Manche.response: David Luiz produced a catalogue of errors in a torrid 25-minute cameo appearance as 10-man Arsenal slipped to a 3-0 defeat at Manchester City on the Premier League's return.
8:15pm, Wednesday 17th June 2020._Manche.detail: Brought on as a substitute in the 24th minute following an injury to Pablo Mari, the Brazilian's error led to Raheem Sterling's opener (45+2) before he was sent off for hauling down Riyad Mahrez inside the penalty area four minutes into the second half.

8:00pm, Monday 9th March 2020._Leicester.news: Leicester 4-0 Aston Villa: Harvey Barnes and Jamie Vardy score two apiece
8:00pm, Monday 9th March 2020._Leicester.response: Leicester returned to form in a spectacular style with a 4-0 thrashing of Aston Villa at the King Power Stadium that keeps Dean Smith's side in the relegation zone.
8:00pm, Monday 9th March 2020._Leicester.detail: Harvey Barnes capitalised on Pepe Reina's goalkeeping error to give the home side a first-half lead before Jamie Vardy came off the bench to score twice in the second half.

2:00pm, Sunday 8th March 2020._Chelsea_E.news: Chelsea 4-0 Everton: Carlo Ancelotti's side routed on Stamford Bridge return
2:00pm, Sunday 8th March 2020._Chelsea_E.response: A dominant Chelsea thrashed Everton 4-0 in the Premier League on Super Sunday, making it an unhappy return to Stamford Bridge for Carlo Ancelotti.
2:00pm, Sunday 8th March 2020._Chelsea_E.detail: The Everton boss had never faced Chelsea before in his managerial career and returned to Stamford Bridge for the first time since his sacking from the club in 2011, but it got off to the worst start when Mason Mount produced a fine, swivelled finish in the 14th minute.

4:30pm, Sunday 8th March 2020._Mancheste.news: Manchester United 2-0 Manchester City: Ederson errors hand United derby spoils
4:30pm, Sunday 8th March 2020._Mancheste.response: Manchester United punished two goalkeeping errors from Ederson to inflict a 2-0 derby defeat on Manchester City at a jubilant Old Trafford on Super Sunday.
4:30pm, Sunday 8th March 2020._Mancheste.detail: Anthony Martial volleyed Bruno Fernandes' exquisite free-kick past Ederson half an hour into the 182nd Manchester derby, an effort the City goalkeeper got two hands to and should have saved.

12:30pm, Saturday 7th March 2020._Liverp.news: Liverpool 2-1 Bournemouth: Reds move to within three wins of Premier League title
12:30pm, Saturday 7th March 2020._Liverp.response: Liverpool came from behind to beat Bournemouth as a 2-1 victory at Anfield moved them to within three wins of the Premier League title.
12:30pm, Saturday 7th March 2020._Liverp.detail: Liverpool's bid to arrest a run of three defeats in four matches got off to the worst possible start as Callum Wilson's contentious ninth-minute opener - allowed to stand after VAR ruled the Bournemouth striker's shove on Joe Gomez was legal - left Anfield stunned.

3:00pm, Saturday 7th March 2020._Arsenal.news: Arsenal 1-0 West Ham: Alexandre Lacazette scores winner after long VAR check
3:00pm, Saturday 7th March 2020._Arsenal.response: Alexandre Lacazette stepped off the bench to boost Arsenal's Champions League qualifying hopes with a VAR assisted winner in a 1-0 victory over West Ham.
3:00pm, Saturday 7th March 2020._Arsenal.detail: The Frenchman fired in from Mesut Ozil's headed cross (78) and, after a long VAR check, the initial offside flag on Ozil was overruled to put Arsenal on course for their third straight Premier League win, which moves them to within five points of fourth place.

3:00pm, Saturday 7th March 2020._Crystal.news: Crystal Palace 1-0 Watford: Jordan Ayew's stunner lifts Palace into European contention
3:00pm, Saturday 7th March 2020._Crystal.response: Crystal Palace won for third game on the bounce to move into the European qualification picture by seeing off Watford 1-0 at Selhurst Park.
3:00pm, Saturday 7th March 2020._Crystal.detail: In a bitty and niggly encounter with eight yellow cards, including one for Wilfried Zaha who was in the thick of things not for the first time against Watford, Jordan Ayew's stunning first-half goal (28) separated the teams.

3:00pm, Saturday 7th March 2020._Sheffie.news: Sheffield United 1-0 Norwich: Billy Sharp and Dean Henderson ensure victory for hosts
3:00pm, Saturday 7th March 2020._Sheffie.response: Sheffield United closed in on the Premier League's top four after Billy Sharp's first-half header and Dean Henderson's superb late save secured a 1-0 victory over bottom side Norwich at Bramall Lane.
3:00pm, Saturday 7th March 2020._Sheffie.detail: After Teemu Pukki struck the upright from close range in the 14th minute, the Blades took control and Sharp headed home John Lundstram's brilliant cross in the 36th minute for his third in four games.

3:00pm, Saturday 7th March 2020._Southam.news: Southampton 0-1 Newcastle: Allan Saint-Maximin moves Magpies closer to safety
3:00pm, Saturday 7th March 2020._Southam.response: Allan Saint-Maximin was the hero after the winger's late strike gave Newcastle a much-needed 1-0 win over 10-man Southampton in a VAR-dominated clash at St Mary's.
3:00pm, Saturday 7th March 2020._Southam.detail: The hosts' task was made all the harder when Moussa Djenepo was sent off after referee Graham Scott was urged to consult the pitch-side monitor to decide the Mali international's dangerous tackle on Isaac Hayden warranted a straight red card just before the half-hour mark.

3:00pm, Saturday 7th March 2020._Wolverh.news: Wolves 0-0 Brighton: Stalemate at Molineux as Nuno Espirito Santo's team miss chance to go fourth
3:00pm, Saturday 7th March 2020._Wolverh.response: Brighton held Wolves to a goalless draw at Molineux as the home side missed the chance to move fourth.
3:00pm, Saturday 7th March 2020._Wolverh.detail: It was a game of few openings in which Solly March went closest for the away side, while Leander Dendoncker spurned an opportunity to win it late on.

5:30pm, Saturday 7th March 2020._Burnley.news: Burnley 1-1 Tottenham: Dele Alli penalty earns draw for Jose Mourinho's team
5:30pm, Saturday 7th March 2020._Burnley.response: Dele Alli's penalty earned Spurs a 1-1 draw at Burnley but a third winless game saw them miss the chance to cut the gap to the top four to two points.
5:30pm, Saturday 7th March 2020._Burnley.detail: Spurs - coming into the game on a run of four defeats in a row - were perhaps fortunate to escape Turf Moor with a point after a lacklustre opening period during which the hosts deservedly took the lead through Chris Wood's goal after a Hugo Lloris fumble (13).

2:00pm, Sunday 1st March 2020._Everton_M.news: Everton 1-1 Manchester United: Bruno Fernandes rescues point after David de Gea howler
2:00pm, Sunday 1st March 2020._Everton_M.response: Everton had a late winner ruled out by VAR as Bruno Fernandes spared David de Gea's blushes by rescuing a 1-1 draw for Manchester United at Goodison Park.
2:00pm, Sunday 1st March 2020._Everton_M.detail: Calvert-Lewin's charge down forced an awful error from a hesitant De Gea as his clearance deflected into his own net with just three minutes on the clock, but Fernandes equalised with his third goal in three games on the half-hour, ramming home a near-post drive that Jordan Pickford will be disappointed not to have saved.

2:00pm, Sunday 1st March 2020._Tottenham.news: Tottenham 2-3 Wolves: Nuno Espirito Santo's side move to within three points of Chelsea
2:00pm, Sunday 1st March 2020._Tottenham.response: Wolves' march towards Champions League qualification stepped up a notch with a 3-2 win at Tottenham where they twice came from behind.
2:00pm, Sunday 1st March 2020._Tottenham.detail: Spurs took an early lead when Steven Bergwijn fired home (13) but Matt Doherty (24) equalised on his 250th appearance for the club. Jose Mourinho's side then looked in control of matters at the break after Serge Aurier's fine strike (45+1), however, Diogo Jota pulled Wolves level (57) for the second time.

12:30pm, Saturday 29th February 2020._Br.news: Brighton 0-1 Crystal Palace: Jordan Ayew punishes wasteful Seagulls
12:30pm, Saturday 29th February 2020._Br.response: Jordan Ayew boosted Crystal Palace's survival hopes at the expense of rivals Brighton as his second-half strike secured a 1-0 victory at the Amex Stadium on Saturday.
12:30pm, Saturday 29th February 2020._Br.detail: Brighton registered 24 shots on goal - their highest tally in a Premier League game - but they paid the price for failing to convert them as Ayew notched his seventh goal of the season against the run of play to fire the Eagles to back-to-back league wins for the first time since December.

3:00pm, Saturday 29th February 2020._Bou.news: Bournemouth 2-2 Chelsea: Marcos Alonso equaliser rescues point
3:00pm, Saturday 29th February 2020._Bou.response: Marcos Alonso continued his fine scoring form in the Premier League as he rescued a late point for Chelsea in a 2-2 draw with Bournemouth.
3:00pm, Saturday 29th February 2020._Bou.detail: Alonso scored just his second goal of the season against Tottenham last weekend and made it two in two when he slammed home Chelsea's opener just after the half-an-hour mark.

3:00pm, Saturday 29th February 2020._New.news: Newcastle 0-0 Burnley: Defences on top on frustrating afternoon at St James' Park
3:00pm, Saturday 29th February 2020._New.response: Burnley extended their unbeaten run in the league to six games after playing out a frustrating goalless draw with Newcastle at St James' Park on Saturday.
3:00pm, Saturday 29th February 2020._New.detail: In a game low on real excitement, Steve Bruce's side did have the better of the opportunities but they drew a blank for the fourth league game in a row.

3:00pm, Saturday 29th February 2020._Wes.news: West Ham 3-1 Southampton: Jarrod Bowen sparks Hammers into life
3:00pm, Saturday 29th February 2020._Wes.response: West Ham moved out of the relegation zone with a 3-1 win over Southampton, their first success in nine games.
3:00pm, Saturday 29th February 2020._Wes.detail: In an attacking performance full of pace, power and ruthless finishing, all of the front three scored with Jarrod Bowen (15), who was making his full debut, Sebastien Haller (40) and Michail Antonio (54) proving too hot for a timid Saints to handle.

5:30pm, Saturday 29th February 2020._Wat.news: Watford 3-0 Liverpool: Jurgen Klopp's side suffer first Premier League defeat of the season
5:30pm, Saturday 29th February 2020._Wat.response: Watford caused a monumental upset after becoming the first team to beat Liverpool in the Premier League this season with Ismaila Sarr's second-half double helping to condemn the league leaders to a stunning 3-0 loss at Vicarage Road on Saturday.
5:30pm, Saturday 29th February 2020._Wat.detail: Sarr nipped in to break the deadlock after 54 minutes, before then racing through to double the Hornets' lead six minutes later.

8:00pm, Friday 28th February 2020._Norwi.news: Norwich 1-0 Leicester: Jamal Lewis stunner gives hosts relegation hope
8:00pm, Friday 28th February 2020._Norwi.response: A stunning Jamal Lewis goal saw Norwich beat Leicester 1-0 in the Premier League on Friday Night Football and boost their survival hopes.
8:00pm, Friday 28th February 2020._Norwi.detail: Both sides went into the game having not won in the league since the middle of January and Leicester thought they taken the lead when Kelechi Iheanacho (49) powered home just after the break, but VAR ruled it out for handball.

8:00pm, Monday 24th February 2020._Liver.news: Liverpool 3-2 West Ham: Sadio Mane strikes late to sink spirited Hammers
8:00pm, Monday 24th February 2020._Liver.response: Sadio Mane's 81st-minute strike ensured Liverpool overcame an almighty scare to beat a spirited West Ham 3-2 at Anfield and re-establish their 22-point lead at the top of the Premier League.
8:00pm, Monday 24th February 2020._Liver.detail: Jurgen Klopp's side trailed the Hammers with 22 minutes remaining, but goals from Mohamed Salah (68) and Mane ensured Liverpool equalled Manchester City's Premier League record of 18 consecutive league wins.

2:00pm, Sunday 23rd February 2020._Manch.news: Manchester United 3-0 Watford: Bruno Fernandes stars as United climb to fifth
2:00pm, Sunday 23rd February 2020._Manch.response: Bruno Fernandes scored one and had a hand in the other two goals as Manchester United continued their recent upturn with a 3-0 Premier League victory over Watford at Old Trafford on Sunday.
2:00pm, Sunday 23rd February 2020._Manch.detail: January signing Fernandes capped a man-of-the-match performance in style with his first goal for the club, nonchalantly converting a penalty he had won after being fouled by Ben Foster shortly before half-time.

2:00pm, Sunday 23rd February 2020._Wolve.news: Wolves 3-0 Norwich: Diogo Jota double helps keep Wolves in European hunt
2:00pm, Sunday 23rd February 2020._Wolve.response: Wolves kept themselves firmly in the running for another European campaign next season with a comfortable 3-0 victory at home to rock-bottom Norwich City.
2:00pm, Sunday 23rd February 2020._Wolve.detail: Diogo Jota scored the opener after 19 minutes and made it 2-0 11 minutes later to put the hosts in control, before Raul Jimenez added a third five minutes after half-time on a sorry afternoon for the visitors.

4:30pm, Sunday 23rd February 2020._Arsen.news: Arsenal 3-2 Everton: Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang scores twice in entertaining clash
4:30pm, Sunday 23rd February 2020._Arsen.response: Arsenal came out on top in a five-goal thriller as Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang's double gave them a 3-2 victory over Everton in the Premier League on Super Sunday.
4:30pm, Sunday 23rd February 2020._Arsen.detail: In-form Dominic Calvert-Lewin opened the scoring for Everton after just 49 seconds with an intuitive acrobatic effort, but Eddie Nketiah levelled with just his second Premier League goal from early sub Bukayo Saka's brilliant cross (27).

12:30pm, Saturday 22nd February 2020._Ch.news: Chelsea 2-1 Tottenham: Olivier Giroud and Marcos Alonso seal Blues' London derby win
12:30pm, Saturday 22nd February 2020._Ch.response: Chelsea boss Frank Lampard masterminded a crucial 2-1 win over Jose Mourinho's Tottenham, as recalled pair Olivier Giroud and Marcos Alonso fired the Blues to a victory which strengthens their hold on fourth place.
12:30pm, Saturday 22nd February 2020._Ch.detail: In his pre-match press conference, Mourinho had claimed he had been told Chelsea were switching to a back five for the fixture, and while that was proved correct, Spurs were unable to prevent Giroud (15) from scoring his first Premier League goal of the season or Alonso (48) capping a move which involved all four line-up changes made by Lampard.

3:00pm, Saturday 22nd February 2020._Bur.news: Burnley 3-0 Bournemouth: Cherries capitulate after VAR disallows two goals
3:00pm, Saturday 22nd February 2020._Bur.response: Burnley were given a helping hand by VAR as they capitalised on two disallowed Bournemouth goals to maintain their push for Europe with a 3-0 victory at Turf Moor on Saturday.
3:00pm, Saturday 22nd February 2020._Bur.detail: Joshua King thought he had opened the scoring for the visitors on 22 minutes, only for his close-range strike to be chalked off after VAR ruled the ball had struck Philip Billing's arm in the build-up.

3:00pm, Saturday 22nd February 2020._Cry.news: Crystal Palace 1-0 Newcastle: Patrick van Aanholt free-kick gives Eagles first win since Boxing Day
3:00pm, Saturday 22nd February 2020._Cry.response: Patrick van Aanholt's first-half free-kick handed Crystal Palace a narrow 1-0 Premier League victory against Newcastle at a blustery Selhurst Park on Saturday.
3:00pm, Saturday 22nd February 2020._Cry.detail: In tricky conditions, the Eagles constantly dominated via set pieces and deservedly took the lead through former Sunderland left-back van Aanholt via a sweetly struck 25-yard free-kick on the stroke of half-time.

3:00pm, Saturday 22nd February 2020._She.news: Sheffield Utd 1-1 Brighton: Neal Maupay earns point at Bramall Lane
3:00pm, Saturday 22nd February 2020._She.response: Neal Maupay's first goal in two months quelled Sheffield United's top-four charge as Brighton earned a 1-1 draw at Bramall Lane.
3:00pm, Saturday 22nd February 2020._She.detail: Brighton trailed early on to Enda Stevens' powerful rising effort from a half-cleared corner after 26 minutes - his first goal on home soil since the Blades' promotion.

3:00pm, Saturday 22nd February 2020._Sou.news: Southampton 2-0 Aston Villa: Saints secure vital win
3:00pm, Saturday 22nd February 2020._Sou.response: Southampton took an important step towards Premier League safety as they recorded a 2-0 win over Aston Villa to leave Dean Smith's side precariously hanging above the relegation zone.
3:00pm, Saturday 22nd February 2020._Sou.detail: Shane Long scored early into the first half after converting from Moussa Djenepo's pull-back, before Stuart Armstrong - with Pepe Reina having deserted his goal following a late corner - stroked the ball into an empty net deep into injury time.

5:30pm, Saturday 22nd February 2020._Lei.news: Leicester 0-1 Manchester City: Gabriel Jesus grabs late win after Sergio Aguero penalty miss
5:30pm, Saturday 22nd February 2020._Lei.response: Substitute Gabriel Jesus's late goal gave Manchester City a 1-0 win at Leicester to strengthen their hold on second place in the Premier League.
5:30pm, Saturday 22nd February 2020._Lei.detail: Latching onto former Leicester winger Riyad Mahrez's pass after a superb run, Jesus slipped past Kasper Schmeichel (80), after the Dane had saved a Sergio Aguero penalty (62).

7:30pm, Wednesday 19th February 2020._Ma.news: Manchester City 2-0 West Ham: City return to winning ways after tumultuous week
7:30pm, Wednesday 19th February 2020._Ma.response: Manchester City returned to winning ways after a tumultuous week off the field with a comfortable 2-0 victory over West Ham on Wednesday.
7:30pm, Wednesday 19th February 2020._Ma.detail: Postponed by 10 days due to Storm Ciara, the champions let their football do the talking with a display of attacking dominance in their first game since receiving a two-season ban from all UEFA competition.

8:00pm, Monday 17th February 2020._Chels.news: Chelsea 0-2 Manchester United: Anthony Martial and Harry Maguire seal win amid VAR controversy
8:00pm, Monday 17th February 2020._Chels.response: Manchester United blew the race for the top four wide open with a 2-0 win at Chelsea amid more VAR controversy at Stamford Bridge on Monday night.
8:00pm, Monday 17th February 2020._Chels.detail: Anthony Martial struck just before half-time and Harry Maguire doubled the visitors' lead on 66 minutes to send United on their way to victory, as they moved up the table to seventh - just three points behind Chelsea in fourth.

2:00pm, Sunday 16th February 2020._Aston.news: Aston Villa 2-3 Tottenham: Heung-Min Son's stoppage-time winner punishes Villa
2:00pm, Sunday 16th February 2020._Aston.response: Heung-Min Son scored a dramatic stoppage-time winner as Tottenham put significant pressure on Chelsea in the top-four race with a 3-2 win at Aston Villa.
2:00pm, Sunday 16th February 2020._Aston.detail: The relegation-threatened hosts bossed the early stages and took a deserving lead when Toby Alderweireld scored an own goal (9).

4:30pm, Sunday 16th February 2020._Arsen.news: Arsenal 4-0 Newcastle: Mesut Ozil and Alexandre Lacazette score at Emirates
4:30pm, Sunday 16th February 2020._Arsen.response: Arsenal produced a devastating second-half blitz to see off Newcastle 4-0 at the Emirates and arrest a run of four successive draws in the Premier League.
4:30pm, Sunday 16th February 2020._Arsen.detail: The Gunners spent the majority of the first half on the back foot but sprung to life after the break thanks to a brilliant Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang header and Nicolas Pepe's fourth league goal of the season in the space of three minutes.

12:30pm, Saturday 15th February 2020._So.news: Southampton 1-2 Burnley: Matej Vydra storms Saints with second half winner
12:30pm, Saturday 15th February 2020._So.response: Matej Vydra's stunning second-half winner handed Burnley a gritty 2-1 victory at Southampton in wet and windy conditions.
12:30pm, Saturday 15th February 2020._So.detail: The visitors took the lead with a freak goal when Ashley Westwood scored straight from a corner (2) after Danny Ings had misjudged the flight in the wind. Ings then hauled his team level (18) with a powerful strike from range, netting his 18th goal of the campaign in all competitions.

5:30pm, Saturday 15th February 2020._Nor.news: Norwich 0-1 Liverpool: Sadio Mane moves Reds 25 points clear at top
5:30pm, Saturday 15th February 2020._Nor.response: Liverpool took another stride towards the Premier League title as they overcame Norwich 1-0 at a blustery Carrow Road thanks to Sadio Mane's second-half strike.
5:30pm, Saturday 15th February 2020._Nor.detail: With Storm Dennis hitting East Anglia ahead of kick-off, the adverse weather conditions made the task of breaking down a gutsy Norwich team that bit more difficult for the league leaders.

8:00pm, Friday 14th February 2020._Wolve.news: Wolves 0-0 Leicester: Willy Boly goal disallowed by VAR as 10-man Foxes hold on
8:00pm, Friday 14th February 2020._Wolve.response: Wolves were held to a goalless draw with 10-man Leicester at Molineux after Willy Boly's header was disallowed.
8:00pm, Friday 14th February 2020._Wolve.detail: Boly had appeared to have given Wolves the lead late in the first half but Pedro Neto was adjudged to have been offside by the narrowest of margins in the build-up.

2:00pm, Sunday 9th February 2020._Sheffi.news: Sheffield United 2-1 Bournemouth: Chris Wilder's men move to within two points of top four
2:00pm, Sunday 9th February 2020._Sheffi.response: Sheffield United's charge towards the Champions League places gathered momentum as a 2-1 win over Bournemouth took them to within two points of Chelsea in fourth.
2:00pm, Sunday 9th February 2020._Sheffi.detail: Chris Wilder's men did it the hard way at Bramall Lane, coming from behind after Callum Wilson handed the improved Cherries a deserved early lead (13).

12:30pm, Saturday 8th February 2020._Eve.news: Everton 3-1 Crystal Palace: Toffees maintain hopes of European football
12:30pm, Saturday 8th February 2020._Eve.response: Everton maintained their recent good form as they overcame struggling Crystal Palace 3-1 at Goodison Park on Saturday lunchtime to move up to seventh in the Premier League.
12:30pm, Saturday 8th February 2020._Eve.detail: Bernard opened the scoring after just 18 minutes with a well-struck volley, the Brazilian's third goal of the season on his 50th league appearance for Everton.

5:30pm, Saturday 8th February 2020._Brig.news: Brighton 1-1 Watford: Adrian Mariappa own goal hands hosts draw
5:30pm, Saturday 8th February 2020._Brig.response: A second-half own goal from Adrian Mariappa handed Brighton a deserved point against Watford, with the relegation-threatened sides playing out a 1-1 draw.
5:30pm, Saturday 8th February 2020._Brig.detail: Neither side went into the game in good form, but Watford struck first with a fine solo goal from Abdoulaye Doucoure (19), putting some demons to rest after also scoring an own goal in the 3-0 loss to Brighton on the opening weekend.

2:00pm, Sunday 2nd February 2020._Burnle.news: Burnley 0-0 Arsenal: Jay Rodriguez denied winner as Gunners draw again
2:00pm, Sunday 2nd February 2020._Burnle.response: Arsenal recorded a fourth consecutive Premier League draw as they were held 0-0 in an entertaining stalemate with Burnley at Turf Moor.
2:00pm, Sunday 2nd February 2020._Burnle.detail: Mikel Arteta's side were profligate in front of goal in the opening exchanges as both Alexandre Lacazette and Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang missed good chances, but they were fortunate to avoid defeat late on as Jay Rodriguez struck the crossbar from point-blank range.

4:30pm, Sunday 2nd February 2020._Totten.news: Tottenham 2-0 Man City: Steven Bergwijn scores stunner on debut
4:30pm, Sunday 2nd February 2020._Totten.response: Steven Bergwijn's stunning volley on his debut helped Tottenham to a 2-0 victory over 10-man Manchester City, who missed a first-half penalty.
4:30pm, Sunday 2nd February 2020._Totten.detail: City were reduced to 10 men after Oleksandr Zinchenko picked up two needless yellows (60), before debutant Bergwijn's superb chest down and instinctive volley from just inside the box gave Spurs the lead with their first shot on goal (63).

12:30pm, Saturday 1st February 2020._Lei.news: Leicester 2-2 Chelsea: Antonio Rudiger scores twice as Frank Lampard's side earn point
