12:30pm, Saturday 1st February 2020._Lei.response: Leicester kept their eight-point lead over fourth-placed Chelsea intact following a topsy-turvy 2-2 draw at the King Power Stadium.
12:30pm, Saturday 1st February 2020._Lei.detail: With both sides looking to boost their top-four hopes, Chelsea took the lead two minutes after half-time through Antonio Rudiger.

3:00pm, Saturday 1st February 2020._Bour.news: Bournemouth 2-1 Aston Villa: Cherries out of relegation zone
3:00pm, Saturday 1st February 2020._Bour.response: Ten-man Bournemouth leapfrogged Aston Villa and moved out of the relegation zone with a crucial 2-1 win at the Vitality Stadium.
3:00pm, Saturday 1st February 2020._Bour.detail: Goals from Philip Billing (37) and Nathan Ake (44) gave Bournemouth a deserved half-time lead, before Jefferson Lerma was harshly sent off (70) for a second booking soon after the break.

3:00pm, Saturday 1st February 2020._Crys.news: Crystal Palace 0-1 Sheffield United: Vicente Guaita own-goal gifts Blades win
3:00pm, Saturday 1st February 2020._Crys.response: A bizarre Vicente Guaita own-goal gifted Sheffield United a 1-0 victory against Crystal Palace, ending the Blades' winless away run in the Premier League.
3:00pm, Saturday 1st February 2020._Crys.detail: United had barely had a shot when Guaita spilled a save from a corner, dropping the ball over his own line in an error that ultimately decided the game and ended the Blades' three-game run without a victory in top-flight away games.

3:00pm, Saturday 1st February 2020._Live.news: Liverpool 4-0 Southampton: Reds win 20th Premier League home game in a row
3:00pm, Saturday 1st February 2020._Live.response: Mohamed Salah scored twice as Liverpool beat Southampton 4-0 to go 22 points clear at the top of the Premier League with their 20th straight home league victory.
3:00pm, Saturday 1st February 2020._Live.detail: Moments after a strong appeal for a Southampton penalty was rejected, Jurgen Klopp's side took a hugely controversial lead through Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain's low shot just after half-time.

3:00pm, Saturday 1st February 2020._Newc.news: Newcastle United 0-0 Norwich City: Canaries stuck in relegation zone
3:00pm, Saturday 1st February 2020._Newc.response: Newcastle and Norwich played out a poor 0-0 draw at St. James' Park with neither side able to make the breakthrough in a game lacking in quality.
3:00pm, Saturday 1st February 2020._Newc.detail: Norwich had the better of the chances, with Sam Byram (5) and Teemu Pukki (61) guilty of missing the best opportunities, while Newcastle could have gone ahead in the first half when Joelinton's header (21) was saved by Tim Krul.

3:00pm, Saturday 1st February 2020._Watf.news: Watford 2-3 Everton: Theo Walcott seals remarkable late comeback win for 10-man visitors
3:00pm, Saturday 1st February 2020._Watf.response: Everton completed a remarkable comeback as Theo Walcott's first Premier League goal of the season secured a dramatic 3-2 win from two goals down against Watford at Vicarage Road.
3:00pm, Saturday 1st February 2020._Watf.detail: Adam Masina fired the hosts into a 10th-minute lead before Roberto Pereyra made it 2-0 three minutes before the break.

3:00pm, Saturday 1st February 2020._West.news: West Ham 3-3 Brighton: VAR awards Glenn Murray equaliser as Seagulls show fight
3:00pm, Saturday 1st February 2020._West.response: West Ham twice threw away two-goal leads to draw 3-3 with Brighton in which VAR awarded Glenn Murray’s late equaliser.
3:00pm, Saturday 1st February 2020._West.detail: In a game littered with defensive gaffes and incredible relegation tension, West Ham were 2-0 ahead at half-time after goals from Issa Diop (30) and Robert Snodgrass (45) but a comical own-goal from Angelo Ogbonna after a flap from Lukasz Fabianski (47) gave Brighton hope.

5:30pm, Saturday 1st February 2020._Manc.news: Man Utd 0-0 Wolves: Bruno Fernandes makes debut but hosts lack spark
5:30pm, Saturday 1st February 2020._Manc.response: Manchester United are now three without a win in the Premier League as they drew 0-0 with Wolves in the Premier League at Old Trafford.
5:30pm, Saturday 1st February 2020._Manc.detail: Bruno Fernandes' debut was the only source of excitement at Old Trafford, with chances at a minimum for both sides, though David de Gea was forced into saves by Matt Doherty and Raul Jimenez in either half.

7:45pm, Wednesday 29th January 2020._Wes.news: West Ham 0-2 Liverpool: Mohamed Salah and Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain on target for Reds
7:45pm, Wednesday 29th January 2020._Wes.response: Mohamed Salah was the star man as Liverpool extended their lead at the top of the Premier League to a huge 19 points by beating West Ham 2-0 at the London Stadium.
7:45pm, Wednesday 29th January 2020._Wes.detail: Salah crashed in a first-half penalty (35) to put the visitors on their way and Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain slotted in a second (52) as Liverpool made the most of their game in hand on their distant pursuers.

8:00pm, Thursday 23rd January 2020._Wolv.news: Wolves 1-2 Liverpool: Late Roberto Firmino goal continues Reds' remarkable run
8:00pm, Thursday 23rd January 2020._Wolv.response: Roberto Firmino's 84th-minute winner earned Liverpool a nervy 2-1 win at Wolves and extended their unbeaten Premier League run to 40 games.
8:00pm, Thursday 23rd January 2020._Wolv.detail: Firmino's goal, six minutes from time, settled a tough encounter for the Reds, who struggled to deal with a strong second-half performance from the home side, but are now 16 points clear at the top of the Premier League with a game in hand.

7:30pm, Wednesday 22nd January 2020._Lei.news: Leicester 4-1 West Ham: Brendan Rodgers' side return to winning ways to boost top-four hopes
7:30pm, Wednesday 22nd January 2020._Lei.response: Leicester returned to winning ways in emphatic fashion, boosting their top-four hopes with a 4-1 victory against West Ham at the King Power Stadium.
7:30pm, Wednesday 22nd January 2020._Lei.detail: Brendan Rodgers' side came into the game on the back of successive defeats in the Premier League, but there was no sign of a lack of confidence as the hosts roared into a two-goal lead in the first half, despite losing Jamie Vardy and Nampalys Mendy to injury.

7:30pm, Wednesday 22nd January 2020._Tot.news: Tottenham 2-1 Norwich: Dele Alli and Heung-Min Son help Spurs to first league win of 2020
7:30pm, Wednesday 22nd January 2020._Tot.response: Heung-Min Son's late header helped below-par Tottenham pick up their first league victory of 2020 with a 2-1 defeat of Norwich - but Jose Mourinho will know there is plenty of work to do if his side are to further close the six-point gap on the top four.
7:30pm, Wednesday 22nd January 2020._Tot.detail: Dele Alli tucked in Tottenham's first Premier League goal of the year from Serge Aurier's low cross on 38 minutes after both sides had spurned good chances in the early exchanges but the hosts failed to kick-on.

8:15pm, Wednesday 22nd January 2020._Man.news: Manchester United 0-2 Burnley: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's side falter again after Jay Rodriguez stunner
8:15pm, Wednesday 22nd January 2020._Man.response: Burnley plunged more misery on Manchester United as they beat Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's side 2-0 to claim their first win at Old Trafford for 58 years.
8:15pm, Wednesday 22nd January 2020._Man.detail: United could have moved to within three points of Chelsea in fourth with a win but Chris Wood (39) and a stunning effort from Jay Rodriguez (56) further dented their hopes of climbing the league.

7:30pm, Tuesday 21st January 2020._Aston.news: Aston Villa 2-1 Watford: Last-gasp winner lifts Villa out of drop zone
7:30pm, Tuesday 21st January 2020._Aston.response: A 95th-minute winner off the boot of Tyrone Mings gave Aston Villa a priceless 2-1 victory over Watford to leapfrog their opponents and claw themselves out of the relegation zone.
7:30pm, Tuesday 21st January 2020._Aston.detail: Deep into stoppage time, defender Ezri Konsa's strike deflected off the boot of Mings and into the far corner of the net to deal Watford a huge blow in a relegation six-pointer.

7:30pm, Tuesday 21st January 2020._Bourn.news: Bournemouth 3-1 Brighton: Aaron Ramsdale stars in key win for Eddie Howe's side
7:30pm, Tuesday 21st January 2020._Bourn.response: Clinical finishing and a superb performance from goalkeeper Aaron Ramsdale took Bournemouth to a much-needed 3-1 victory over fellow south coast strugglers Brighton and eased the pressure on boss Eddie Howe.
7:30pm, Tuesday 21st January 2020._Bourn.detail: The visitors dominated the opening half an hour at the Vitality Stadium, with Neal Maupay drawing a stunning one-handed close-range stop from Ramsdale but Harry Wilson smacked home Bournemouth's opener (36) against the run of play.

7:30pm, Tuesday 21st January 2020._Cryst.news: Crystal Palace 0-2 Southampton: Nathan Redmond shines in impressive away win
7:30pm, Tuesday 21st January 2020._Cryst.response: Southampton made an impressive return to form as goals from Nathan Redmond and Stuart Armstrong secured a 2-0 win at Crystal Palace.
7:30pm, Tuesday 21st January 2020._Cryst.detail: Ralph Hasenhuttl's side were on the receiving end of a second-half blitz from Wolves at the weekend as they surrendered a two-goal lead to lose 3-2, but he hailed this performance at Selhurst Park as their best away from home this season.

7:30pm, Tuesday 21st January 2020._Evert.news: Everton 2-2 Newcastle: Florian Lejeune nets two injury-time goals to salvage unlikely point
7:30pm, Tuesday 21st January 2020._Evert.response: Two goals in injury-time from Florian Lejeune grabbed Newcastle the most unlikely point as Everton threw away a 2-0 goal lead to draw 2-2.
7:30pm, Tuesday 21st January 2020._Evert.detail: As the game ticked deep into stoppage time, Everton looked to have the game all sewn up after Moise Kean scored his first goal for the club (30) and Dominic Calvert-Lewin grabbed his 10th Premier League goal of the campaign (54).

7:30pm, Tuesday 21st January 2020._Sheff.news: Sheffield United 0-1 Manchester City: Sergio Aguero scores winner in narrow victory
7:30pm, Tuesday 21st January 2020._Sheff.response: Sergio Aguero scored the winner after Gabriel Jesus' missed penalty as Manchester City beat Sheffield United 1-0 at Bramall Lane.
7:30pm, Tuesday 21st January 2020._Sheff.detail: Six minutes after replacing his regular strike partner, Aguero tucked in from close range from Kevin De Bruyne's teasing low cross into the six-yard box, as Man City finally made their mounting chances count to break the deadlock 17 minutes from time.

8:15pm, Tuesday 21st January 2020._Chels.news: Chelsea 2-2 Arsenal: Hector Bellerin's late strike rescues point for 10-man Gunners
8:15pm, Tuesday 21st January 2020._Chels.response: Hector Bellerin's first Premier League goal since January 2018 rescued a point for 10-man Arsenal, who fought back twice to secure a 2-2 draw at Chelsea despite having David Luiz sent off on his return to Stamford Bridge.
8:15pm, Tuesday 21st January 2020._Chels.detail: The Gunners' chances were dealt a severe blow midway through the first half when Luiz was sent off after taking out Tammy Abraham when he was through on goal after Shkodran Mustafi's woeful backpass.

2:00pm, Sunday 19th January 2020._Burnle.news: Burnley 2-1 Leicester: Nick Pope saves Jamie Vardy penalty as Clarets break losing run
2:00pm, Sunday 19th January 2020._Burnle.response: Burnley grabbed a 2-1 win against Leicester to break a run of five straight defeats as Nick Pope starred and saved a Jamie Vardy penalty with the scores at 1-1.
2:00pm, Sunday 19th January 2020._Burnle.detail: Sean Dyche's men looked in big trouble at the break after Harvey Barnes handed top-four chasing Leicester the lead (33) but Chris Wood forced home a timely leveller (56) at a time when Leicester were dominating.

4:30pm, Sunday 19th January 2020._Liverp.news: Liverpool 2-0 Manchester United: Virgil van Dijk and Mohamed Salah push leaders closer to title
4:30pm, Sunday 19th January 2020._Liverp.response: Virgil van Dijk's header helped Liverpool on their way to a 2-0 win over Manchester United at Anfield as they extended their lead at the top to 16 points.
4:30pm, Sunday 19th January 2020._Liverp.detail: Jurgen Klopp's side had two further goals ruled out before the interval and upped the intensity again in the second half before Mohamed Salah's goal added gloss to the win late on.

12:30pm, Saturday 18th January 2020._Wat.news: Watford 0-0 Tottenham: Goal-line clearance denies Spurs win by 10.04mm
12:30pm, Saturday 18th January 2020._Wat.response: Ignacio Pussetto's goal-line clearance denied Tottenham a last-minute winner at Watford by just 10.04mm in a goalless draw at Vicarage Road.
12:30pm, Saturday 18th January 2020._Wat.detail: Pussetto, making his Watford debut as a substitute, slid in to clear Erik Lamela's goalbound effort off the line in the second minute of injury-time and prevent the below-par visitors from stealing a win.

3:00pm, Saturday 18th January 2020._Arse.news: Arsenal 1-1 Sheffield United: John Fleck earns battling Blades a point
3:00pm, Saturday 18th January 2020._Arse.response: Sheffield United remain four points ahead of Arsenal in the Premier League after battling back from a goal down to earn a 1-1 draw at the Emirates Stadium.
3:00pm, Saturday 18th January 2020._Arse.detail: The visitors were the better side for long periods of the first half but all their good early work was undone when Arsenal striker Gabriel Martinelli, who replaced the suspended Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang, tucked home from close range (45) just before half-time.

3:00pm, Saturday 18th January 2020._Brig.news: Brighton 1-1 Aston Villa: Jack Grealish magic rescues a point for Villa
3:00pm, Saturday 18th January 2020._Brig.response: Jack Grealish's stunning second-half equaliser grabbed Aston Villa an important point in a 1-1 draw with Brighton.
3:00pm, Saturday 18th January 2020._Brig.detail: In a game of few chances, Brighton took a first-half lead through Leandro Trossard (38) but Villa improved after the break and Grealish thrashed home a fierce half-volley to get his team back on a positive footing following their embarrassing 6-1 home defeat by Manchester City.

3:00pm, Saturday 18th January 2020._Manc.news: Manchester City 2-2 Crystal Palace: Champions' grip on title gets weaker after draw
3:00pm, Saturday 18th January 2020._Manc.response: Manchester City's grip on the Premier League title got even weaker as Crystal Palace earned a 2-2 draw at the Etihad Stadium following a dramatic final 10 minutes.
3:00pm, Saturday 18th January 2020._Manc.detail: Kevin De Bruyne hit the bar early on with a brilliant 30-yard free kick, but Palace scored against the run of play as Cenk Tosun headed home at the far post from a corner (39), the visitors' first and only effort of the first half.

3:00pm, Saturday 18th January 2020._Norw.news: Norwich 1-0 Bournemouth: Referee uses pitchside monitor to issue second red card
3:00pm, Saturday 18th January 2020._Norw.response: Norwich held on for a  vital 1-0 win over Bournemouth at Carrow Road after both sides were reduced to 10 men and Paul Tierney became the first Premier League referee to use a pitchside monitor.
3:00pm, Saturday 18th January 2020._Norw.detail: The hosts were on top during the opening period but failed to make it count until Steve Cook received a red card for acrobatically palming away a shot in the area from Norwich debutant Ondrej Duda on the half-hour mark.

3:00pm, Saturday 18th January 2020._Sout.news: Southampton 2-3 Wolves: Raul Jimenez scores twice in thrilling win
3:00pm, Saturday 18th January 2020._Sout.response: Wolves staged a thrilling second-half fightback to come from 2-0 down and beat in-form Southampton 3-2 at St Mary's.
3:00pm, Saturday 18th January 2020._Sout.detail: Saints looked to be heading for a fifth win from their last six Premier League matches as goals from Jan Bednarek (15) and Shane Long (35) put them in control.

3:00pm, Saturday 18th January 2020._West.news: West Ham 1-1 Everton: Dominic Calvert-Lewin cancels out Issa Diop opener
3:00pm, Saturday 18th January 2020._West.response: Dominic Calvert-Lewin's instinctive finish ensured a depleted Everton earned a 1-1 draw against West Ham at the London Stadium.
3:00pm, Saturday 18th January 2020._West.detail: Issa Diop headed the hosts in front five minutes before the break on his return to the side, but Calvert-Lewin responded immediately with his 11th goal of the season to restore parity (44) from close range.

5:30pm, Saturday 18th January 2020._Newc.news: Newcastle 1-0 Chelsea: Late Isaac Hayden header stuns Chelsea
5:30pm, Saturday 18th January 2020._Newc.response: Issac Hayden's 94th-minute header snatched a stunning 1-0 win over Chelsea, earning Newcastle their first Premier League victory of 2020.
5:30pm, Saturday 18th January 2020._Newc.detail: Chelsea had 70 per cent of the possession and 19 shots but were kept at bay by a well-drilled Newcastle side, who completed the ultimate smash-and-grab with 30 seconds to play as Hayden glanced an Allan Saint-Maximin cross home to send St James' Park into raptures.

2:00pm, Sunday 12th January 2020._Bourne.news: Bournemouth 0-3 Watford: Nigel Pearson's side out of relegation zone with win
2:00pm, Sunday 12th January 2020._Bourne.response: Bournemouth's miserable run of form continued as Watford's 3-0 win at the Vitality Stadium saw Nigel Pearson's side move out of the relegation zone for the first time this season.
2:00pm, Sunday 12th January 2020._Bourne.detail: Abdoulaye Doucoure (42) gave Watford a first-half lead as they capitalised on an error from goalkeeper Mark Travers, before captain Troy Deeney (65) doubled the lead midway through the second half.

4:30pm, Sunday 12th January 2020._Aston.news: Aston Villa 1-6 Manchester City: Sergio Aguero scores hat-trick in rout
4:30pm, Sunday 12th January 2020._Aston.response: Manchester City showed no mercy in thrashing a troubled Aston Villa 6-1 on Super Sunday as Sergio Aguero's hat-trick made him the top non-English scorer in Premier League history.
4:30pm, Sunday 12th January 2020._Aston.detail: Villa were as woeful as City were devastating in the first half as the champions went in 4-0 up; Riyad Mahrez struck low at the near post for the opener (18), and then pounced on debutant Danny Drinkwater's mistake for the second (24).

12:30pm, Saturday 11th January 2020._Cry.news: Crystal Palace 1-1 Arsenal: Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang sent off
12:30pm, Saturday 11th January 2020._Cry.response: Arsenal had goalscorer and captain Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang sent off by the Video Assistant Referee (VAR) as they were held to a 1-1 draw by Crystal Palace at Selhurst Park.
12:30pm, Saturday 11th January 2020._Cry.detail: Arsenal took a 12th-minute lead when Aubameyang finished off a fine 18-pass move with his 16th goal of the season in all competitions.

3:00pm, Saturday 11th January 2020._Chel.news: Chelsea 3-0 Burnley: Blues breeze past Burnley to halt losing home run
3:00pm, Saturday 11th January 2020._Chel.response: Chelsea breezed past Burnley with a convincing 3-0 victory at Stamford Bridge, ending a run of two home Premier League games without a goal.
3:00pm, Saturday 11th January 2020._Chel.detail: Frank Lampard's side had been beaten by Bournemouth and Southampton in their recent home league encounters, but never looked like losing this time around, even when Jeff Hendrick nodded home in the 18th minute, which was correctly ruled out for offside by the linesman and VAR.

3:00pm, Saturday 11th January 2020._Ever.news: Everton 1-0 Brighton: Richarlison secures victory for Carlo Ancelotti
3:00pm, Saturday 11th January 2020._Ever.response: Richarlison scored a stunning solo goal as Everton returned to winning ways by beating Brighton 1-0 at Goodison Park on Saturday.
3:00pm, Saturday 11th January 2020._Ever.detail: The Toffees dominated the match but withstood a nervous finish with Seagulls striker Glenn Murray nearly equalising twice within the final 10 minutes, forcing an excellent save out of goalkeeper Jordan Pickford.

3:00pm, Saturday 11th January 2020._Leic.news: Leicester 1-2 Southampton: Danny Ings strikes late as Saints banish memory of 9-0 defeat
3:00pm, Saturday 11th January 2020._Leic.response: Southampton banished the memory of their 9-0 defeat to Leicester back in October and moved six points clear of the relegation zone with a well-deserved 2-1 victory at the King Power Stadium.
3:00pm, Saturday 11th January 2020._Leic.detail: Leicester midfielder Dennis Praet opened the scoring in the 14th minute but Stuart Armstrong's deflected effort (19) ensured Southampton, who hit the crossbar twice late in the first half through Danny Ings, went in at the break level.

3:00pm, Saturday 11th January 2020._Manc.news: Man Utd 4-0 Norwich: Marcus Rashford scores twice on 200th appearance
3:00pm, Saturday 11th January 2020._Manc.response: Marcus Rashford scored twice as Manchester United returned to winning ways with a thumping 4-0 victory over bottom side Norwich at Old Trafford.
3:00pm, Saturday 11th January 2020._Manc.detail: On his 200th appearance for United, Rashford tucked home a sublime Juan Mata cross to put the hosts ahead (27), before he doubled his and the hosts' tally just after the break with a penalty (52).

3:00pm, Saturday 11th January 2020._Wolv.news: Wolves 1-1 Newcastle: Miguel Almiron and Leander Dendoncker score in draw
3:00pm, Saturday 11th January 2020._Wolv.response: Newcastle battled through more injury issues to end a three-match losing run and earn a hard-fought 1-1 draw at Wolves.
3:00pm, Saturday 11th January 2020._Wolv.detail: Miguel Almiron gave Newcastle the lead with a fine first-time finish in the seventh minute.

5:30pm, Saturday 11th January 2020._Tott.news: Tottenham 0-1 Liverpool: Jurgen Klopp's side set new European points record
5:30pm, Saturday 11th January 2020._Tott.response: Liverpool's march towards the Premier League title continued as they beat Tottenham 1-0 at the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium to set a new European points record.
5:30pm, Saturday 11th January 2020._Tott.detail: Roberto Firmino scored the only goal of the game in the 37th minute as Jurgen Klopp's side, who have now gone 38 league games without defeat, sealed their 20th win of the season to move 16 points clear at the top of the Premier League.

8:00pm, Friday 10th January 2020._Sheffi.news: Sheff Utd 1-0 West Ham: VAR drama denies Hammers last-gasp point
8:00pm, Friday 10th January 2020._Sheffi.response: A late VAR handball decision denied West Ham a draw at Sheffield United as Oli McBurnie's goal proved enough to earn a 1-0 win.
8:00pm, Friday 10th January 2020._Sheffi.detail: David Martin, who had replaced the injured Lukasz Fabianski before half-time, misplaced a goal-kick straight to John Fleck eight minutes after half-time, and the Scot teed up his compatriot McBurnie to bundle in the opener from close range.

8:00pm, Thursday 2nd January 2020._Liver.news: Liverpool 2-0 Sheffield United: Leaders seal unbeaten calendar year in Premier League
8:00pm, Thursday 2nd January 2020._Liver.response: Liverpool restored their 13-point lead at the top of the Premier League with a 2-0 victory over Sheffield United that guarantees Jurgen Klopp's side an unbeaten calendar year in the top flight.
8:00pm, Thursday 2nd January 2020._Liver.detail: The runaway leaders last lost a league game at champions Manchester City on January 3, 2019, but Sheffield United's hopes of ending that run were extinguished by goals in either half by Mohamed Salah and Sadio Mane.

12:30pm, Wednesday 1st January 2020._Bri.news: Brighton 1-1 Chelsea: Alireza Jahanbakhsh overhead kick denies Blues
12:30pm, Wednesday 1st January 2020._Bri.response: Alireza Jahanbakhsh made it a festive period to remember after scoring a stunning overhead kick to deny Chelsea in a 1-1 draw with Brighton.
12:30pm, Wednesday 1st January 2020._Bri.detail: Fresh from scoring on his second appearance of the season against Bournemouth, the Iranian came off the bench to cancel out (84) Cesar Azpilicueta's first-half opener (10) for Chelsea with an outrageous bicycle kick.

12:30pm, Wednesday 1st January 2020._Bur.news: Burnley 1-2 Aston Villa: Jack Grealish inspires Dean Smith's side to second away win of season
12:30pm, Wednesday 1st January 2020._Bur.response: Jack Grealish produced an influential performance as Aston Villa climbed out of the relegation zone after securing their second away win of the season with a 2-1 victory at Burnley.
12:30pm, Wednesday 1st January 2020._Bur.detail: Wesley, whose heel cost Grealish a 12th-minute opener at Turf Moor after VAR controversially adjudged the striker to have been offside in the build-up, eventually gave Villa the lead with a much-needed goal after 27 minutes.

3:00pm, Wednesday 1st January 2020._Newc.news: Newcastle 0-3 Leicester: Foxes cruise past injury-struck Magpies
3:00pm, Wednesday 1st January 2020._Newc.response: Leicester cruised to a 3-0 win over Newcastle at St James' Park after the hosts were forced to play most of the second half with 10 men due to injuries.
3:00pm, Wednesday 1st January 2020._Newc.detail: Newcastle sat deep early on and allowed the visitors, who had a staggering 77 per cent possession, to pass along their defensive lines. But former Magpies forward Ayoze Perez capitalised on a loose pass from Florian Lejeune in the 36th minute to open the scoring.

3:00pm, Wednesday 1st January 2020._Sout.news: Southampton 1-0 Tottenham: Danny Ings scores again as Saints extend unbeaten run
3:00pm, Wednesday 1st January 2020._Sout.response: A super goal from Danny Ings was enough for Southampton to beat lacklustre Tottenham 1-0 and continue their recent unbeaten run.
3:00pm, Wednesday 1st January 2020._Sout.detail: Saints looked like the more energetic side from the first whistle and went ahead when Ings produced a confident, sweeping finish in the 17th minute as he enjoys his best scoring season.

3:00pm, Wednesday 1st January 2020._Watf.news: Watford 2-1 Wolves: Ten-man Hornets hold on for crucial win
3:00pm, Wednesday 1st January 2020._Watf.response: Ten-man Watford held on to beat Wolves 2-1 at Vicarage Road and boost their Premier League survival hopes in the process.
3:00pm, Wednesday 1st January 2020._Watf.detail: Gerard Deulofeu made the vital first breakthrough on the half-hour mark with an excellent finish into the bottom right-hand corner for his third goal against Wolves in all competitions.

5:30pm, Wednesday 1st January 2020._Manc.news: Man City 2-1 Everton: Gabriel Jesus at the double for champions
5:30pm, Wednesday 1st January 2020._Manc.response: A second-half Gabriel Jesus double gave Manchester City a 2-1 victory over Everton at the Etihad on New Year's Day.
5:30pm, Wednesday 1st January 2020._Manc.detail: VAR ruled out Phil Foden's early strike for an offside on Riyad Mahrez in the build-up, before Mahrez himself was denied a spot-kick by VAR after Lucas Digne's tug on his shirt.

5:30pm, Wednesday 1st January 2020._Norw.news: Norwich 1-1 Crystal Palace: Connor Wickham punishes wasteful hosts to earn point
5:30pm, Wednesday 1st January 2020._Norw.response: Connor Wickham's first Premier League goal in over three years secured a hard-fought point for Crystal Palace as Norwich were held to a 1-1 draw at Carrow Road.
5:30pm, Wednesday 1st January 2020._Norw.detail: Canaries boss Daniel Farke cut a dejected figure at the final whistle describing the result as "feeling like a loss" after seeing his side pegged back at home to draw for the second time in the space of four days following the 2-2 draw with Tottenham.

5:30pm, Wednesday 1st January 2020._West.news: West Ham 4-0 Bournemouth: Mark Noble double helps give David Moyes perfect debut
5:30pm, Wednesday 1st January 2020._West.response: David Moyes' West Ham return began in perfect fashion as his side rose out of the relegation zone with a 4-0 win over Bournemouth.
5:30pm, Wednesday 1st January 2020._West.detail: A confident Hammers performance got off to a fine start when Mark Noble's sidefoot from 20 yards was deflected past Aaron Ramsdale by the unfortunate Lewis Cook.

8:00pm, Wednesday 1st January 2020._Arse.news: Arsenal 2-0 Manchester United: Gunners claim first win under Mikel Arteta
8:00pm, Wednesday 1st January 2020._Arse.response: Arsenal kicked off the new year in style with a superb 2-0 win over Manchester United, handing Mikel Arteta his first victory in charge of the Gunners.
8:00pm, Wednesday 1st January 2020._Arse.detail: Arsenal - transformed from the blunt, directionless outfit of recent months into a high-intensity side by Arteta - struck at the beginning and end of the first half, with the impressive Nicolas Pepe (8) tucking in before Sokratis (42) smashed home a close-range finish to put the hosts in control.

2:00pm, Sunday 29th December 2019._Arsen.news: Arsenal 1-2 Chelsea: Tammy Abraham completes comeback as Mikel Arteta loses first home match
2:00pm, Sunday 29th December 2019._Arsen.response: Arsenal suffered a late collapse as Chelsea came from behind to claim a dramatic 2-1 win in Mikel Arteta's first home game in charge of the Gunners.
2:00pm, Sunday 29th December 2019._Arsen.detail: Arsenal seemed to be on course for victory at the Emirates Stadium as they went into the closing stages a goal up thanks to Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang's early header, but a glaring error from Bernd Leno allowed Jorginho to equalise from Mason Mount's free kick in the 83rd minute.

4:30pm, Sunday 29th December 2019._Liver.news: Liverpool 1-0 Wolves: More VAR controversy as Liverpool edge to victory
4:30pm, Sunday 29th December 2019._Liver.response: VAR was once again the centre of attention as Liverpool edged to a 1-0 win against Wolves, who had two huge calls go against them.
4:30pm, Sunday 29th December 2019._Liver.detail: After a VAR-laden win against Manchester City on Friday, Wolves were again frustrated by the technology at Anfield. The first review looked at a handball against Adam Lallana, whose knockdown was slotted home by Sadio Mane in the 42nd minute. The goal was eventually given by VAR after referee Antony Taylor had initially ruled it out.

6:00pm, Sunday 29th December 2019._Manch.news: Man City 2-0 Sheffield United: Sergio Aguero and Kevin De Bruyne seal victory
6:00pm, Sunday 29th December 2019._Manch.response: Goals from Sergio Aguero and Kevin De Bruyne saw Manchester City get back to winning ways with a 2-0 victory over Sheffield United at the Etihad Stadium.
6:00pm, Sunday 29th December 2019._Manch.detail: It was not all straight forward for the hosts though as United, who caused City plenty of problems in the first half, thought they had taken the lead in the 29th minute through Lys Mousset, but his effort was ruled out by VAR for offside.

12:30pm, Saturday 28th December 2019._Br.news: Brighton 2-0 Bournemouth: Aaron Mooy stars in Seagulls' key win
12:30pm, Saturday 28th December 2019._Br.response: Alireza Jahanbakhsh and Aaron Mooy scored their first goals for Brighton to earn an important 2-0 win for Graham Potter's side against south-coast rivals Bournemouth on Saturday.
12:30pm, Saturday 28th December 2019._Br.detail: The Iranian club-record signing finally got off the mark in his 27th appearance by firing home inside three minutes - Brighton's fastest goal in Premier League history.

3:00pm, Saturday 28th December 2019._New.news: Newcastle 1-2 Everton: Dominic Calvert-Lewin double gives Carlo Ancelotti second win
3:00pm, Saturday 28th December 2019._New.response: Everton's resurgence under Carlo Ancelotti continued as Dominic Calvert-Lewin's double gave them a 2-1 win over Newcastle at St James' Park.
3:00pm, Saturday 28th December 2019._New.detail: Calvert-Lewin proved the difference on Boxing Day as his goal gave Ancelotti victory in his first game over Burnley, and the 22-year-old Yorkshireman broke the deadlock with an instinctive finish after 13 minutes.

3:00pm, Saturday 28th December 2019._Sou.news: Southampton 1-1 Crystal Palace: Saints resurgence continues with entertaining draw
3:00pm, Saturday 28th December 2019._Sou.response: Southampton's recent resurgence continued on Saturday as they played out an entertaining 1-1 draw at home to Crystal Palace.
3:00pm, Saturday 28th December 2019._Sou.detail: Both teams were riding high after Boxing Day wins, but the first half was an ill-tempered affair. Max Meyer's 15th-minute strike was ruled out by VAR as Wilfried Zaha was caught offside, and Palace looked frustrated for much of the 45 minutes.

3:00pm, Saturday 28th December 2019._Wat.news: Watford 3-0 Aston Villa: Pressure rises on Villans after defeat to 10-man Hornets
3:00pm, Saturday 28th December 2019._Wat.response: Aston Villa's relegation woes worsened as Troy Deeney's double helped 10-man Watford to a 3-0 win at Vicarage Road.
3:00pm, Saturday 28th December 2019._Wat.detail: Deeney had put the hosts in front shortly before half-time in a one-sided opening period during which they enjoyed almost 65 per cent of possession and had 11 shots.

5:30pm, Saturday 28th December 2019._Nor.news: Norwich City 2-2 Tottenham: Harry Kane rescues point for error-strewn Spurs
5:30pm, Saturday 28th December 2019._Nor.response: Harry Kane's late penalty rescued a 2-2 draw for Tottenham after an error-strewn defensive performance looked to have gifted Norwich victory at Carrow Road.
5:30pm, Saturday 28th December 2019._Nor.detail: Norwich looked set to add Spurs to their list of Premier League scalps when Serge Aurier's own goal restored their lead after Mario Vrancic's first-half opener was cancelled out by Christian Eriksen's exquisite free-kick.

5:30pm, Saturday 28th December 2019._Wes.news: West Ham 1-2 Leicester: Foxes victory seals Manuel Pellegrini fate
5:30pm, Saturday 28th December 2019._Wes.response: Leicester piled the pressure on beleaguered West Ham, with a 2-1 win sealing the fate of boss Manuel Pellegrini.
5:30pm, Saturday 28th December 2019._Wes.detail: Reports ahead of kick-off suggested Pellegrini had two games - home matches against Leicester and Bournemouth - to save his job, but the Hammers confirmed his departure just hours after defeat to Brendan Rodgers' side.

7:45pm, Saturday 28th December 2019._Bur.news: Burnley 0-2 Manchester United: Anthony Martial and Marcus Rashford send Red Devils fifth
7:45pm, Saturday 28th December 2019._Bur.response: Manchester United moved into the top five with a fourth win in six games, beating Burnley 2-0 at Turf Moor on Saturday evening.
7:45pm, Saturday 28th December 2019._Bur.detail: United controlled the first half and went ahead just before the break as Anthony Martial capitalised on Charlie Taylor's error before calmly turning home (44).

7:45pm, Friday 27th December 2019._Wolve.news: Wolves 3-2 Man City: Matt Doherty hits winner as 10-man City blow two-goal lead
7:45pm, Friday 27th December 2019._Wolve.response: Ten-man Manchester City blew a two-goal lead as Wolves produced a stunning second-half comeback to win 3-2 on a dramatic evening at Molineux.
7:45pm, Friday 27th December 2019._Wolve.detail: Raheem Sterling had scored twice (25, 50) even after Ederson's early red card but Adama Traore pulled one back (55) and set up Raul Jimenez for the equaliser before Matt Doherty's late winner.

12:30pm, Thursday 26th December 2019._To.news: Tottenham 2-1 Brighton: Dele Alli stunner gives Spurs comeback win
12:30pm, Thursday 26th December 2019._To.response: Dele Alli's sumptuous strike earned Tottenham a 2-1 victory over a stubborn Brighton side as the hosts came from behind at the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium.
12:30pm, Thursday 26th December 2019._To.detail: Adam Webster headed Brighton into a deserved 37th-minute lead, the centre-back's third Premier League goal of the season.

3:00pm, Thursday 26th December 2019._Ast.news: Aston Villa 1-0 Norwich: Sub Conor Hourihane gives Villa first win in six
3:00pm, Thursday 26th December 2019._Ast.response: Substitute Conor Hourihane hit a vital winner as Aston Villa picked up their first victory in six games, beating Norwich 1-0 at Villa Park.
3:00pm, Thursday 26th December 2019._Ast.detail: Both sides went close in a goalless first half as Norwich hit the bar through Sam Byram's header, while Villa's Anwar El Ghazi swept a first-time effort inches wide.

3:00pm, Thursday 26th December 2019._Bou.news: Bournemouth 1-1 Arsenal: Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang rescues point for Mikel Arteta's side
3:00pm, Thursday 26th December 2019._Bou.response: Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang's second-half strike rescued a point for Arsenal as Mikel Arteta’s first game in charge ended in a 1-1 draw at Bournemouth.
3:00pm, Thursday 26th December 2019._Bou.detail: Dan Gosling put Bournemouth in front in the 35th minute but the Gunners fought back after the break as Aubameyang's 12th Premier League goal of the season (63) ensured Arteta avoided defeat in his first match as a head coach.

3:00pm, Thursday 26th December 2019._Che.news: Chelsea 0-2 Southampton: Michael Obafemi and Nathan Redmond on target as Saints claim shock win
3:00pm, Thursday 26th December 2019._Che.response: Michael Obafemi and Nathan Redmond were on target as Southampton consigned Chelsea to a second consecutive defeat at Stamford Bridge.
3:00pm, Thursday 26th December 2019._Che.detail: Academy product Obafemi, starting in place of the rested Danny Ings, gave Southampton the lead when he curled home a stunning left-footed effort from the edge of the box (31) after Chelsea had lost possession in midfield.

3:00pm, Thursday 26th December 2019._Cry.news: Crystal Palace 2-1 West Ham: Super Jordan Ayew goal wins it for Eagles
3:00pm, Thursday 26th December 2019._Cry.response: A super Jordan Ayew goal secured a late 2-1 win for Crystal Palace against West Ham, giving the hosts their first win in three games.
3:00pm, Thursday 26th December 2019._Cry.detail: It was a battle of wills in the first half with defences coming out on top, but the second half was a much more open affair and West Ham broke the deadlock when Robert Snodgrass slotted home (57).

3:00pm, Thursday 26th December 2019._Eve.news: Everton 1-0 Burnley: Dominic Calvert-Lewin nets as Carlo Ancelotti is off and running at Goodison Park
3:00pm, Thursday 26th December 2019._Eve.response: Carlo Ancelotti started his reign at Everton with a battling 1-0 win over Burnley after Dominic Calvert-Lewin netted 10 minutes from time with a superb header.
3:00pm, Thursday 26th December 2019._Eve.detail: The Toffees have yet to taste defeat since the sacking of Marco Silva, with Ancelotti using the momentum of Duncan Ferguson's tenure to get over the line in this scrappy encounter.

3:00pm, Thursday 26th December 2019._She.news: Sheffield United 1-1 Watford: Ben Foster stars as Hornets thwart Blades
3:00pm, Thursday 26th December 2019._She.response: Ben Foster starred as resurgent Watford thwarted high-flying Sheffield United to earn a 1-1 draw that lifted them off the bottom of the Premier League table.
3:00pm, Thursday 26th December 2019._She.detail: Gerard Deulofeu had given Nigel Pearson's newly-buoyed side a 27th-minute lead against the run of play, before Oliver Norwood's spot-kick (36) restored deserved parity for the hosts.

5:30pm, Thursday 26th December 2019._Man.news: Manchester United 4-1 Newcastle: Anthony Martial sparks comeback
5:30pm, Thursday 26th December 2019._Man.response: Anthony Martial, Mason Greenwood and Marcus Rashford were all on target as Manchester United roared back from a goal down to secure an emphatic 4-1 victory over Newcastle at Old Trafford.
5:30pm, Thursday 26th December 2019._Man.detail: Four days on from their abject defeat at Watford, Manchester United's festive period looked set to take a further turn for the worse when Matty Longstaff - the match-winner in October's reverse fixture - fired Newcastle into a 17th-minute lead.

8:00pm, Thursday 26th December 2019._Lei.news: Leicester 0-4 Liverpool: Reds thrash nearest rivals to extend lead
8:00pm, Thursday 26th December 2019._Lei.response: Liverpool extended their lead at the top of the Premier League with an emphatic 4-0 win over closest challengers Leicester at the King Power Stadium.
8:00pm, Thursday 26th December 2019._Lei.detail: Two goals from Roberto Firmino, a penalty by substitute James Milner and a sweet strike by star of the show Trent Alexander-Arnold gave the newly crowned world champions a thoroughly deserved victory.

2:00pm, Sunday 22nd December 2019._Watfo.news: Watford 2-0 Manchester United: David de Gea howler helps gift Nigel Pearson first win as Hornets boss
2:00pm, Sunday 22nd December 2019._Watfo.response: David de Gea's poor form lurched from bad to worse as his goalkeeping howler helped Watford secure a 2-0 win over Manchester United at Vicarage Road.
2:00pm, Sunday 22nd December 2019._Watfo.detail: Ismaila Sarr's shot five minutes into the second period lacked power, but somehow squirmed through De Gea's grasp, adding to the lack of aerial command he showed for Everton's opening goal during last Sunday's 1-1 draw at Old Trafford.

4:30pm, Sunday 22nd December 2019._Totte.news: Tottenham 0-2 Chelsea: Willian double inspires Blues amid racism storm
4:30pm, Sunday 22nd December 2019._Totte.response: Willian's double inspired Chelsea back to winning ways as a 2-0 victory over Tottenham saw Frank Lampard haunt Jose Mourinho - but the victory was overshadowed by allegations of racist abuse.
4:30pm, Sunday 22nd December 2019._Totte.detail: Willian whipped Chelsea into the lead on 12 minutes and doubled his tally when he converted a VAR-awarded penalty on the stroke of half-time, and that was enough as Lampard outwitted his former manager to inflict the Portuguese's first defeat against a club he used to manage at the 14th attempt.

12:30pm, Saturday 21st December 2019._Ev.news: Everton 0-0 Arsenal: Carlo Ancelotti and Mikel Arteta watch Goodison Park stalemate
12:30pm, Saturday 21st December 2019._Ev.response: New Everton manager Carlo Ancelotti and Arsenal head coach Mikel Arteta looked on from the stands at Goodison Park as their respective new sides played out a dour goalless draw on Saturday lunchtime.
12:30pm, Saturday 21st December 2019._Ev.detail: Ancelotti was confirmed as Marco Silva's replacement just before kick-off, meaning Duncan Ferguson and Freddie Ljungberg remained in caretaker charge of Everton and Arsenal for the last time.

3:00pm, Saturday 21st December 2019._Ast.news: Aston Villa 1-3 Southampton: Danny Ings double lifts Saints above Villa
3:00pm, Saturday 21st December 2019._Ast.response: Danny Ings scored twice to help Southampton climb out of the relegation places and send Aston Villa into the bottom three with a convincing 3-1 win at Villa Park.
3:00pm, Saturday 21st December 2019._Ast.detail: Villa lost their talismanic midfielder John McGinn after just five minutes, when he appeared to twist his ankle after a meaty block on Cedric, but things turned from bad to worse for Dean Smith's side.

3:00pm, Saturday 21st December 2019._Bou.news: Bournemouth 0-1 Burnley: Jay Rodriguez's late goal hands Burnley scrappy win
3:00pm, Saturday 21st December 2019._Bou.response: Jay Rodriguez's 89th-minute goal handed Burnley a scrappy 1-0 win against Bournemouth in torrential conditions at the Vitality Stadium.
3:00pm, Saturday 21st December 2019._Bou.detail: The rain and wind created difficult conditions on the south coast, but the game was littered with fouls, free-kicks and bookings. The pick of the first-half action was Simon Francis and Ryan Fraser giving Bournemouth some injury scares, but the hosts escaped any more casualties in their treatment room.

3:00pm, Saturday 21st December 2019._Bri.news: Brighton 0-1 Sheffield United: Blades maintain unbeaten away run to go fifth
3:00pm, Saturday 21st December 2019._Bri.response: Sheffield United overcame having two goals ruled out by VAR to beat Brighton 1-0 as they moved up to fifth in the Premier League table.
3:00pm, Saturday 21st December 2019._Bri.detail: Oli McBurnie's strike (24) for the Blades was sandwiched in between overturned goals by John Egan, for handball, and Jack O'Connell, for a clear offside.

3:00pm, Saturday 21st December 2019._New.news: Newcastle 1-0 Crystal Palace: Miguel Almiron's first Premier League goal secures victory
3:00pm, Saturday 21st December 2019._New.response: Miguel Almiron ended a run of 26 games without a goal to finally break his Newcastle United goal drought and hand Steve Bruce's side a 1-0 victory over Crystal Palace at St James' Park.
3:00pm, Saturday 21st December 2019._New.detail: With the game appearing to be heading for a stalemate, Almiron (83) picked an ideal time to open his account and score his first Premier League goal for the club, driving the ball past Crystal Palace goalkeeper Vicente Guaita after latching on to Andy Carroll's knockdown.

3:00pm, Saturday 21st December 2019._Nor.news: Norwich 1-2 Wolves: Raul Jimenez punishes Canaries with late winner
3:00pm, Saturday 21st December 2019._Nor.response: Raul Jimenez took advantage of Norwich's profligacy to score a late winner for Wolves in a 2-1 victory at Carrow Road.
3:00pm, Saturday 21st December 2019._Nor.detail: Todd Cantwell gave Norwich a half-time lead with a powerful strike following Jonny's mistake, but the Canaries should have led by more with Wolves significantly below-par.

5:30pm, Saturday 21st December 2019._Man.news: Manchester City 3-1 Leicester City: Champions fight back to flatten Foxes
5:30pm, Saturday 21st December 2019._Man.response: Manchester City came from behind to end Leicester's nine-game unbeaten run in the Premier League with a 3-1 victory at the Etihad Stadium on Saturday Night Football.
5:30pm, Saturday 21st December 2019._Man.detail: The champions looked set to lose more ground in the title race when Jamie Vardy continued his red-hot form with a stunning lofted finish on the breakaway - his 16th Premier League goal of the season - midway through the first half.

7:45pm, Monday 16th December 2019._Cryst.news: Crystal Palace 1-1 Brighton: Wilfried Zaha snatches late draw for Eagles
7:45pm, Monday 16th December 2019._Cryst.response: Wilfried Zaha made the most of Crystal Palace's late resurgence as his fine solo effort earned them a 1-1 draw with Brighton.
7:45pm, Monday 16th December 2019._Cryst.detail: The Palace talisman, so often out of form this season, was at his very best to deceive Martin Montoya, turn outside the Brighton full-back and blast a rising effort inside Mat Ryan's near post with 14 minutes to go.

2:00pm, Sunday 15th December 2019._Manch.news: Manchester United 1-1 Everton: Duncan Ferguson inspires Toffees to Old Trafford point
2:00pm, Sunday 15th December 2019._Manch.response: Mason Greenwood came off the bench to rescue a point for Manchester United as Everton's improvement under Duncan Ferguson continued in a 1-1 draw.
2:00pm, Sunday 15th December 2019._Manch.detail: Everton played with great tenacity and character, taking the lead courtesy of a Victor Lindelof own-goal (37) but United always carried a threat and substitute Greenwood skilfully drilled one home from the edge of the box to level it home (77).

2:00pm, Sunday 15th December 2019._Wolve.news: Wolves 1-2 Tottenham: Jan Vertonghen heads injury-time Spurs winner
2:00pm, Sunday 15th December 2019._Wolve.response: Jan Vertonghen headed an injury-time winner as Tottenham snatched an unlikely 2-1 win at Wolves to move to within three points of the Premier League's top four.
2:00pm, Sunday 15th December 2019._Wolve.detail: Adama Traore, Vertonghen's chief tormentor at a sodden Molineux, looked to have earned the hosts a point that was the least they deserved (67) for a dominant display when he cancelled out Lucas Moura's early opener with a blistering strike.

4:30pm, Sunday 15th December 2019._Arsen.news: Arsenal 0-3 Man City: Kevin De Bruyne stars as woeful Arsenal crumble
4:30pm, Sunday 15th December 2019._Arsen.response: Two fine goals and an assist for Kevin De Bruyne inspired Manchester City to a 3-0 win over a woeful Arsenal in the Premier League on Super Sunday.
4:30pm, Sunday 15th December 2019._Arsen.detail: The Manchester City of old turned up in the first half, racing into a 3-0 lead before the break, largely down to a De Bruyne masterclass. He put City ahead with a brilliantly controlled rebounded half volley (2), before squaring for Raheem Sterling to double their lead (15).

12:30pm, Saturday 14th December 2019._Li.news: Liverpool 2-0 Watford: Mohamed Salah scores twice for Premier League leaders
12:30pm, Saturday 14th December 2019._Li.response: Mohamed Salah's superb double gave an under-par Liverpool a 2-0 victory over bottom side Watford to extend their lead at the top of the Premier League.
12:30pm, Saturday 14th December 2019._Li.detail: After his goal in midweek, Salah showed he was back to his best again with a fine turn and curling finish to give Liverpool the lead (38), but that came sandwiched between two big Watford chances as both Abdoulaye Doucoure and Ismaila Sarr fluffed from fine positions.

3:00pm, Saturday 14th December 2019._Bur.news: Burnley 1-0 Newcastle: Chris Wood heads Clarets winner at Turf Moor
3:00pm, Saturday 14th December 2019._Bur.response: Chris Wood scored the only goal of the game as Burnley got back to winning ways with a hard-earned 1-0 victory over Newcastle at Turf Moor.
3:00pm, Saturday 14th December 2019._Bur.detail: The Burnley striker headed home after 58 minutes - the New Zealand international's seventh goal in his last 10 matches.

3:00pm, Saturday 14th December 2019._Che.news: Chelsea 0-1 Bournemouth: Dan Gosling scores dramatic winner - with help from VAR
3:00pm, Saturday 14th December 2019._Che.response: Bournemouth recorded a shock 1-0 win at Chelsea for their under-pressure manager Eddie Howe as VAR came to the fore late on to award Dan Gosling's winning goal.
3:00pm, Saturday 14th December 2019._Che.detail: Gosling's looping effort (84) was originally disallowed for offside by the referee but a VAR check revealed that it was Dominic Solanke that was in an offside position and, as he was not interfering with play, the goal was given.

3:00pm, Saturday 14th December 2019._Lei.news: Leicester 1-1 Norwich: Foxes held to fall 10 points behind Liverpool
3:00pm, Saturday 14th December 2019._Lei.response: Leicester fell 10 points behind Liverpool in the Premier League title race as Norwich produced a resilient display to earn a 1-1 draw at the King Power Stadium.
3:00pm, Saturday 14th December 2019._Lei.detail: Liverpool had extended their lead at the top courtesy of a 2-0 win over Watford at Anfield, but as Brendan Rodgers' side sought to close the gap with a ninth consecutive league win, they ran into a resolute Canaries outfit who were good value for their point.

3:00pm, Saturday 14th December 2019._She.news: Sheffield United 2-0 Aston Villa: John Fleck double secures comfortable win
3:00pm, Saturday 14th December 2019._She.response: John Fleck struck twice in the second half to seal a 2-0 victory for Sheffield United against Aston Villa, who missed a late penalty through Jack Grealish.
3:00pm, Saturday 14th December 2019._She.detail: Sheffield United failed to register a single shot on target during an uneventful first half at Bramall Lane but they opened the scoring five minutes after the restart as Fleck put the finishing touches on a fine team move involving Chris Basham and John Lundstram.

5:30pm, Saturday 14th December 2019._Sou.news: Southampton 0-1 West Ham: Sebastien Haller ends goalless run with priceless winner
5:30pm, Saturday 14th December 2019._Sou.response: Sebastien Haller's first goal in more than 10 hours of football provided a vital winner for West Ham as they won 1-0 at Southampton.
5:30pm, Saturday 14th December 2019._Sou.detail: The French striker, recalled to the starting line-up for Felipe Anderson, turned Pablo Fornals' knock-down in off the far post in the only goal of the game in a much-improved Hammers performance, which relieves some of the considerable pressure on under-fire manager Manuel Pellegrini.

8:00pm, Monday 9th December 2019._West H.news: West Ham 1-3 Arsenal: Three quick goals give Arsenal long-awaited win
8:00pm, Monday 9th December 2019._West H.response: Three goals in nine second-half minutes gave Arsenal a 3-1 victory at West Ham, ending their nine-match winless streak.
8:00pm, Monday 9th December 2019._West H.detail: After a slow start, West Ham took the lead as Angelo Ogbonna's header deflected off Ainsley Maitland-Niles' head and wrongfooted Bernd Leno (38).

2:00pm, Sunday 8th December 2019._Aston.news: Aston Villa 1-4 Leicester: Jamie Vardy scores two as Foxes win again
2:00pm, Sunday 8th December 2019._Aston.response: Leicester beat Aston Villa 4-1 at Villa Park, with Jamie Vardy scoring twice to cement their grip on second spot in the Premier League.
2:00pm, Sunday 8th December 2019._Aston.detail: Vardy started and finished the scoring, netting for the eighth game in a row, while Kelechi Iheanacho and Jonny Evans were also on target either side of Jack Grealish's strike.

2:00pm, Sunday 8th December 2019._Newcas.news: Newcastle 2-1 Southampton: Federico Fernandez nets late winner as Toon come from behind
2:00pm, Sunday 8th December 2019._Newcas.response: Newcastle won their fourth game from their last six matches courtesy of a spirited comeback that saw them beat Southampton 2-1.
2:00pm, Sunday 8th December 2019._Newcas.detail: Danny Ings scored for the fifth game running (51) to give Saints the lead, but the game swung in Newcastle's favour with the introduction of Andy Carroll on 59 minutes and he swung in the cross that Jonjo Shelvey headed home (51) to make it 1-1.

2:00pm, Sunday 8th December 2019._Norwic.news: Norwich 1-2 Sheffield United: Enda Stevens and George Baldock secure comeback win
2:00pm, Sunday 8th December 2019._Norwic.response: Second-half goals from wing-backs Enda Stevens and George Baldock helped Sheffield United come from behind to beat Norwich 2-1 at Carrow Road.
2:00pm, Sunday 8th December 2019._Norwic.detail: Alex Tettey opened the scoring with a smart finish from Emiliano Buendia's corner in the 27th minute, before Stevens met Baldock's cross to head the Blades level just after half-time (49).

4:30pm, Sunday 8th December 2019._Bright.news: Brighton 2-2 Wolves: Nuno Espirito Santo's side extend unbeaten run to 11 games
4:30pm, Sunday 8th December 2019._Bright.response: Wolves stretched their unbeaten run in the Premier League to 11 games after a 2-2 draw with Brighton at the Amex Stadium.
4:30pm, Sunday 8th December 2019._Bright.detail: Diogo Jota started the scoring, finishing from close range in the 28th minute, but two goals in under two minutes turned the game on its head as Brighton took the lead thanks to goals from Neal Maupay (34) and Davy Propper (36).

12:30pm, Saturday 7th December 2019._Eve.news: Everton 3-1 Chelsea: Dominic Calvert-Lewin double gives Duncan Ferguson superb win
12:30pm, Saturday 7th December 2019._Eve.response: Dominic Calvert-Lewin's double gave Duncan Ferguson a perfect start as Everton caretaker as they beat Chelsea 3-1 at Goodison Park.
12:30pm, Saturday 7th December 2019._Eve.detail: Thrust into his first managerial role following the departure of Marco Silva on Thursday, Ferguson was celebrating wildly on the touchline inside five minutes when Richarlison headed Djibril Sidibe's cross past Kepa Arrizabalaga.

3:00pm, Saturday 7th December 2019._Bour.news: Bournemouth 0-3 Liverpool: Reds remain unbeaten with win against luckless Cherries
3:00pm, Saturday 7th December 2019._Bour.response: Liverpool surged 11 points clear at the top of the Premier League after a 3-0 win against Bournemouth, who lost Nathan Ake and Callum Wilson to injury.
3:00pm, Saturday 7th December 2019._Bour.detail: Jurgen Klopp's side barely made it out of third gear at the Vitality Stadium, and Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (35) opened up the scoring just a minute after Ake - who had been Bournemouth's best defender until that point - to an apparent hamstring strain.

3:00pm, Saturday 7th December 2019._Tott.news: Tottenham 5-0 Burnley: Heung-Min Son solo goal helps Spurs thrash Burnley
3:00pm, Saturday 7th December 2019._Tott.response: Heung-Min Son scored a goal-of-the-season contender as Tottenham hammered Burnley 5-0 on Saturday.
3:00pm, Saturday 7th December 2019._Tott.detail: The Tottenham forward picked up the ball on the edge of his own box and skipped past a flurry of challenges as he surged to the other end of the field before coolly slotting home (32) the hosts' third of the afternoon.

3:00pm, Saturday 7th December 2019._Watf.news: Watford 0-0 Crystal Palace: Palace hold Hornets to goalless draw at Vicarage Road
3:00pm, Saturday 7th December 2019._Watf.response: Watford ended a run of three defeats with a goalless stalemate against Crystal Palace at Vicarage Road.
3:00pm, Saturday 7th December 2019._Watf.detail: New head coach Nigel Pearson was watching from the stands as caretaker boss Hayden Mullins oversaw duties from the dugout for the second game running.

5:30pm, Saturday 7th December 2019._Manc.news: Manchester City 1-2 Manchester United: First-half United magic leaves City 14 behind Liverpool
5:30pm, Saturday 7th December 2019._Manc.response: Manchester United stunned Manchester City with a devastating first-half display as they won 2-1 at the Etihad to leave the champions 14 points behind Liverpool.
5:30pm, Saturday 7th December 2019._Manc.detail: United were as spectacular as City were shoddy in the first half, as the visitors raced into a 2-0 lead; Marcus Rashford's penalty, via VAR, put them ahead (23), before Anthony Martial squeezed a low strike off the post from 18 yards (29).

7:30pm, Thursday 5th December 2019._Shef.news: Sheff Utd 0-2 Newcastle: VAR awards Jonjo Shelvey goal after Allan Saint-Maximin scores first
7:30pm, Thursday 5th December 2019._Shef.response: A first Allan Saint-Maximin goal and a VAR-awarded Jonjo Shelvey strike gave Newcastle a 2-0 win at Sheffield United.
7:30pm, Thursday 5th December 2019._Shef.detail: In a game dominated by the hosts, Saint-Maximin's well-placed header gave Newcastle the lead with their only shot on target of the first half, turning Javier Manquillo's excellent cross back inside the near post.

8:15pm, Thursday 5th December 2019._Arse.news: Arsenal 1-2 Brighton: Neal Maupay seals historic win for Seagulls
8:15pm, Thursday 5th December 2019._Arse.response: Brighton piled the misery on Arsenal with a hard-fought and deserved 2-1 win at the Emirates Stadium, where boos rung out at full-time in interim boss Freddie Ljungberg's first home game in charge.
8:15pm, Thursday 5th December 2019._Arse.detail: The visitors had never previously won away at Arsenal but they dominated the first half and withstood an Arsenal assault after the break before Neal Maupay headed home the decisive goal on 80 minutes.

7:30pm, Wednesday 4th December 2019._Che.news: Chelsea 2-1 Aston Villa: Mason Mount cracker earns Blues win on John Terry's return
7:30pm, Wednesday 4th December 2019._Che.response: Chelsea returned to winning ways as Mason Mount's thunderous volley secured a 2-1 victory over Aston Villa in the Premier League at Stamford Bridge.
7:30pm, Wednesday 4th December 2019._Che.detail: The hosts broke the deadlock when Tammy Abraham rose to head in his 11th Premier League goal of the season (24) against the side he scored 26 times for on loan in the Championship last season.

7:30pm, Wednesday 4th December 2019._Lei.news: Leicester 2-0 Watford: Jamie Vardy scores for seventh league game in a row
7:30pm, Wednesday 4th December 2019._Lei.response: Jamie Vardy and James Maddison scored as Leicester won a record seventh straight Premier League game with a 2-0 victory over Watford.
7:30pm, Wednesday 4th December 2019._Lei.detail: Vardy, who was also on target for the seventh league game in a row, scored from the spot 10 minutes after the break after Jonny Evans had been awarded a soft penalty for a hand in the face from Adam Masina.

7:30pm, Wednesday 4th December 2019._Man.news: Manchester United 2-1 Tottenham: Marcus Rashford double eases pressure on Ole Gunnar Solskjaer
7:30pm, Wednesday 4th December 2019._Man.response: Marcus Rashford scored twice for Manchester United as they beat Tottenham 2-1 to leave Jose Mourinho empty handed on his return to Old Trafford.
7:30pm, Wednesday 4th December 2019._Man.detail: Rashford struck early in the first half, before the hosts were pegged back before the break by a superb Dele Alli goal. Rashford then converted the winner shortly after the break from a penalty he won himself to ease some of the pressure on Ole Gunnar Solskjaer.

7:30pm, Wednesday 4th December 2019._Sou.news: Southampton 2-1 Norwich: Saints beat another Premier League relegation rival
7:30pm, Wednesday 4th December 2019._Sou.response: Southampton beat another Premier League relegation rival, edging to a nervy 2-1 win against Norwich at St Mary's.
7:30pm, Wednesday 4th December 2019._Sou.detail: The Saints' 2-1 victory against rock-bottom Watford on Saturday had seen them go one point and one place above Norwich, and they made the perfect start when the in-form Danny Ings (22) nodded home from a James Ward-Prowse free-kick.

7:30pm, Wednesday 4th December 2019._Wol.news: Wolves 2-0 West Ham: Nuno Espirito Santo's side move up to fifth
7:30pm, Wednesday 4th December 2019._Wol.response: Wolves produced a dominant performance to beat West Ham 2-0 at Molineux and move up to fifth in the Premier League table.
7:30pm, Wednesday 4th December 2019._Wol.detail: Leander Dendoncker's goal gave the home side the lead midway through the first half and substitute Patrick Cutrone put the seal on the victory with a late second.

8:15pm, Wednesday 4th December 2019._Liv.news: Liverpool 5-2 Everton: First-half goal bonanza leaves Toffees in sticky situation
8:15pm, Wednesday 4th December 2019._Liv.response: Liverpool maintained their Merseyside stranglehold over Everton with a 5-2 win over their rivals to remain eight points clear at the top of the Premier League.
8:15pm, Wednesday 4th December 2019._Liv.detail: In one of the showpiece fixtures of the season under the lights at Anfield, the game lived up to its billing in an extraordinary first half which saw six goals scored.

7:30pm, Tuesday 3rd December 2019._Cryst.news: Crystal Palace 1-0 Bournemouth: Eddie Howe's side lose again at Selhurst Park
7:30pm, Tuesday 3rd December 2019._Cryst.response: Bournemouth lost their fourth Premier League game in a row as they were beaten 1-0 by 10-man Crystal Palace, who themselves move into fifth ahead of the remaining midweek games.
7:30pm, Tuesday 3rd December 2019._Cryst.detail: The game could not have started worse for the Eagles as Mamadou Sakho was sent off in the 19th minute after catching Adam Smith on the knee with a high foot, before Patrick van Aanholt was taken off with an injury not long after.

8:15pm, Tuesday 3rd December 2019._Burnl.news: Burnley 1-4 Man City: Gabriel Jesus scores twice as Pep Guardiola's side return to winning ways
8:15pm, Tuesday 3rd December 2019._Burnl.response: Gabriel Jesus struck twice to get Manchester City back to winning ways and back up to second in the Premier League with a 4-1 victory at Burnley on Tuesday night.
8:15pm, Tuesday 3rd December 2019._Burnl.detail: City - who fell further away from runaway leaders Liverpool at the weekend - closed back to within eight points of Jurgen Klopp's side in the table ahead of the Merseyside derby on Wednesday night.

2:00pm, Sunday 1st December 2019._Norwic.news: Norwich 2-2 Arsenal: Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang rescues a point in Freddie Ljungberg's first game in charge
2:00pm, Sunday 1st December 2019._Norwic.response: Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang came to Arsenal's rescue twice as the Gunners secured a 2-2 draw at Norwich in Freddie Ljungberg's first game as the club's interim head coach.
2:00pm, Sunday 1st December 2019._Norwic.detail: Teemu Pukki (21) opened the scoring for the hosts before Aubameyang (29) scored from the penalty spot at the second time of asking following a handball by Christoph Zimmermann in the penalty area.

2:00pm, Sunday 1st December 2019._Wolver.news: Wolves 1-1 Sheffield United: Matt Doherty cancels out Lys Mousset's opener
2:00pm, Sunday 1st December 2019._Wolver.response: Sheffield United made it seven Premier League away games without defeat as they drew 1-1 with Wolves at Molineux.
2:00pm, Sunday 1st December 2019._Wolver.detail: Lys Mousset gave the visitors the lead with just 62 seconds on the clock, before John Fleck and David McGoldrick passed up chances to extend their advantage either side of half-time.

4:30pm, Sunday 1st December 2019._Leices.news: Leicester City 2-1 Everton: Last-gasp VAR drama as Kelechi Iheanacho floors visitors
4:30pm, Sunday 1st December 2019._Leices.response: Kelechi Iheanacho's late VAR-awarded winner piled more misery on Marco Silva as Leicester reclaimed second spot in the Premier League with a dramatic 2-1 victory over Everton at the King Power Stadium.
4:30pm, Sunday 1st December 2019._Leices.detail: Substitute Iheanacho broke Everton hearts in the fifth minute of stoppage-time when he was allowed to stride through and slot his first Premier League goal of the season past Jordan Pickford despite being flagged for offside.

4:30pm, Sunday 1st December 2019._Manche.news: Manchester United 2-2 Aston Villa: Jack Grealish scores stunner as Man Utd held to draw
4:30pm, Sunday 1st December 2019._Manche.response: Manchester United drew 2-2 with Aston Villa at Old Trafford as Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's side were held by a newly-promoted side for the second game in a row.
4:30pm, Sunday 1st December 2019._Manche.detail: United played out a dramatic 3-3 draw at Sheffield United last weekend, and things started in much the same way as a stunning Jack Grealish goal opened the scoring inside 11 minutes.

12:30pm, Saturday 30th November 2019._Ne.news: Newcastle 2-2 Manchester City: Jonjo Shelvey's late strike stuns champions
12:30pm, Saturday 30th November 2019._Ne.response: Manchester City dropped two points at St James' Park as Jonjo Shelvey's stunning late strike saw Newcastle earn a 2-2 draw with the champions.
12:30pm, Saturday 30th November 2019._Ne.detail: The visitors opened the scoring midway through the first half thanks to Raheem Sterling's well-taken effort, the forward's 15th goal of another productive season, only for Jetro Willems' low drive to immediately draw Newcastle level.

3:00pm, Saturday 30th November 2019._Bur.news: Burnley 0-2 Crystal Palace: Roy Hodgson's side end run of five games without a win
3:00pm, Saturday 30th November 2019._Bur.response: Crystal Palace ended a run of five Premier League games without a win by beating Burnley 2-0 at Turf Moor.
3:00pm, Saturday 30th November 2019._Bur.detail: Wilfried Zaha put Palace ahead in first-half stoppage time, striking the ball through Nick Pope at his near post before substitute Jeffrey Schlupp capitalised on a mistake by Ben Mee in the 78th minute to secure all three points for the visitors.

3:00pm, Saturday 30th November 2019._Che.news: Chelsea 0-1 West Ham: Aaron Cresswell strike eases pressure on Manuel Pellegrini
3:00pm, Saturday 30th November 2019._Che.response: West Ham ended a 17-year wait for a Premier League victory at Stamford Bridge as Aaron Cresswell's strike saw them beat Chelsea 1-0 to ease the pressure on manager Manuel Pellegrini.
3:00pm, Saturday 30th November 2019._Che.detail: Cresswell scored the decisive goal three minutes into the second half, curling a low right-footed shot beyond Kepa Arrizabalaga, and the Hammers' victory would have been more secure had Michail Antonio not had a second ruled out by VAR.

3:00pm, Saturday 30th November 2019._Liv.news: Liverpool 2-1 Brighton: Leaders avoid late scare to go 11 points clear
3:00pm, Saturday 30th November 2019._Liv.response: Liverpool avoided a big late scare with 10 men to hold on for a 2-1 victory over Brighton, stretching their lead to 11 points at the top of the Premier League.
3:00pm, Saturday 30th November 2019._Liv.detail: Two Virgil van Dijk headers put Liverpool in control in the first half, first from Trent Alexander-Arnold's free-kick (18), and then from the full-back's corner from the left (24).

3:00pm, Saturday 30th November 2019._Tot.news: Tottenham 3-2 Bournemouth: Spurs hold on after Dele Alli double
3:00pm, Saturday 30th November 2019._Tot.response: Tottenham's resurgence under Jose Mourinho continued as Dele Alli scored twice in a thrilling 3-2 win over Bournemouth in the Premier League.
3:00pm, Saturday 30th November 2019._Tot.detail: Spurs were cruising with 20 minutes remaining when, following on from Alli's double (21, 50), Moussa Sissoko finished off a sweeping move to make it 3-0 (69).

5:30pm, Saturday 30th November 2019._Sou.news: Southampton 2-1 Watford: James Ward-Prowse free-kick fires Saints to precious win
5:30pm, Saturday 30th November 2019._Sou.response: James Ward-Prowse fired Southampton to a precious 2-1 victory against fellow relegation strugglers Watford and earned them their first home win since April.
5:30pm, Saturday 30th November 2019._Sou.detail: Both teams were languishing at the bottom of the table heading into the vital game at St Mary's, and it was Watford who got themselves ahead in the first half as Ismaila Sarr (24) coolly finished for his first Premier League goal.

8:00pm, Monday 25th November 2019._Aston.news: Aston Villa 2-0 Newcastle: Conor Hourihane stars for Aston Villa
8:00pm, Monday 25th November 2019._Aston.response: Conor Hourihane scored one and made one for Aston Villa in a 2-0 win over Newcastle as the midfielder haunted Steve Bruce, who signed him for Villa.
8:00pm, Monday 25th November 2019._Aston.detail: It was an inspired decision from current Villa boss Dean Smith to start Hourihane as he looked to arrest a run of three straight Premier League games. The Irishman curled home the opener with a clever free-kick (32) before laying on the second for Anwar El Ghazi (37) via a delicious left-wing set-piece.

4:30pm, Sunday 24th November 2019._Sheff.news: Sheffield United 3-3 Manchester United: Oli McBurnie saves Blades from capitulation
4:30pm, Sunday 24th November 2019._Sheff.response: Oli McBurnie's 90th-minute equaliser arrested a second-half Sheffield United capitulation as they salvaged a point in thrilling 3-3 draw with Manchester United at Bramall Lane.
4:30pm, Sunday 24th November 2019._Sheff.detail: Substitute McBurnie's effort was allowed to stand after a VAR review found no evidence of handball, sparking delirious scenes as the Blades rescued themselves from the jaws of defeat in the most dramatic of finales.

12:30pm, Saturday 23rd November 2019._We.news: West Ham 2-3 Tottenham: Jose Mourinho enjoys winning start
12:30pm, Saturday 23rd November 2019._We.response: Jose Mourinho made a winning return to management as Tottenham withstood a West Ham fightback to win 3-2 at the London Stadium.
12:30pm, Saturday 23rd November 2019._We.detail: Spurs had not won an away Premier League game since January 20 at Fulham, but first-half goals from Heung-Min Son (36) and Lucas Moura (43) put them in a commanding position.

3:00pm, Saturday 23rd November 2019._Ars.news: Arsenal 2-2 Southampton: Unai Emery's men booed off despite Alexandre Lacazette equaliser
3:00pm, Saturday 23rd November 2019._Ars.response: Arsenal were booed off at the Emirates despite rescuing a point with a late Alexandre Lacazette equaliser in a chaotic 2-2 draw with Southampton.
3:00pm, Saturday 23rd November 2019._Ars.detail: The Gunners were facing an embarrassing home defeat after goals from Danny Ings (9) and James Ward-Prowse (71) put Saints on the verge of their first Premier League win away at Arsenal.

3:00pm, Saturday 23rd November 2019._Bou.news: Bournemouth 1-2 Wolves: Nuno Espirito Santo's side up to fifth
3:00pm, Saturday 23rd November 2019._Bou.response: Wolves moved up to fifth in the Premier League after edging past 10-man Bournemouth to seal a 2-1 victory at the Vitality Stadium.
3:00pm, Saturday 23rd November 2019._Bou.detail: Nuno Espirito Santo's side led 2-0 at the break as Joao Moutinho curled a stunning free-kick into the top corner (21) before a quick set-piece caught out the hosts and Raul Jimenez (31) tapped in Adama Traore's cross.

3:00pm, Saturday 23rd November 2019._Bri.news: Brighton 0-2 Leicester: Dramatic VAR penalty re-take as Leicester win
3:00pm, Saturday 23rd November 2019._Bri.response: Leicester battled to a 2-0 win against Brighton, with VAR making a dramatic late penalty call, and extended their winning Premier League run to five games.
3:00pm, Saturday 23rd November 2019._Bri.detail: A goalless first half was followed by an incident-packed second and Leicester took the lead in a classic counter-attack which was finished off coolly by Ayoze Perez (64).

3:00pm, Saturday 23rd November 2019._Cry.news: Crystal Palace 1-2 Liverpool: Leaders escape with dramatic victory
3:00pm, Saturday 23rd November 2019._Cry.response: Liverpool escaped Crystal Palace with a chaotic and dramatic 2-1 victory thanks to a late Roberto Firmino strike that maintained their healthy lead at the top of the Premier League.
3:00pm, Saturday 23rd November 2019._Cry.detail: After Wilfried Zaha looked to have grabbed Palace a point (82), Firmino coolly swept home following bedlam in the penalty area to keep Liverpool eight points clear of Leicester, and nine clear of Manchester City.

3:00pm, Saturday 23rd November 2019._Eve.news: Everton 0-2 Norwich: Canaries impress with big win at Goodison Park
3:00pm, Saturday 23rd November 2019._Eve.response: Norwich scored their first away goals since the opening weekend of the season as they produced an impressive performance to beat Everton 2-0 at Goodison Park.
3:00pm, Saturday 23rd November 2019._Eve.detail: Both sides played high lines in a combative first half that produced few chances as they prioritised possession over attack, with Onel Hernandez going closest for the Canaries when he forced an outstanding save by Jordan Pickford.

3:00pm, Saturday 23rd November 2019._Wat.news: Watford 0-3 Burnley: Hornets drop to bottom of Premier League
3:00pm, Saturday 23rd November 2019._Wat.response: Burnley overcame struggling Watford 3-0 at Vicarage Road to increase the pressure on returning boss Quique Sanchez Flores, whose side are now bottom of the Premier League.
3:00pm, Saturday 23rd November 2019._Wat.detail: The visitors opened the scoring through Chris Wood's close-range finish eight minutes after half-time, before Ashley Barnes's VAR-assisted penalty doubled their lead with eight minutes to go.

5:30pm, Saturday 23rd November 2019._Man.news: Manchester City 2-1 Chelsea: Champions get back on track as Blues falter
5:30pm, Saturday 23rd November 2019._Man.response: Manchester City returned to winning ways with a morale-boosting 2-1 victory over Chelsea at the Etihad Stadium on Saturday Night Football.
5:30pm, Saturday 23rd November 2019._Man.detail: A fortnight on from their damaging defeat at Anfield, City found themselves 12 points behind leaders Liverpool following their dramatic win at Crystal Palace, and their title challenge looked set to receive another blow when N'Golo Kante put Chelsea into a deserved lead midway through the first half.

2:00pm, Sunday 10th November 2019._Manch.news: Manchester United 3-1 Brighton: Marcus Rashford stars in dominant showing
2:00pm, Sunday 10th November 2019._Manch.response: Manchester United put Brighton to the sword with a dominant attacking performance full of pace and quality to win 3-1.
2:00pm, Sunday 10th November 2019._Manch.detail: In a one-sided game in which United had 21 shots to Brighton's six, Andreas Pereira's deflected effort put the hosts on their way (17) before Scott McTominay forced Davy Propper into an own goal (19) after a Harry Maguire knockdown.

2:00pm, Sunday 10th November 2019._Wolve.news: Wolves 2-1 Aston Villa: Hosts extend unbeaten Premier League run with derby win
2:00pm, Sunday 10th November 2019._Wolve.response: Wolves took the West Midlands bragging rights as they beat Aston Villa 2-1 in the Premier League, extending their unbeaten run to seven top-flight games.
2:00pm, Sunday 10th November 2019._Wolve.detail: It was a terrible first half for Aston Villa, who were forced into two substitutions due to injury. The first was inside seven minutes as Jed Steer was taken off, before Ruben Neves' (41) fine finish deservedly put Wolves ahead.

4:30pm, Sunday 10th November 2019._Liver.news: Liverpool 3-1 Manchester City: Jurgen Klopp's side lay down significant marker in Premier League title race
4:30pm, Sunday 10th November 2019._Liver.response: Liverpool laid down a significant marker in their bid to win a first league title in 30 years by beating champions Manchester City 3-1 at Anfield on Renault Super Sunday.
4:30pm, Sunday 10th November 2019._Liver.detail: The roof was lifted off Anfield as early as the sixth minute when Fabinho drilled the ball past Claudio Bravo from 30 yards, but the goal was shrouded in controversy as City thought they should have had a penalty moments earlier when the ball struck Trent Alexander-Arnold's arm in the penalty area.

12:30pm, Saturday 9th November 2019._Che.news: Chelsea 2-0 Crystal Palace: Tammy Abraham and Christian Pulisic maintain Blues' winning run
12:30pm, Saturday 9th November 2019._Che.response: Chelsea moved up to third in the Premier League after Tammy Abraham and Christian Pulisic sealed a 2-0 win over Crystal Palace at Stamford Bridge.
12:30pm, Saturday 9th November 2019._Che.detail: Abraham's 10th league goal of the season unlocked the Palace defence after 52 minutes of resistance, before Pulisic sealed a sixth consecutive league victory for Frank Lampard's side with his fifth goal in three league games.

3:00pm, Saturday 9th November 2019._Burn.news: Burnley 3-0 West Ham: Hammers drop to 16th after fourth defeat in five
3:00pm, Saturday 9th November 2019._Burn.response: West Ham dropped to 16th as a wretched 3-0 defeat to Burnley at Turf Moor condemned them to a sixth game without a win.
3:00pm, Saturday 9th November 2019._Burn.detail: Ashley Barnes put the hosts ahead inside 10 minutes from a corner which should not have been awarded but West Ham had reason to feel some justice had been done when Chris Wood's header was then ruled out by a VAR review for a marginal offside.

3:00pm, Saturday 9th November 2019._Newc.news: Newcastle 2-1 Bournemouth: Magpies rally to claim back-to-back Premier League wins
3:00pm, Saturday 9th November 2019._Newc.response: Ciaran Clark scored the winner as Newcastle came from behind to beat Bournemouth 2-1 at St James' Park.
3:00pm, Saturday 9th November 2019._Newc.detail: Bournemouth took a 14th-minute lead when on-loan Liverpool winger Harry Wilson swept home after a clever short-corner routine.

3:00pm, Saturday 9th November 2019._Sout.news: Southampton 1-2 Everton: Richarlison strikes to heap pressure on Saints boss Ralph Hasenhuttl
3:00pm, Saturday 9th November 2019._Sout.response: Southampton suffered another disappointing result as Richarlison's 75th-minute strike condemned them to a 2-1 defeat against Everton at St Mary's.
3:00pm, Saturday 9th November 2019._Sout.detail: In a game that often lacked quality between two Premier League strugglers, Tom Davies headed the visitors in front after just four minutes, and Saints were fortunate not to be further behind during a one-sided first half.

3:00pm, Saturday 9th November 2019._Tott.news: Tottenham 1-1 Sheffield United: George Baldock scores equaliser after VAR chaos
