3:00pm, Saturday 9th November 2019._Tott.response: Sheffield United overcame VAR controversy to grab a 1-1 draw at Tottenham after having a goal ruled out for John Lundstram’s big toe being offside.
3:00pm, Saturday 9th November 2019._Tott.detail: Despite being second best for the majority, Spurs took the lead through Heung-Min Son (58) but the Blades thought they had equalised when David McGoldrick struck two minutes later. However, after a four-minute wait at the centre circle, VAR overturned the goal as it was deemed Lundstram's big toe was offside in the build-up.

5:30pm, Saturday 9th November 2019._Leic.news: Leicester 2-0 Arsenal: Brendan Rodgers' side  move nine points clear of Gunners
5:30pm, Saturday 9th November 2019._Leic.response: Leicester laid down a significant marker in the race to finish in the Premier League's top four by beating Arsenal 2-0 to move nine points ahead of the sixth-placed Gunners.
5:30pm, Saturday 9th November 2019._Leic.detail: Jamie Vardy broke the deadlock in the 68th minute with his ninth goal in as many games against the Gunners, finishing a slick Leicester move involving Youri Tielemans and Harvey Barnes.

8:00pm, Friday 8th November 2019._Norwic.news: Norwich 0-2 Watford: Canaries drop to bottom as Watford earn first league win since April
8:00pm, Friday 8th November 2019._Norwic.response: Watford's first win in 16 league games lifted them off the bottom of the Premier League at the expense of Norwich after a 2-0 victory at Carrow Road.
8:00pm, Friday 8th November 2019._Norwic.detail: Gerard Deulofeu fired the visitors ahead after just 76 seconds but Norwich squandered numerous chances to score before half-time against a Watford side who had kept only one clean sheet on the road in 2019.

2:00pm, Sunday 3rd November 2019._Crysta.news: Crystal Palace 0-2 Leicester: Caglar Soyuncu and Jamie Vardy send Foxes third
2:00pm, Sunday 3rd November 2019._Crysta.response: Second-half goals from Caglar Soyuncu and Jamie Vardy earned Leicester a 2-0 victory at Crystal Palace that saw them reclaim third spot in the Premier League.
2:00pm, Sunday 3rd November 2019._Crysta.detail: Turkey international Soyuncu headed his first goal for the club on 57 minutes before Vardy's 10th league goal of the season wrapped up Leicester's seventh win in nine two minutes from time.

4:30pm, Sunday 3rd November 2019._Everto.news: Everton 1-1 Tottenham: Andre Gomes suffers horror injury as Toffees snatch draw
4:30pm, Sunday 3rd November 2019._Everto.response: Cenk Tosun's 97th-minute equaliser earned Everton a 1-1 draw with Spurs after Andre Gomes suffered a horrific ankle injury, for which Heung-Min Son saw red.
4:30pm, Sunday 3rd November 2019._Everto.detail: Sub Tosun's bullet header cancelled out Dele Alli's opener (63), but the game will unfortunately be remembered for Gomes' injury (79), which forced 12 minutes of stoppage time.

12:30pm, Saturday 2nd November 2019._Bou.news: Bournemouth 1-0 Man Utd: Josh King strike brings United back to earth
12:30pm, Saturday 2nd November 2019._Bou.response: Josh King's first-half goal dented Manchester United's recent recovery as they were beaten 1-0 by Bournemouth at the Vitality Stadium.
12:30pm, Saturday 2nd November 2019._Bou.detail: King flicked the ball over Aaron Wan-Bissaka before beating David de Gea in first-half stoppage time as Bournemouth ended a run of 358 minutes without scoring.

3:00pm, Saturday 2nd November 2019._Arse.news: Arsenal 1-1 Wolves: Raul Jimenez goal pegs back Gunners
3:00pm, Saturday 2nd November 2019._Arse.response: Arsenal surrendered another lead as Raul Jimenez earned Wolves a 1-1 draw at the Emirates Stadium on Saturday.
3:00pm, Saturday 2nd November 2019._Arse.detail: Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang, handed the armband in Granit Xhaka's absence, had given Arsenal a first-half lead but Jimenez's 76th-minute header levelled things up to add to the pressure on Unai Emery.

3:00pm, Saturday 2nd November 2019._Asto.news: Aston Villa 1-2 Liverpool: Sadio Mane's 94th-minute winner gives leaders stunning victory
3:00pm, Saturday 2nd November 2019._Asto.response: Sadio Mane's 94th-minute header gave Liverpool a stunning 2-1 comeback victory against Aston Villa to keep their six-point lead at the top of the Premier League.
3:00pm, Saturday 2nd November 2019._Asto.detail: With Manchester City fighting back from behind to beat Southampton 2-1, Liverpool's lead looked to be reduced to four points before Mane stooped low deep into injury time to extend their unbeaten run to 28 in the Premier League.

3:00pm, Saturday 2nd November 2019._Brig.news: Brighton 2-0 Norwich: Leandro Trossard steals show as Seagulls sink Canaries
3:00pm, Saturday 2nd November 2019._Brig.response: Brighton made it three home wins in a row to go eighth in the Premier League table with a 2-0 victory over a lacklustre Norwich.
3:00pm, Saturday 2nd November 2019._Brig.detail: The Seagulls were full of confidence from the off and deserved a first-half lead but for their careless finishing, while Norwich almost stole an early goal against the run of play when Marco Stiepermann hit the bar.

3:00pm, Saturday 2nd November 2019._Manc.news: Man City 2-1 Southampton: Kyle Walker hits late winner as hosts fight back
3:00pm, Saturday 2nd November 2019._Manc.response: Manchester City came from behind to keep the pressure on Premier League leaders Liverpool as Kyle Walker's 86th-minute strike secured a hard-fought 2-1 win over Southampton.
3:00pm, Saturday 2nd November 2019._Manc.detail: Ralph Hasenhuttl's side produced a valiant display a week on from their 9-0 thrashing at home to Leicester, and James Ward-Prowse gave the visitors a shock lead at the Etihad (16).

3:00pm, Saturday 2nd November 2019._Shef.news: Sheffield United 3-0 Burnley: John Lundstram and Lys Mousset inspire Blades victory
3:00pm, Saturday 2nd November 2019._Shef.response: John Lundstram scored twice and Lys Mousset registered a hat-trick of assists as Sheffield United thrashed Burnley 3-0 at Bramall Lane.
3:00pm, Saturday 2nd November 2019._Shef.detail: The Blades netted all three goals in the first half with the result moving them up to sixth in the Premier League in what has been an extraordinary season so far for the promoted side, while Burnley drop to 14th.

3:00pm, Saturday 2nd November 2019._West.news: West Ham 2-3 Newcastle: Toon stun Hammers
3:00pm, Saturday 2nd November 2019._West.response: West Ham's brave second-half comeback was not enough to deny Premier League strugglers Newcastle a thrilling 3-2 win at the London Stadium.
3:00pm, Saturday 2nd November 2019._West.detail: The Hammers were shocked by the Magpies' electric start as their centre-backs Ciaran Clark (16) and Federico Fernandez (22) both scored headers from well-worked set-piece routines to put them two up at the break.

5:30pm, Saturday 2nd November 2019._Watf.news: Watford 1-2 Chelsea: Blues weather late Watford rally to move third
5:30pm, Saturday 2nd November 2019._Watf.response: Tammy Abraham scored one and set up another but Chelsea had to weather a late Watford rally to secure a 2-1 victory that lifts them up to third in the Premier League.
5:30pm, Saturday 2nd November 2019._Watf.detail: Abraham arrested a run of four games without a goal with a brilliant lofted finish inside five minutes at Vicarage Road - his seventh goal away from home this season - and then turned provider 10 minutes into the second half when his precise cross was tapped home by Christian Pulisic.

2:00pm, Sunday 27th October 2019._Newcas.news: Newcastle 1-1 Wolves: Jonny capitalises on Martin Dubravka mistake to earn visitors a point
2:00pm, Sunday 27th October 2019._Newcas.response: Jonny took advantage of a Martin Dubravka error to earn Wolves a point from a hard-fought 1-1 draw at Newcastle.
2:00pm, Sunday 27th October 2019._Newcas.detail: The Magpies 'keeper palmed a Matt Doherty cross straight into the path of Jonny with 17 minutes remaining and he made no mistake to cancel out Jamaal Lascelles' opener.

4:30pm, Sunday 27th October 2019._Arsena.news: Arsenal 2-2 Crystal Palace: Gunners held as VAR takes centre stage at Emirates Stadium
4:30pm, Sunday 27th October 2019._Arsena.response: VAR took centre stage in a pulsating encounter at Emirates Stadium as Crystal Palace fought back from two goals down to secure a battling 2-2 draw with Arsenal.
4:30pm, Sunday 27th October 2019._Arsena.detail: In a game which saw Granit Xhaka clash with his own fans following his second-half substitution, Roy Hodgson's side benefitted from two VAR calls after Arsenal had raced into a two-goal advantage following goals from Sokratis Papastathopoulos (7) and David Luiz (9).

4:30pm, Sunday 27th October 2019._Liverp.news: Liverpool 2-1 Tottenham: Reds fight back in second half to regain six-point lead
4:30pm, Sunday 27th October 2019._Liverp.response: Liverpool regained their six-point lead at the top of the Premier League as they came from behind to beat Tottenham 2-1 in a pulsating affair at Anfield on Super Sunday.
4:30pm, Sunday 27th October 2019._Liverp.detail: Spurs took a shock lead after just 47 seconds through Harry Kane's intuitive header, while Paulo Gazzaniga was forced into several fine saves as Liverpool laid siege on the visitors' goal.

4:30pm, Sunday 27th October 2019._Norwic.news: Norwich City 1-3 Manchester United: Tim Krul saves two penalties but United win to go seventh
4:30pm, Sunday 27th October 2019._Norwic.response: Norwich goalkeeper Tim Krul saved two VAR-awarded penalties but could not stop Manchester United from picking up their first Premier League away win in eight months with a 3-1 victory at Carrow Road.
4:30pm, Sunday 27th October 2019._Norwic.detail: Scott McTominay (21) gave United the lead, before Krul denied Marcus Rashford from the spot after Ben Godfrey was controversially judged to have fouled Dan James in the box.

12:30pm, Saturday 26th October 2019._Man.news: Man City 3-0 Aston Villa: Second-half show gives champions victory
12:30pm, Saturday 26th October 2019._Man.response: Manchester City put on a second-half show to see off Aston Villa 3-0 at the Etihad in the Premier League, reducing the gap to Liverpool to three points for 24 hours at least.
12:30pm, Saturday 26th October 2019._Man.detail: City struck inches wide on two occasions in a goalless first half through Gabriel Jesus and David Silva, but within seconds of the restart, Raheem Sterling had slotted home his sixth goal in four games for club and country (46).

3:00pm, Saturday 26th October 2019._Brig.news: Brighton 3-2 Everton: Late Lucas Digne own goal hands hosts victory
3:00pm, Saturday 26th October 2019._Brig.response: A 94th-minute own goal from Lucas Digne gifted Brighton a 3-2 victory against Everton on Saturday in a dramatic Premier League encounter.
3:00pm, Saturday 26th October 2019._Brig.detail: The Everton captain sent Leandro Trossard's cross into his own net after Neal Maupay (80) had made it 2-2 from the penalty spot not long before following a controversial VAR review.

3:00pm, Saturday 26th October 2019._Watf.news: Watford 0-0 Bournemouth: Quique Sanchez Flores' side stay bottom after draw
3:00pm, Saturday 26th October 2019._Watf.response: Watford remain bottom of the table and without a win in the Premier League this season following a frustrating 0-0 draw with Bournemouth at Vicarage Road.
3:00pm, Saturday 26th October 2019._Watf.detail: Both sides created good chances in the opening stages, Abdoulaye Doucoure firing over from close range before Steve Cook's header rattled the crossbar.

3:00pm, Saturday 26th October 2019._West.news: West Ham 1-1 Sheffield United: Blades remain unbeaten on the road
3:00pm, Saturday 26th October 2019._West.response: Sheffield United remain unbeaten away from home in the Premier League after Lys Mousset struck again in a 1-1 draw with West Ham.
3:00pm, Saturday 26th October 2019._West.detail: In the first league meeting between the teams since the third-party ownership saga involving Carlos Tevez and Javier Mascherano in the season when Sheffield United were relegated 13 years ago, Robert Snodgrass gave West Ham the lead just before the break (44).

5:30pm, Saturday 26th October 2019._Burn.news: Burnley 2-4 Chelsea: Christian Pulisic scores perfect hat-trick in seventh straight Blues win
5:30pm, Saturday 26th October 2019._Burn.response: Christian Pulisic marked his first league start since August with a hat-trick as Chelsea beat Burnley 4-2 at Turf Moor.
5:30pm, Saturday 26th October 2019._Burn.detail: The Blues owed their seventh straight win in all competitions to the American's clinical finishing; first he deceived James Tarkowski to open the scoring (21) with his left foot before adding a second just before half-time with a right-foot shot which deflected off Ben Mee and past Nick Pope.

8:00pm, Friday 25th October 2019._Southa.news: Southampton 0-9 Leicester: Ayoze Perez and Jamie Vardy net hat-tricks in record-breaking win
8:00pm, Friday 25th October 2019._Southa.response: Leicester have gone second in the Premier League table in record-breaking style, demolishing 10-man Southampton 9-0 on Friday Night Football.
8:00pm, Friday 25th October 2019._Southa.detail: Leicester were on the verge of history when they were awarded a last-minute penalty after Jamie Vardy was fouled by Yan Bednarek in the area. Vardy then converted from the spot for his hat-trick as the Foxes broke the record for the highest ever away win in the Premier League and matched the overall record.

8:00pm, Monday 21st October 2019._Sheffi.news: Sheffield United 1-0 Arsenal: Lys Mousset strike increases Gunners' away misery
8:00pm, Monday 21st October 2019._Sheffi.response: Arsenal's stuttering away form in the Premier League continued as Lys Mousset's first-half strike gave Sheffield United a 1-0 win on Monday Night Football.
8:00pm, Monday 21st October 2019._Sheffi.detail: Sheffield United were the better side at Bramall Lane and their victory was ultimately sealed when Mousset - making his first Premier League start for his new club - tapped home in the 30th minute.

4:30pm, Sunday 20th October 2019._Manche.news: Manchester United 1-1 Liverpool: Adam Lallana saves point after VAR drama
4:30pm, Sunday 20th October 2019._Manche.response: Adam Lallana's late equaliser saved a point for an under-par Liverpool as they drew 1-1 at Manchester United on Super Sunday in a game littered with more VAR drama.
4:30pm, Sunday 20th October 2019._Manche.detail: After a frantic opening lacking in clear-cut chances, the game exploded late in the first half with two crucial VAR calls. First, Marcus Rashford gave United the lead from close range (36) as Liverpool's cries for a foul on Divock Origi in the build-up were denied by VAR.

12:30pm, Saturday 19th October 2019._Eve.news: Everton 2-0 West Ham: Bernard and Gylfi Sigurdsson goals lift gloom at Goodison
12:30pm, Saturday 19th October 2019._Eve.response: Everton moved out of the bottom three after goals from Bernard and Gylfi Sigurdsson gave them a 2-0 win over West Ham to relieve the pressure on Marco Silva.
12:30pm, Saturday 19th October 2019._Eve.detail: Toffees boss Silva labelled the visit of Manuel Pellegrini's side as a "must-win" game - and his players responded as confidence flowed following Bernard's 17th-minute opener from a tight angle.

3:00pm, Saturday 19th October 2019._Asto.news: Aston Villa 2-1 Brighton: Matt Targett stunner completes Villa comeback
3:00pm, Saturday 19th October 2019._Asto.response: Matt Targett scored a stoppage-time stunner to complete a breathless Aston Villa comeback as they beat Brighton 2-1 at Villa Park.
3:00pm, Saturday 19th October 2019._Asto.detail: Adam Webster's first Brighton goal handed the visitors the lead (12), but their hopes of victory took a blow when Aaron Mooy was sent off after two quickfire yellow cards (35).

3:00pm, Saturday 19th October 2019._Bour.news: Bournemouth 0-0 Norwich: Canaries pick up first away point
3:00pm, Saturday 19th October 2019._Bour.response: Bournemouth and Norwich both earned their first clean sheets of the season as they played out a drab 0-0 draw at the Vitality Stadium.
3:00pm, Saturday 19th October 2019._Bour.detail: In a game including only three shots on target, Bournemouth came closest before half-time when Dominic Solanke turned Callum Wilson's clever reverse pass goalwards, but Tim Krul saved.

3:00pm, Saturday 19th October 2019._Chel.news: Chelsea 1-0 Newcastle: Marcos Alonso sends Blues into top four
3:00pm, Saturday 19th October 2019._Chel.response: Chelsea moved into the Premier League top four as Marcos Alonso's late strike gave them a 1-0 win over Newcastle at Stamford Bridge.
3:00pm, Saturday 19th October 2019._Chel.detail: Chelsea finally broke down a stubborn Toon as Alonso (73) struck a fierce low effort after being fed by Callum Hudson-Odoi on the left of the box, though Newcastle felt they should have been awarded a foul on Joelinton in the build up.

3:00pm, Saturday 19th October 2019._Leic.news: Leicester 2-1 Burnley: Brendan Rodgers' side rally for victory
3:00pm, Saturday 19th October 2019._Leic.response: Leicester temporarily moved up to second in the Premier League after coming from behind to beat Burnley 2-1 at the King Power Stadium.
3:00pm, Saturday 19th October 2019._Leic.detail: On an emotional day when Leicester remembered late chairman Vichai Srivaddhanaprabha, who died alongside four others in a helicopter crash outside the King Power Stadium a year ago this month, the Foxes rallied as Jamie Vardy's 45th-minute header cancelled out Chris Wood's opener (26).

3:00pm, Saturday 19th October 2019._Tott.news: Tottenham 1-1 Watford: VAR confusion as Dele Alli rescues Spurs
3:00pm, Saturday 19th October 2019._Tott.response: Dele Alli scored a late equaliser in a 1-1 draw Watford but confusion surrounded it as a VAR review awarded the goal on the field but disallowed it on the big screen.
3:00pm, Saturday 19th October 2019._Tott.detail: Alli's leveller (86) - after Abdoulaye Doucoure (6) had given Watford the lead - was reviewed by VAR for a potential handball and referee Chris Kavanagh signalled for a goal but the big-screen message, which is controlled by Stockley Park, stated that the goal had been ruled out.

3:00pm, Saturday 19th October 2019._Wolv.news: Wolves 1-1 Southampton: Jimenez earns point after twice being denied by VAR
3:00pm, Saturday 19th October 2019._Wolv.response: ​​​​​​​Raul Jimenez equalised from the spot but had two first-half efforts ruled out by VAR as Wolves had to settle for a 1-1 draw with Southampton.
3:00pm, Saturday 19th October 2019._Wolv.detail: The Mexican striker twice put the ball in the net in the opening 45 minutes but VAR ruled his first strike out for handball and his second for offside in the build-up.

5:30pm, Saturday 19th October 2019._Crys.news: Crystal Palace 0-2 Manchester City: Pep Guardiola's side back on track after nervy win
5:30pm, Saturday 19th October 2019._Crys.response: Manchester City got back to winning ways with a 2-0 victory against Crystal Palace, although they were made to sweat for the three points.
5:30pm, Saturday 19th October 2019._Crys.detail: Pep Guardiola's side scored twice in 93 seconds after a stellar performance from Wayne Hennessey had kept them at bay for much of the opening period. Gabriel Jesus (39) nodded home his 50th Man City goal in all competitions before David Silva (41) tucked home through the goalkeeper's legs.

2:00pm, Sunday 6th October 2019._Arsenal.news: Arsenal 1-0 Bournemouth: David Luiz header sees Gunners up to third
2:00pm, Sunday 6th October 2019._Arsenal.response: David Luiz's early header proved enough for Arsenal to beat Bournemouth and move up to third in the Premier League.
2:00pm, Sunday 6th October 2019._Arsenal.detail: The Brazilian netted his first Arsenal goal on nine minutes, guiding Nicolas Pepe's corner past Aaron Ramsdale and into the back of the net.

2:00pm, Sunday 6th October 2019._Manches.news: Manchester City 0-2 Wolves: Adama Traore double stuns Premier League champions
2:00pm, Sunday 6th October 2019._Manches.response: Adama Traore's second-half double helped Wolves stun Manchester City 2-0 to leave Liverpool eight points clear at the top heading into the international break.
2:00pm, Sunday 6th October 2019._Manches.detail: The warning signs were already there for City after a flat first-half performance but Nuno Espirito Santo's decision to move Traore through the middle was a masterstroke and the winger scored twice on the counter-attack (80 & 90+4).

2:00pm, Sunday 6th October 2019._Southam.news: Southampton 1-4 Chelsea: Tammy Abraham on target as Blues sink Saints
2:00pm, Sunday 6th October 2019._Southam.response: Tammy Abraham and Mason Mount helped Chelsea to a comfortable 4-1 win over Southampton at St Mary's.
2:00pm, Sunday 6th October 2019._Southam.detail: Abraham's lob opened the scoring after 17 minutes before Mount doubled Chelsea's lead with a close-range strike. Danny Ings' tap-in pulled one back for Southampton but N'Golo Kante restored the visitors' two-goal lead before half-time with a long-range deflected strike.

4:30pm, Sunday 6th October 2019._Newcast.news: Newcastle United 1-0 Manchester United: Matty Longstaff strikes on Premier League debut
4:30pm, Sunday 6th October 2019._Newcast.response: Matty Longstaff scored on his Premier League debut as Newcastle piled more misery on Manchester United with a 1-0 victory at St James' Park on Super Sunday.
4:30pm, Sunday 6th October 2019._Newcast.detail: Local lad Longstaff applied the finishing touch at the end of a counter-attack midway through the second half with a crisp low drive that secured Steve Bruce - on his 400th game as a Premier League manager - his first victory over the club he used to captain at the 23rd attempt.

12:30pm, Saturday 5th October 2019._Brig.news: Brighton 3-0 Tottenham: Aaron Connolly double increases pressure on Mauricio Pochettino
12:30pm, Saturday 5th October 2019._Brig.response: Aaron Connolly scored twice on his first Premier League start as Brighton increased the pressure building on Mauricio Pochettino, thrashing Tottenham 3-0 at the Amex Stadium.
12:30pm, Saturday 5th October 2019._Brig.detail: Tottenham came into the game low on confidence already following their 7-2 midweek mauling at home to Bayern Munich in the Champions League, but their problems deepened in only the third minute when goalkeeper Hugo Lloris, who was subsequently stretchered from the field after dislocating his elbow, gifted Neil Maupay Brighton's opener.

3:00pm, Saturday 5th October 2019._Burnl.news: Burnley 1-0 Everton: Jeff Hendrick strike heaps pressure on Marco Silva
3:00pm, Saturday 5th October 2019._Burnl.response: Jeff Hendrick's 72nd-minute strike heaped further pressure on Marco Silva as Burnley secured a 1-0 win over 10-man Everton at Turf Moor.
3:00pm, Saturday 5th October 2019._Burnl.detail: Seamus Coleman was sent off for a second bookable offence (56) to hand the Clarets the initiative, and Hendrick met Ashley Westwood's corner to volley home the winner as Everton's weakness at set-pieces was exploited.

3:00pm, Saturday 5th October 2019._Liver.news: Liverpool 2-1 Leicester: James Milner's 95th-minute winner keeps winning run going
3:00pm, Saturday 5th October 2019._Liver.response: James Milner scored a 95th-minute penalty to keep up Liverpool's winning run in extraordinary fashion with a 2-1 win over Leicester.
3:00pm, Saturday 5th October 2019._Liver.detail: Milner stepped up to send Kasper Schmeichel the wrong way from the spot after Sadio Mane was fouled in the Leicester area by Marc Albrighton. The victory extended Liverpool's winning run to 17 Premier League games.

3:00pm, Saturday 5th October 2019._Norwi.news: Norwich 1-5 Aston Villa: Wesley scores twice as Canaries thrashed at Carrow Road
3:00pm, Saturday 5th October 2019._Norwi.response: Aston Villa secured their first away points of the season with an emphatic 5-1 win over Norwich at Carrow Road.
3:00pm, Saturday 5th October 2019._Norwi.detail: Wesley made headlines in a chaotic first half, giving his side the lead from six yards (16) and adding a second 15 minutes later, before Michael McGovern denied him a hat-trick from the penalty spot before the break.

3:00pm, Saturday 5th October 2019._Watfo.news: Watford 0-0 Sheffield United: Quality lacking as Hornets remain winless
3:00pm, Saturday 5th October 2019._Watfo.response: Watford remain bottom and without a win in the Premier League this season after a turgid 0-0 draw with Sheffield United at Vicarage Road.
3:00pm, Saturday 5th October 2019._Watfo.detail: Despite having just 39 per cent of the ball and registering just two shots on target, Watford created the big opportunities in the match but Andre Gray, Danny Welbeck and Craig Dawson were denied as Blades goalkeeper Dean Henderson redeemed himself after last weekend's error against Liverpool.

5:30pm, Saturday 5th October 2019._West.news: West Ham 1-2 Crystal Palace: VAR drama secures Eagles late win as they go fourth
5:30pm, Saturday 5th October 2019._West.response: Crystal Palace beat West Ham 2-1 and moved up to fourth in the Premier League after VAR overturned Jordan Ayew's disallowed goal late on at the London Stadium.
5:30pm, Saturday 5th October 2019._West.detail: A sensational team goal from West Ham saw Sebastien Haller put the hosts ahead in the 54th minute but a Patrick van Aanholt penalty (63) levelled things after Declan Rice was penalised for handball.

8:00pm, Monday 30th September 2019._Manc.news: Man Utd 1-1 Arsenal: VAR hands Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang equaliser at Old Trafford
8:00pm, Monday 30th September 2019._Manc.response: A vital VAR intervention for Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang's strike gave Arsenal a 1-1 draw at Manchester United in the Premier League on Monday Night Football.
8:00pm, Monday 30th September 2019._Manc.detail: After a scrappy first 40 minutes, United took the lead through Scott McTominay's deflected strike from 22 yards following a United break (45), just moments after David de Gea had produced a double save to keep Arsenal out.

4:30pm, Sunday 29th September 2019._Leic.news: Leicester 5-0 Newcastle: Jamie Vardy scores twice for Foxes
4:30pm, Sunday 29th September 2019._Leic.response: Leicester moved up to third in the Premier League after romping to a 5-0 victory over 10-man Newcastle on Super Sunday.
4:30pm, Sunday 29th September 2019._Leic.detail: ,Ricardo Pereira scored for the second game in a row to put the Foxes ahead in the 16th minute.

12:30pm, Saturday 28th September 2019._S.news: Sheffield United 0-1 Liverpool: Dean Henderson howler hands Reds win
12:30pm, Saturday 28th September 2019._S.response: A goalkeeping howler from Dean Henderson gifted Liverpool a 16th straight Premier League victory as they saw off Sheffield United 1-0 at Bramall Lane.
12:30pm, Saturday 28th September 2019._S.detail: The Premier League leaders looked out of ideas in the face of a thorough examination from the newly-promoted Blades but were handed three points when on-loan Manchester United goalkeeper Henderson allowed Georginio Wijnaldum's volley to squirm across his goal line on 70 minutes.

3:00pm, Saturday 28th September 2019._As.news: Aston Villa 2-2 Burnley: Sean Dyche's men take point in dramatic encounter
3:00pm, Saturday 28th September 2019._As.response: Burnley twice came from behind to snatch a 2-2 draw against Aston Villa in a dramatic Premier League encounter at Villa Park.
3:00pm, Saturday 28th September 2019._As.detail: The controversy started early on when John McGinn had a 25th-minute goal disallowed by VAR for offside against Conor Hourihane, before Anwar El Ghazi put Aston Villa (33) ahead eight minutes later.

3:00pm, Saturday 28th September 2019._Bo.news: Bournemouth 2-2 West Ham: Aaron Cresswell strikes again to earn point for Hammers
3:00pm, Saturday 28th September 2019._Bo.response: Aaron Cresswell's 74th-minute strike secured West Ham a hard-earned point from an entertaining 2-2 draw with Bournemouth at the Vitality Stadium.
3:00pm, Saturday 28th September 2019._Bo.detail: The Hammers took the lead when Andriy Yarmolenko struck his third Premier League goal in four games (10), but Bournemouth levelled when VAR overturned referee Stuart Attwell's on-field decision to rule out Joshua King's finish for offside (17).

3:00pm, Saturday 28th September 2019._Ch.news: Chelsea 2-0 Brighton: Blues' second-half double gives Frank Lampard first home league win
3:00pm, Saturday 28th September 2019._Ch.response: Jorginho and WIllian took advantage of two errors as Chelsea beat Brighton 2-0 at Stamford Bridge to give Frank Lampard his first home league win as manager.
3:00pm, Saturday 28th September 2019._Ch.detail: The hosts had the better of the first half, missing three glorious chances to take the lead, and in the end needed a helping hand from Brighton to open the scoring. Adam Webster fouled Mason Mount after taking a heavy touch in his own box, and set up Jorginho to put his side ahead from the penalty spot.

3:00pm, Saturday 28th September 2019._Cr.news: Crystal Palace 2-0 Norwich City: Luka Milivojevic penalty on 100th Eagles appearance sets up win
3:00pm, Saturday 28th September 2019._Cr.response: Luka Milivojevic scored on his 100th Crystal Palace appearance as Norwich were beaten 2-0 at Selhurst Park.
3:00pm, Saturday 28th September 2019._Cr.detail: Eagles captain Milivojevic scored his first goal of the season from the penalty spot after James McArthur was brought down in the area by Canaries defender Ibrahim Amadou in the first half, before Andros Townsend sealed the win with a second in stoppage-time.

3:00pm, Saturday 28th September 2019._To.news: Tottenham 2-1 Southampton: Spurs survive over an hour with 10 men to beat Saints
3:00pm, Saturday 28th September 2019._To.response: Tottenham overcame Serge Aurier's first-half red card and a comical Hugo Lloris error to grind out a brave 2-1 win over Southampton.
3:00pm, Saturday 28th September 2019._To.detail: After the embarrassing midweek Carabao Cup defeat to Colchester, Mauricio Pochettino called in his programme notes for everyone associated with the club to "remain calm" while they navigate through a tricky spell.

3:00pm, Saturday 28th September 2019._Wo.news: Wolves 2-0 Watford:  Nuno Espirito Santo's side seal first league win of the season
3:00pm, Saturday 28th September 2019._Wo.response: Wolves climbed out of the relegation zone with a 2-0 victory against Watford at Molineux, deepening Quique Sanchez Flores' side's troubles at the bottom of the Premier League table in the process.
3:00pm, Saturday 28th September 2019._Wo.detail: Nuno Espirito Santo's side started the day just two points ahead of Watford at the bottom of the league, but they took the lead for the first time in the Premier League this season when Matt Doherty converted Pedro Neto's cross from close range.

5:30pm, Saturday 28th September 2019._Ev.news: Everton 1-3 Man City: Champions put on strong late show to see off Toffees
5:30pm, Saturday 28th September 2019._Ev.response: Manchester City avoided slipping further behind Premier League leaders Liverpool with a strong second-half performance as they beat Everton 3-1 at Goodison Park.
5:30pm, Saturday 28th September 2019._Ev.detail: City looked slick early on and took the lead through Gabriel Jesus' diving header from yet another fine Kevin De Bruyne delivery (24), but Everton levelled as Seamus Coleman found just enough space in the box to dink over Ederson at an angle, and Dominic Calvert-Lewin got the final touch on the line (32).

2:00pm, Sunday 22nd September 2019._Crys.news: Crystal Palace 1-1 Wolves: Diogo Jota secures last-gasp draw
2:00pm, Sunday 22nd September 2019._Crys.response: Diogo Jota scored in the fifth minute of injury-time to give 10-man Wolves a dramatic 1-1 draw at Crystal Palace.
2:00pm, Sunday 22nd September 2019._Crys.detail: After failing to muster a decent effort on goal before the break, Palace took the lead in the first minute of the second half when Joel Ward's strike from the edge of the box was deflected past Rui Patricio off Leander Dendoncker for an own goal.

2:00pm, Sunday 22nd September 2019._West.news: West Ham 2-0 Manchester United: Andriy Yarmolenko and Aaron Cresswell sink lacklustre visitors
2:00pm, Sunday 22nd September 2019._West.response: Goals from Andriy Yarmolenko and Aaron Cresswell ensured West Ham recorded a convincing 2-0 victory over an injury-hit Manchester United to move fifth in the Premier League.
2:00pm, Sunday 22nd September 2019._West.detail: The Hammers went after the visitors from the off and were rewarded with a deserved lead as Yarmolenko struck a half-volley past a diving David de Gea on the stroke of half-time after some fine one-touch football.

4:30pm, Sunday 22nd September 2019._Arse.news: Arsenal 3-2 Aston Villa: Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang strike seals stunning comeback
4:30pm, Sunday 22nd September 2019._Arse.response: Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang's dramatic winner helped 10-man Arsenal complete a stunning late comeback to beat Aston Villa 3-2 at the Emirates Stadium.
4:30pm, Sunday 22nd September 2019._Arse.detail: The Gunners suffered an early setback when John McGinn gave Villa the lead in the 20th minute and things went from bad to worse for the hosts when Ainsley Maitland-Niles received his marching orders for a second bookable offence just before the break.

4:30pm, Sunday 22nd September 2019._Chel.news: Chelsea 1-2 Liverpool: Reds withstand late fightback to stay perfect
4:30pm, Sunday 22nd September 2019._Chel.response: Liverpool weathered a spirited second-half fightback as a 15th straight Premier League win defeated Chelsea 2-1 and maintained their perfect start to the season.
4:30pm, Sunday 22nd September 2019._Chel.detail: Trent Alexander-Arnold's thunderbolt and Roberto Firmino's free header, either side of a disallowed Cesar Azpilicueta equaliser, saw the league leaders open up a two-goal lead inside half an hour at Stamford Bridge.

12:30pm, Saturday 21st September 2019._L.news: Leicester 2-1 Tottenham: James Maddison nets late winner in game of more VAR drama
12:30pm, Saturday 21st September 2019._L.response: James Maddison's fine late strike saw Leicester come from behind to beat Tottenham 2-1 in a game filled with more VAR drama.
12:30pm, Saturday 21st September 2019._L.detail: Maddison's powerful 25-yard effort settled a wonderful game of twists and turns at the King Power Stadium, which saw Spurs surrender the lead for the third time in four games.

3:00pm, Saturday 21st September 2019._Bu.news: Burnley 2-0 Norwich: Chris Wood's double seals victory for hosts
3:00pm, Saturday 21st September 2019._Bu.response: Chris Wood scored twice as Burnley eased to a deserved 2-0 victory against Norwich at Turf Moor.
3:00pm, Saturday 21st September 2019._Bu.detail: The result never really looked in doubt with Wood scoring twice in four minutes to give the dominant hosts an early lead after just 14 minutes.

3:00pm, Saturday 21st September 2019._Ev.news: Everton 0-2 Sheff Utd: Brilliant Blades secure first Premier League away win of season
3:00pm, Saturday 21st September 2019._Ev.response: Sheffield United recorded their first away Premier League win of the season as they beat an abject Everton side 2-0 at Goodison Park.
3:00pm, Saturday 21st September 2019._Ev.detail: Marco Silva's side slumped to a third defeat in four league games as Yerry Mina's own goal (40) was followed by a second from Blades substitute Lys Mousset (79).

3:00pm, Saturday 21st September 2019._Ma.news: Manchester City 8-0 Watford: Imperious City record their biggest top-flight victory
3:00pm, Saturday 21st September 2019._Ma.response: Manchester City scored five goals in a devastating opening 18-minute spell as they responded to their shock defeat at Norwich with an 8-0 demolition of Watford on Saturday.
3:00pm, Saturday 21st September 2019._Ma.detail: David Silva opened the scoring with just 52 seconds on the clock before Sergio Aguero put the champions two up from the penalty spot on seven minutes with his 100th Premier League goal at the Etihad Stadium.

5:30pm, Saturday 21st September 2019._Ne.news: Newcastle 0-0 Brighton: Andy Carroll returns but Toon struggles continue
5:30pm, Saturday 21st September 2019._Ne.response: Newcastle and Brighton both lacked the required quality in the final third as they played out an uninspiring goalless draw at St James' Park.
5:30pm, Saturday 21st September 2019._Ne.detail: Graham Potter's side bossed possession, registering 71 per cent, and created the better chances as only a miraculous clearance off the line from Fabian Schar, to deny substitute Aaron Connolly, kept Newcastle in the game.

8:00pm, Friday 20th September 2019._Sout.news: Southampton 1-3 Bournemouth: Visitors beat rivals for first win at St Mary's
8:00pm, Friday 20th September 2019._Sout.response: Bournemouth won at St Mary's for the first time as they beat Southampton 3-1 in the Premier League, sending them into third in the table.
8:00pm, Friday 20th September 2019._Sout.detail: The Cherries had failed to win at their south coast rivals in 15 attempts, but they got off to the perfect start when Nathan Ake headed home inside 10 minutes before Harry Wilson (35) fired the ball home to double their lead.

8:00pm, Monday 16th September 2019._Asto.news: Aston Villa 0-0 West Ham: Hammers survive Arthur Masuaku red card
8:00pm, Monday 16th September 2019._Asto.response: West Ham survived the second-half dismissal of Arthur Masuaku to extend their unbeaten run in the Premier League to three games with a 0-0 draw at Aston Villa on Monday Night Football.
8:00pm, Monday 16th September 2019._Asto.detail: The Hammers had to navigate the final 23 minutes with a man down after referee Mike Dean issued Masuaku with a second yellow for a challenge on Ahmed Elmohamady which did not appear to make contact with the Villa defender.

2:00pm, Sunday 15th September 2019._Bour.news: Bournemouth 3-1 Everton: Callum Wilson punishes terrible Toffees defending
2:00pm, Sunday 15th September 2019._Bour.response: Callum Wilson took advantage of an abysmal defensive performance from Everton to score twice in a 3-1 Premier League home win for Bournemouth on Sunday.
2:00pm, Sunday 15th September 2019._Bour.detail: In a tight affair involving two evenly matched teams it was the Toffees' sticky defending that cost them, firstly allowing Wilson to net (23) after failing to deal with a set-piece. Dominic Calvert-Lewin notched his first goal for 13 games to level it up (44) but a Ryan Fraser free-kick from the left was deflected past Jordan Pickford by Fabian Delph to hand the Cherries the lead (66).

4:30pm, Sunday 15th September 2019._Watf.news: Watford 2-2 Arsenal: Gunners' defensive mistakes prove costly as Watford fight back
4:30pm, Sunday 15th September 2019._Watf.response: Arsenal threw away a 2-0 lead at Watford through defensive errors as Quique Sanchez Flores' side earned a 2-2 draw in the first game of his second spell.
4:30pm, Sunday 15th September 2019._Watf.detail: A typically expert finish from Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang had Arsenal ahead (21) despite Watford's calls for a foul in the build-up, and the Gabon striker made it 2-0 shortly after with a simple finish from a fine Gunners move (32).

12:30pm, Saturday 14th September 2019._L.news: Liverpool 3-1 Newcastle: Sadio Mane's double preserves hosts' 100 per cent start
12:30pm, Saturday 14th September 2019._L.response: Sadio Mane scored twice as Liverpool came from behind to preserve their 100 per cent start to the season with a 3-1 victory over Newcastle at Anfield.
12:30pm, Saturday 14th September 2019._L.detail: Newcastle took a shock early lead through Jetro Willems' powerful strike (7) but Liverpool, who enjoyed 80 per cent possession in the first half, turned things around before half-time with Mane (28, 40) taking his tally for goals in the Premier league this season to four.

3:00pm, Saturday 14th September 2019._Br.news: Brighton 1-1 Burnley: Jeff Hendrick strikes late to deny Seagulls rare home win
3:00pm, Saturday 14th September 2019._Br.response: Jeff Hendrick's stoppage-time strike denied Brighton manager Graham Potter a first Premier League home win as Burnley earned a 1-1 draw at the Amex Stadium.
3:00pm, Saturday 14th September 2019._Br.detail: Neal Maupay looked to have secured all three points for the Seagulls after he volleyed the hosts in front (51) on his 100th appearance in English football.

3:00pm, Saturday 14th September 2019._Ma.news: Man Utd 1-0 Leicester: Marcus Rashford penalty gives United much-needed victory
3:00pm, Saturday 14th September 2019._Ma.response: Marcus Rashford's early penalty gave Manchester United a much-needed 1-0 victory over Leicester City at Old Trafford.
3:00pm, Saturday 14th September 2019._Ma.detail: Having missed two penalties in their first four games, United took the lead through Rashford's spot-kick (8) after Caglar Soyuncu had brought the England man down.

3:00pm, Saturday 14th September 2019._Sh.news: Sheffield United 0-1 Southampton: Moussa Djenepo hits winner for Saints as Blades denied by VAR
3:00pm, Saturday 14th September 2019._Sh.response: Southampton took home all three points with a 1-0 win against Sheffield United in a frantic match with more VAR drama at Bramall Lane.
3:00pm, Saturday 14th September 2019._Sh.detail: The Blades dominated a first half littered with chances as David McGoldrick forced a brilliant save from Angus Gunn, while John Fleck and George Baldock were wasteful with close-range shots.

3:00pm, Saturday 14th September 2019._To.news: Tottenham 4-0 Crystal Palace: Heung-Min Son double sparks Spurs
3:00pm, Saturday 14th September 2019._To.response: Tottenham's season got up and running courtesy of a four-goal first-half blitz against Crystal Palace to run out 4-0 winners.
3:00pm, Saturday 14th September 2019._To.detail: After taking just five points from their opening four games, Mauricio Pochettino's men burst into life with a thumping first-half display where goals from Heung-Min Son (10 & 23), Erik Lamela (42) and a Patrick van Aanholt own goal (21) floored Roy Hodgson's side.

3:00pm, Saturday 14th September 2019._Wo.news: Wolves 2-5 Chelsea: Tammy Abraham hat-trick as Blues stun Molineux
3:00pm, Saturday 14th September 2019._Wo.response: Tammy Abraham scored a wonderful hat-trick as Chelsea beat Wolves 5-2 on Saturday, with Fikayo Tomori also netting his first senior goal for the club.
3:00pm, Saturday 14th September 2019._Wo.detail: It was defender Tomori (31) who got the scoring under way with a sensational long-range curler before Abraham (34, 41) added two more in the first half.

5:30pm, Saturday 14th September 2019._No.news: Norwich 3-2 Man City: Teemu Pukki scores one and makes another in famous victory at Carrow Road
5:30pm, Saturday 14th September 2019._No.response: Teemu Pukki scored one and made another as Norwich inflicted a shock first defeat of the season on Man City, who went down 3-2 at Carrow Road.
5:30pm, Saturday 14th September 2019._No.detail: The setback leaves champions City five points behind Liverpool in the Premier League table.

2:00pm, Sunday 1st September 2019._Evert.news: Everton 3-2 Wolves: Richarlison nets twice to seal Toffees win
2:00pm, Sunday 1st September 2019._Evert.response: Richarlison netted twice for Everton in a topsy-turvy encounter in which Wolves came from behind twice but eventually lost 3-2 to the Toffees on Super Sunday.
2:00pm, Sunday 1st September 2019._Evert.detail: The Brazilian got things rolling early on when punishing a defensive howler from Conor Coady (5), but Romain Saiss fired Wolves level (9) after some tricky work from Adama Traore. In what was a pulsating start to the game, Alex Iwobi - on his full Premier League debut for the Toffees - then headed Everton in front again (12).

4:30pm, Sunday 1st September 2019._Arsen.news: Arsenal 2-2 Tottenham: Gunners fight back for north London derby draw
4:30pm, Sunday 1st September 2019._Arsen.response: Arsenal produced a spirited fightback from two goals down to salvage a 2-2 draw with Tottenham in a pulsating north London derby at the Emirates on Super Sunday,
4:30pm, Sunday 1st September 2019._Arsen.detail: Spurs raced into a two-goal lead inside 40 minutes thanks to Christian Eriksen's 50th Premier League goal and Harry Kane's clinical penalty, awarded after Granit Xhaka's mindless lunge on Heung-min Son in the area.

12:30pm, Saturday 31st August 2019._Sout.news: Southampton 1-1 Man Utd: Jannik Vestergaard cancels out Daniel James strike as Red Devils held
12:30pm, Saturday 31st August 2019._Sout.response: Jannik Vestergaard cancelled out Daniel James' stunning strike as Manchester United were held to a 1-1 draw by 10-man Southampton at St Mary's Stadium.
12:30pm, Saturday 31st August 2019._Sout.detail: James gave the visitors a 10th-minute lead with an unstoppable diagonal drive - the Welshman's third goal in four games for United - but Vestergaard equalised shortly before the hour-mark when he powered home a cross from Kevin Danso, who was then sent off for a second yellow card.

3:00pm, Saturday 31st August 2019._Chels.news: Chelsea 2-2 Sheffield United: Frank Lampard still looking for first home win after Blades comeback
3:00pm, Saturday 31st August 2019._Chels.response: Sheffield United staged a spirited second-half fightback to pick up a deserved 2-2 draw with Chelsea at Stamford Bridge.
3:00pm, Saturday 31st August 2019._Chels.detail: After falling behind to Tammy Abraham's first-half double (19 and 43), the Blades responded with great confidence and character after the break.

3:00pm, Saturday 31st August 2019._Cryst.news: Crystal Palace 1-0 Aston Villa: Jordan Ayew strike beats 10-man visitors
3:00pm, Saturday 31st August 2019._Cryst.response: Jordan Ayew scored in his second successive Premier League game as Crystal Palace beat 10-man Aston Villa 1-0 at Selhurst Park.
3:00pm, Saturday 31st August 2019._Cryst.detail: Aston Villa thought they had scored a last-minute equaliser, but Henri Lansbury's effort was ruled out after Jack Grealish was booked for diving in the build-up.

3:00pm, Saturday 31st August 2019._Leice.news: Leicester 3-1 Bournemouth: Jamie Vardy strikes twice at the King Power Stadium
3:00pm, Saturday 31st August 2019._Leice.response: Leicester City proved too clinical for Bournemouth as Brendan Rodgers' side cruised to a 3-1 win at the King Power Stadium.
3:00pm, Saturday 31st August 2019._Leice.detail: The game kicked off in frenetic fashion with both sides taking turns to counter, but Leicester struck first after Ben Chilwell hit a long ball behind Bournemouth's defence, with Jamie Vardy latching onto it to lob Aaron Ramsdale.

3:00pm, Saturday 31st August 2019._Manch.news: Man City 4-0 Brighton: Sergio Aguero scores twice as champions cruise to win over Seagulls
3:00pm, Saturday 31st August 2019._Manch.response: Manchester City returned to the Premier League summit after Sergio Aguero scored twice in a clinical 4-0 win over Brighton at the Etihad Stadium.
3:00pm, Saturday 31st August 2019._Manch.detail: Kevin De Bruyne gave the hosts the lead after just 68 seconds as he met David Silva's cross to convert from close range.

3:00pm, Saturday 31st August 2019._Newca.news: Newcastle 1-1 Watford: Hornets earn first point of season
3:00pm, Saturday 31st August 2019._Newca.response: Watford earned their first point of the season with a 1-1 draw against Newcastle after an end-to-end contest at St James' Park.
3:00pm, Saturday 31st August 2019._Newca.detail: The Hornets took the lead inside two minutes as Abdoulaye Doucoure's deflected shot found Will Hughes unmarked inside the box, but Newcastle levelled before half-time after Fabian Schar's well-taken finish.

3:00pm, Saturday 31st August 2019._West.news: West Ham 2-0 Norwich: Hammers up to fifth after first home win of season
3:00pm, Saturday 31st August 2019._West.response: West Ham sealed their first home win of the season thanks to a comfortable 2-0 victory over Norwich.
3:00pm, Saturday 31st August 2019._West.detail: Club-record signing Sebastien Haller continued his excellent start to the season for the Hammers, opening the scoring in the 24th minute with his third goal of the season.

5:30pm, Saturday 31st August 2019._Burnl.news: Burnley 0-3 Liverpool: Reds go back top with record-breaking win
5:30pm, Saturday 31st August 2019._Burnl.response: Liverpool moved back to the top of the Premier League table with a dominant 3-0 win over Burnley at Turf Moor – a club-record 13th consecutive league victory.
5:30pm, Saturday 31st August 2019._Burnl.detail: Chris Wood was unfortunate to deflect Trent Alexander-Arnold's cross beyond his own goalkeeper in the 33rd minute and Sadio Mane doubled the lead soon after.

2:00pm, Sunday 25th August 2019._Bournem.news: Bournemouth 1-3 Man City: Sergio Aguero double takes champions up to second
2:00pm, Sunday 25th August 2019._Bournem.response: Two goals from Sergio Aguero and a Raheem Sterling strike eased Manchester City to a 3-1 win at Bournemouth.
2:00pm, Sunday 25th August 2019._Bournem.detail: Aguero opened the scoring in the 14th minute with a cool finish from inside the box before Raheem Sterling doubled City's advantage two minutes before the break after being played in by David Silva.

4:30pm, Sunday 25th August 2019._Tottenh.news: Tottenham 0-1 Newcastle: Joelinton goal gives Steve Bruce shock first win
4:30pm, Sunday 25th August 2019._Tottenh.response: Newcastle got their first points under Steve Bruce as Joelinton's first-half goal gave them a shock 1-0 victory at Tottenham on Super Sunday.
4:30pm, Sunday 25th August 2019._Tottenh.detail: After a summer of discontent, Newcastle got off the mark in the Premier League thanks to some lax Spurs defending, as record signing Joelinton slotted home for his first goal for the club (27).

4:30pm, Sunday 25th August 2019._Wolverh.news: Wolves 1-1 Burnley: Last-gasp penalty earns Wolves point
4:30pm, Sunday 25th August 2019._Wolverh.response: Raul Jimenez's 97th-minute penalty rescued a dramatic point for Wolves in a 1-1 draw at home to Burnley.
4:30pm, Sunday 25th August 2019._Wolverh.detail: Ashley Barnes thundered in a half-volley from 25 yards with 13 minutes on the clock at Molineux on Sunday, and his fourth goal of the season looked set to send Burnley third in the Premier League table.

12:30pm, Saturday 24th August 2019._Norw.news: Norwich City 2-3 Chelsea: Tammy Abraham double hands Frank Lampard first Blues win
12:30pm, Saturday 24th August 2019._Norw.response: Tammy Abraham's double saw Chelsea beat Norwich 3-2 at Carrow Road to hand Frank Lampard his first win in charge of the club.
12:30pm, Saturday 24th August 2019._Norw.detail: It was Chelsea who opened the scoring after just three minutes through Abraham's well-taken goal, only for the hosts to equalise only 156 seconds later as local boy Todd Cantwell side-footed home from close range after some lovely build-up play.

3:00pm, Saturday 24th August 2019._Brigh.news: Brighton 0-2 Southampton: Moussa Djenepo and Nathan Redmond seal first win for Saints
3:00pm, Saturday 24th August 2019._Brigh.response: Nathan Redmond and substitute Moussa Djenepo scored to seal Southampton a 2-0 win at 10-man Brighton, who had a goal ruled out through VAR for the second week running.
3:00pm, Saturday 24th August 2019._Brigh.detail: The 21-year-old Djenepo opened his Saints account in style when brought on after 53 minutes with an excellent right-footed curling strike two minutes later that was too much for Mat Ryan.

3:00pm, Saturday 24th August 2019._Manch.news: Manchester United 1-2 Crystal Palace: David de Gea error costs hosts
3:00pm, Saturday 24th August 2019._Manch.response: Crystal Palace stunned Manchester United with a 2-1 win at Old Trafford thanks to Patrick van Aanholt's injury-time winner.
3:00pm, Saturday 24th August 2019._Manch.detail: Daniel James appeared to have earned United a point with an 89th-minute equaliser.

3:00pm, Saturday 24th August 2019._Sheff.news: Sheffield United 1-2 Leicester: Superb Harvey Barnes strike seals Leicester win
3:00pm, Saturday 24th August 2019._Sheff.response: A superb Harvey Barnes strike sealed Leicester's first Premier League win of the season, beating Sheffield United 2-1 at Bramall Lane.
3:00pm, Saturday 24th August 2019._Sheff.detail: Sheffield-born Jamie Vardy (38) had scored a fine opener in the first half, but it was cancelled out by Oli McBurnie, nodding home his first Premier League goal in the 62nd minute.

3:00pm, Saturday 24th August 2019._Watfo.news: Watford 1-3 West Ham: Sebastien Haller's double gets Hammers off the mark
3:00pm, Saturday 24th August 2019._Watfo.response: Sebastien Haller's first Premier League goals helped West Ham to a 3-1 win over Watford at Vicarage Road.
3:00pm, Saturday 24th August 2019._Watfo.detail: The Hornets shot themselves in the foot inside two minutes when Abdoulaye Doucoure caught Manuel Lanzini in the box, and Mark Noble stepped up to slot home from the spot on his 350th Premier League appearance.

5:30pm, Saturday 24th August 2019._Liver.news: Liverpool 3-1 Arsenal: Mohamed Salah's double maintains Reds' 100 per cent record at the top
5:30pm, Saturday 24th August 2019._Liver.response: Liverpool maintained their perfect start to the Premier League season and moved three points clear at the top of the table with a 3-1 win over Arsenal at Anfield.
5:30pm, Saturday 24th August 2019._Liver.detail: Joel Matip's header late in the first half gave the home side the lead before Mohamed Salah took the game away from the Gunners with two goals early in the second period.

8:00pm, Friday 23rd August 2019._Aston V.news: Aston Villa 2-0 Everton: Wesley and Anwar El Ghazi goals secure first win for Villa
8:00pm, Friday 23rd August 2019._Aston V.response: Aston Villa gained their first win back in the Premier League as goals from Wesley and Anwar El Ghazi secured a 2-0 victory over Everton on Friday Night Football.
8:00pm, Friday 23rd August 2019._Aston V.detail: Wesley, a club-record £22million signing from Club Brugge in the summer, easily found space inside the Everton box to calmly slot his first Villa goal (21) against the run of play.

8:00pm, Monday 19th August 2019._Wolverh.news: Wolves 1-1 Manchester United: Paul Pogba sees penalty saved in draw
8:00pm, Monday 19th August 2019._Wolverh.response: Paul Pogba saw a penalty saved as Manchester United were held to a 1-1 draw by Wolves on Monday Night Football.
8:00pm, Monday 19th August 2019._Wolverh.detail: Anthony Martial scored for the second game in a row to put United ahead in the 27th minute, but Ruben Neves levelled with a brilliant curling strike from outside the box shortly after half time.

2:00pm, Sunday 18th August 2019._Sheffie.news: Sheff Utd 1-0 Crystal Palace: John Lundstram gives Blades first Premier League win
2:00pm, Sunday 18th August 2019._Sheffie.response: John Lundstram's goal gave Sheffield United their first Premier League win since 2007 by beating Crystal Palace 1-0 at Bramall Lane.
2:00pm, Sunday 18th August 2019._Sheffie.detail: Lundstram scored three minutes into the second half, turning home the rebound from Luke Freeman's shot after Vincent Guaita had palmed it into his path.

4:30pm, Sunday 18th August 2019._Chelsea.news: Chelsea 1-1 Leicester: Wilfred Ndidi's fine header denies Frank Lampard win in first home game
4:30pm, Sunday 18th August 2019._Chelsea.response: Frank Lampard remains winless as Chelsea head coach after being held to a 1-1 draw by Leicester at Stamford Bridge on Super Sunday.
4:30pm, Sunday 18th August 2019._Chelsea.detail: Chelsea's energetic start brought a goal as Wilfred Ndidi's error allowed Mason Mount to tuck home his first goal for Chelsea (7), but Ndidi made up for it in the second half with a towering header from a James Maddison corner (67).

12:30pm, Saturday 17th August 2019._Arse.news: Arsenal 2-1 Burnley: Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang scores winner
12:30pm, Saturday 17th August 2019._Arse.response: Arsenal made it two wins from two matches to start the Premier League season as Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang's goal secured a hard-fought 2-1 victory over Burnley.
12:30pm, Saturday 17th August 2019._Arse.detail: Alexandre Lacazette's early opener was cancelled out by Ashley Barnes in the 43rd minute as Burnley's direct approach caused Arsenal problems.

3:00pm, Saturday 17th August 2019._Aston.news: Aston Villa 1-2 Bournemouth: Josh King and Harry Wilson score early as Villa lose again
3:00pm, Saturday 17th August 2019._Aston.response: Aston Villa were condemned to a second straight defeat on their return to the Premier League as Bournemouth won 2-1 at Villa Park on Saturday afternoon.
3:00pm, Saturday 17th August 2019._Aston.detail: Villa endured a nightmare start to their first top-flight home game since May 2016 as Tom Heaton tripped Callum Wilson after just 41 seconds with Josh King slotting home the resulting penalty.

3:00pm, Saturday 17th August 2019._Brigh.news: Brighton 1-1 West Ham: Leandro Trossard cancels out Javier Hernandez's opener
3:00pm, Saturday 17th August 2019._Brigh.response: Brighton rued several missed opportunities and a disallowed goal by VAR as they were held to an entertaining 1-1 draw by West Ham.
3:00pm, Saturday 17th August 2019._Brigh.detail: The points were shared after two goals in four second-half minutes.

3:00pm, Saturday 17th August 2019._Evert.news: Everton 1-0 Watford: Bernard first-half strike fires hosts to first win of the season
3:00pm, Saturday 17th August 2019._Evert.response: Bernard's first Premier League goal of the season helped Everton edge a 1-0 win over Watford in a tight contest at Goodison Park.
3:00pm, Saturday 17th August 2019._Evert.detail: The Brazilian's deflected strike into the bottom corner in the first half (10) proved the difference in the swirling conditions on Merseyside, but the visitors came close when Craig Dawson's header hit the woodwork midway through the first half.

3:00pm, Saturday 17th August 2019._Norwi.news: Norwich 3-1 Newcastle: Teemu Pukki hat-trick seals first win of the season
3:00pm, Saturday 17th August 2019._Norwi.response: A wonderful Teemu Pukki hat-trick sealed Norwich's first win back in the Premier League as they beat Newcastle 3-1 at Carrow Road.
3:00pm, Saturday 17th August 2019._Norwi.detail: After a few chances at either end, Pukki got his first goal just after the half-hour mark (32), producing a sensational volley with his first touch.

3:00pm, Saturday 17th August 2019._South.news: Southampton 1-2 Liverpool: Danny Ings' late goal from Adrian howler not enough as Reds win
3:00pm, Saturday 17th August 2019._South.response: Sadio Mane and Roberto Firmino's goals gave Liverpool a 2-1 win at Southampton despite a late scare from the hosts.
3:00pm, Saturday 17th August 2019._South.detail: A Liverpool performance which had started so poorly on the south coast still held a half-time lead thanks to Mane's curling strike just before the break, and they marked a much-improved second half with a smart finish from Firmino (71).

5:30pm, Saturday 17th August 2019._Manch.news: Man City 2-2 Tottenham: Spurs end champions' winning run after more late VAR drama
5:30pm, Saturday 17th August 2019._Manch.response: Substitute Gabriel Jesus had an injury-time goal ruled out by VAR as Tottenham left Manchester City with a 2-2 draw, scoring with their only two shots on target.
5:30pm, Saturday 17th August 2019._Manch.detail: Jesus looked to have extended City's winning Premier League run to 16 games with an effort on the stretch, but a handball in the lead up by Aymeric Laporte meant Spurs benefited from VAR again, just four months after their historic Champions League quarter-final at the Etihad.

2:00pm, Sunday 11th August 2019._Leicest.news: Leicester 0-0 Wolves: Leander Dendoncker goal ruled out by VAR in goalless draw
2:00pm, Sunday 11th August 2019._Leicest.response: Leander Dendoncker saw the only goal of the game ruled out by VAR as Wolves held Leicester to a 0-0 draw in the Premier League on Sunday.
2:00pm, Sunday 11th August 2019._Leicest.detail: Dendoncker bundled in Joao Moutinho's corner six minutes into the second half but VAR official Jon Moss overturned the decision after spotting it had struck Willy Boly's arm in the build-up.

2:00pm, Sunday 11th August 2019._Newcast.news: Newcastle 0-1 Arsenal: Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang strike hands Gunners winning start
2:00pm, Sunday 11th August 2019._Newcast.response: Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang scored the only goal of the game as Arsenal made a winning start to the Premier League campaign with a 1-0 victory at Newcastle on Sunday.
2:00pm, Sunday 11th August 2019._Newcast.detail: The 30-year-old, who shared the Golden Boot last season with Liverpool duo Mohamed Salah and Sadio Mane, opened his account for 2019/20 in the 58th minute, bringing down Ainsley Maitland-Niles' cross before lifting the ball over Martin Dubravka.

4:30pm, Sunday 11th August 2019._Manches.news: Manchester United 4-0 Chelsea: Frank Lampard thrashed on PL managerial debut
4:30pm, Sunday 11th August 2019._Manches.response: Manchester United inflicted a harsh lesson on Frank Lampard in his first Premier League assignment as Chelsea head coach with a 4-0 victory at Old Trafford on Renault Super Sunday.
4:30pm, Sunday 11th August 2019._Manches.detail: Marcus Rashford opened United's account from the penalty spot on 18 minutes, but Chelsea struck the woodwork twice through Tammy Abraham and Emerson Palmieri before the end of a promising first half.

12:30pm, Saturday 10th August 2019._West.news: West Ham 0-5 Man City: Raheem Sterling scores hat-trick as VAR has first Premier League impact
12:30pm, Saturday 10th August 2019._West.response: Raheem Sterling scored a hat-trick as Manchester City got their title defence up and running in style with a 5-0 win at West Ham, in a game where VAR made its first impact in the Premier League.
12:30pm, Saturday 10th August 2019._West.detail: City's new No 9 Gabriel Jesus showed deadly instinct to open the scoring with a near-post touch from Kyle Walker's fine work down the right (25), and the champions were 2-0 up shortly after half-time through Sterling's tidy finish (51).

3:00pm, Saturday 10th August 2019._Bourn.news: Bournemouth 1-1 Sheffield United: Billy Sharp bundles home late on to rescue opening-day point
3:00pm, Saturday 10th August 2019._Bourn.response: Billy Sharp's late equaliser ensured Sheffield United's Premier League return began unbeaten with a 1-1 draw at Bournemouth.
3:00pm, Saturday 10th August 2019._Bourn.detail: Sharp showcased his predatory instinct off the bench to bundle home from a free-kick, netting his first Premier League goal at the age of 33, inside the last two minutes of a game from which the Blades had deserved at least a point.

3:00pm, Saturday 10th August 2019._Burnl.news: Burnley 3-0 Southampton: Ashley Barnes double hands hosts opening weekend win
3:00pm, Saturday 10th August 2019._Burnl.response: A second-half double from Ashley Barnes helped Burnley to a comfortable 3-0 win against Southampton in their opening game of the Premier League season.
3:00pm, Saturday 10th August 2019._Burnl.detail: After a goalless first half, all of Burnley's strikes came within 11 minutes and Barnes nabbed the first two. His first (63) came after an error from Jannik Vestergaard allowed him through, and he followed it up with an impressive tap in for the second (70).

3:00pm, Saturday 10th August 2019._Cryst.news: Crystal Palace 0-0 Everton: Morgan Schneiderlin sees red in stalemate
3:00pm, Saturday 10th August 2019._Cryst.response: Morgan Schneiderlin was sent off as Crystal Palace were held to a 0-0 draw by Everton at Selhurst Park in the Premier League on Saturday.
3:00pm, Saturday 10th August 2019._Cryst.detail: Gylfi Sigurdsson and Seamus Coleman both wasted good first-half chances for the visitors before Jordan Pickford made two smart saves to deny Jordan Ayew and Max Meyer in the second period.

3:00pm, Saturday 10th August 2019._Watfo.news: Watford 0-3 Brighton: Graham Potter makes instant impact with Seagulls
3:00pm, Saturday 10th August 2019._Watfo.response: Graham Potter made an instant impact at Brighton as he oversaw a 3-0 victory over Watford in his first game in charge.
3:00pm, Saturday 10th August 2019._Watfo.detail: Playing a more progressive and attack-minded system than his predecessor Chris Hughton, Potter's side were handed a first-half lead by an Abdoulaye Doucoure own goal (28).

5:30pm, Saturday 10th August 2019._Totte.news: Tottenham 3-1 Aston Villa: Harry Kane's late double secures Spurs win
5:30pm, Saturday 10th August 2019._Totte.response: Harry Kane scored two late goals to ensure Tottenham avoided an opening-day upset as they won 3-1 against Aston Villa.
5:30pm, Saturday 10th August 2019._Totte.detail: Newly-promoted Villa took a shock lead in the ninth minute when John McGinn finished past Hugo Lloris.

8:00pm, Friday 9th August 2019._Liverpoo.news: Liverpool 4-1 Norwich: Reds thrash Canaries in Premier League opener
8:00pm, Friday 9th August 2019._Liverpoo.response: Liverpool raised the curtain on the new Premier League season with a 4-1 thrashing of newly-promoted Norwich at Anfield on Friday Night Football.
8:00pm, Friday 9th August 2019._Liverpoo.detail: The European champions, who missed out on the title last season by a single point, rarely got out of second gear, racing into a four-goal lead at the break courtesy of strikes from Mohamed Salah, Virgil van Dijk, Divock Origi and a Grant Hanley own goal.
